text: Freddy was extremely helpful !! We needed help with  locating our friend who wasn’t answering their phone. He called the room for us and let us up to go wake them up. Freddy was very personable and understanding of our situation! 5 star service!

title: Wonderful Customer Service!
text: Stayed at the Ace Hotel for a few days in September, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Jesus at the front desk went above and beyond to accommodate me and ensure that the check in process went as smooth as possible. Rooms were very clean and the entire hotel has a great vibe and atmosphere. Next time I am in NY, I will definitely stay at the Ace Hotel!

title: Amazing Hotel!
text:
Stayed a week at the Ace with my husband and absolutely loved it. The staff were amazing, easy check in and they were very accommodating with our check out time! The room was huge! Having stayed in NY before this room was by far the coolest and biggest I’ve ever seen. 
Great location!

title: Great place
text: Receptionist was super helpful wish I got the names of the lady and gentlemen working in the afternoon on 9/29...they steered me in the direction of the miniroom which didn't disappoint.  Room was clean and just right for a solo traveler.  I will definitely stay here again.  Bar was poppin if you are into that sort of thing.

title: A little slice of heaven in the big apple (my new home away from home)!
text:
I had a phenomenal stay at the Ace Hotel! The incredible quality and cleanliness of the hotel was only eclipsed by the world class service of the staff. I was amazed by how each of them went out of their way to attend to my every need and proactively give me recommendations to make my New York trip unforgettable. Shout out to David, who gave a masterclass on hospitality from the moment we stepped into the hotel. In a city flooded with commoditized options, this hotel experience was a hidden gem that was truly unique! I would definitely recommend this place to all of my friends and with certainty be back for my next stay. I only wish they had more locations around the US! 

Jordan

title: Clean Safe Fun everything you need is in the room
text: 2nd time staying and still Love the hotel. The Front Desk Staff is always so happy to see you. Even at 6:30am HA! Lots of lights in the rooms on dimmer so you make as bright or dim as you want. Not a loud hotel I slept pretty good for a light sleeper. They will try to achieve whatever you ask for. I have never been disappointed yet. The towels are large and thick and love the great smells of the bath products. Sheets white crisp and new makes for a great night sleep. AC worked great and cooled the room down fast. This is my go too hotel now.

title: Great hotel, amazing staff, wonderful location !
text: Front desk staff Fred was absolutely kind from the very first moment I checked in to the moment I checked out ! This was my first time visiting NY ! I highly recommend the Ace Hotel ! I will be back !!

title: Ace hotel is the coolest hotel in NYC with kind people  (especially Freddy)
text:
Freddy offered a great experience during my short stay here! I was a regular at the Ace hotel in Shoreditch and found myself in need of wifi after having a train delay. He was able to find me a quiet space and hook me up to wifi so I could make a virtual presentation. What a kind person! 
Super cool vibe.
Will be back for cocktails!

title: Great service and location
text:
I stayed at the Ace for work for around two weeks. Steffi and the team at the Ace hotel were all very friendly and welcoming. Steffi in particular went out of her way to find a solution for the credit card issues I encountered.
The bar is quite nice and they make a good coffee too. The location is perfect, with some good food and drink options around.

title: Extended stay
text: The staff made a huge difference during a planned two-week stay that turned into one month.  It's not typical that I would spend this much time in a hotel, but after some sudden life changes, I needed a room for an extended period, and the staff went out of their way to accommodate my needs.  Shout out to Freddy and Jesus who were beyond generous with their time and attentiveness.  I felt like I could count on them for anything. See you guys soon!

title: don’t know what you mean “title”????
text:
great place/vibe/ location 
Ace people welcoming / helpful 
Rooms unique/ lobby nice place to hang out/grab a bite to eat/ good foid/,so will be back/ have stayed before many times & always recommend to friends

title: Great service, hipster hotel
text:
I stayed at the Ace on a work trip during a very busy time in New York. I was pleasantly surprised by the amazing service.  I was concerned about my room size but Freddy hooked it up!  He took the time to walk me to several different rooms and I eventually ended up upgrading for a reasonable $$$.  I was so touched he took the time and patience to show me all the rooms and even called me afterward to make sure I was having a great stay.  People make all the difference!!  

The hotel is also in a great location and has a chic bar.  I loved the record player too.

title: Shout out to the Staff that make it happen
text:
Have been staying here since 2012 almost monthly when I visit the  office. 

The staff try really hard from the engineering staff fixing tv and heating issues, the team helping with luggage, the cleaning crew  to when they used to have room service team.

While over the years staff and the place has changed, one constant has been Kimani on the front desk. When Kimani is around things go so smoothly, he ensures preferences are met and he makes sure that I am very much looked after. He is probably one of the number one reasons I have not changed hotels even though my office has changed locations. Thanks Kimani for all you do!

title: Great experience with stunning view over Empire State
text: I spent one week in NYC and I stayed at Ace. It is an excellent hotel, very clean rooms, perhaps it might need a bit of update but the cleanliness is Top, the beds are very comfortable and hotel stuff very welcoming and nice, front desk very familiar and very kind. The lobby of the hotel is very nice with a lovely atmosphere, definitely a place to come back.

title: great hotel with a great vibe, in the center of Manhattan
text:
I was on a holiday trip to NY, for one week, with my daughter, to celebrate a personal event. Our stay at ACE hotel was just perfect. starting from the very good central positioning, at walking distance from the main spots (Times square,Broadway,  Empire state building..etc..); the hotel is very clean, modern, with a nice lobby where you can have cocktails or a coffee and very friendly stuff.
Definitely an excellent place to stay if you want to visit Manhattan.

title: Best NYC Hotel ever!
text: Phenomenal hotel right in the heart of NYC!  Absolutely loved the eclectic theme of the hotel rooms and the incredible atmosphere of the bar and lounge!  Great location and incredibly friendly staff.  Highly recommend!!

title: Great service from check in
text: I checked in the hotel and received such amazing customer service from a gentleman named Freddy. Freddy was knowledgeable about the hotel as well shared information about attractions and etc near by. This made me feel comfortable and I will be visiting again in the future.

title: Perfect location for MSG and everything else
text: We picked Ace Hotel New York based on it's location to MSG as well as being near places to eat & drink. The staff that worked the week we were there were the most cheerful and genuinely helpful group of beautiful men. Every time our paths crossed we were greeted with a smile and a hello. We felt very welcomed and appreciated everything they did to make are stay as comfortable as possible. When we expressed our room had some issues, they immediately offered to switch our room - no questions asked. The lounge was a wonderful place to hang out for a morning coffee as well as for a night cap at the bar. Having it be walking distance to MSG was the icing on the cake. I couldn't ask for a better experience.

title: Another Amazing Stay At The Ace Hotel
text:
I always come and stay at the ACE when im in NYC. This time I was here for my Fiancés  birthday. The front desk staff and Rudy were phenomenal with setting up special treats inside the room before we got there! I couldn't have asked for a better group of staff members. I'll always stay here when I come to NYC, if I could give 10 stars I would!

PJG

title: Wedding in NYC
text: It was my first ever trip to NYC and I am not a city guy but I have had one of the most memorable trips ever and I want to come back and stay at the ACE soon. I will also recommend this hotel to my friends and co workers as a “must stay” destination for future trips to NYC! The staff were courteous and friendly and the accommodations were absolutely comfortable and fun. Thank you for making my first trip to New York so enjoyable!

title: Amazing stay!
text:
Recently stayed at the Ace New York for a staycation. The Medium King was a great sized room and extremely comfortable. The overall industrial/artsy decor of the the whole property and its rooms were enjoyable. The hotel is also situated right by K-Town near a lot of great bars - will definitely be returning!
Also, the chicken tenders and hummus are great food options downstairs at the Lobby!

title: Incredible Experience
text: My wife and I traveled to NYC to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and booked a stay at the Ace to be near to our youngest daughter studying fashion at FIT.  The staff was so lovely and the woman who checked us in upgraded us to a suite for our anniversary!  Her name was Cody.  We had a wonderful experience staying at the hotel and would definitely come back. Everyone at the front desk was so helpful and accommodating to our needs. They gave great recommendations for restaurants in the area. You definitely need to stop by the lobby bar and grab the espresso martini, it was delicious. Maria at the bar was just lovely. We would come back again! -- Ted

title: Amazing
text:
I stayed at Ace Hotel New York with my husband for one night to meet up with my son.  From the moment we arrived I loved the amazing historic hotel, the decor, our room had a comfortable bed and a beautiful view. Staff were friendly and helpful when you needed.  lobby is great place to grab a drink and sit before  or after enjoying  some of NYC. 
Parking was a few feet down from hotel which was awesome for us. We didn’t have to walk that far. 
We really loved our stay here and we’ll stay again on our next NYC trip.

title: 3 week stay
text: Stayed at the ace hotel for three weeks and it was very pleasant.   I enjoyed the room and the bed was very comfortable.  Enjoyed the lobby bar.  Had great experience with the staff.  Everyone was friendly and in particular the hotel concierge Freddie was amazing, he helped me on multiple occasions and offered great advice about New York City. Will definitely stay here again.

title: Good hotel, terrific service
text:
My partner and I showed up at the Ace, hot and sweaty and tired after a long plane ride, and found out our reservation had been cancelled. 

This was NOT the hotel's fault; it was the fault of my credit card company (I was using points for the trip, and a month after I booked the stay, US Bank notified the hotel that my reservation was cancelled, for reasons that are still mysterious to me). At first the front desk staff seemed unsure what to do, but Freddy at the front desk quickly stepped in to fix it--assuring us that they could still give us a room, and that they would work out the payment with US Bank. Freddy is a champ.

The hotel itself is in a great location, literally just a block from a subway stop, in an old building full of character. Our room (medium king) was good-sized for New York, and really well laid-out. Extra points for the good strong water pressure to wake you up in the morning. The lobby buzzed all through the day in a way that was stimulating to walk into; the young woman at the coffee bar makes a good strong latte in the morning; and the gym's not bad.

I don't come to New York often. But I'd definitely stay at the Ace again.

title: Relaxing stay in the heart of it all
text:
What an amazing hotel in a historic building centrally located in Manhattan with such kind and thoughtful staff. I appreciated the attention to detail that preserves the historical feel of the building - even down to lighting throughout. We managed to get a suite with a fantastic view of the Empire State Building that was just wonderful. The bed was super comfortable and powerful shower made for a spa like experience.

The lobby is a great place to hang and grab a drink after a long day of walking. Having Stumptown and Blackseed in the building made for easy starts to the morning. 

Overall we loved our stay at The Ace and will definitely stay again on our next NYC trip!

title: I cannot say enough good things about this place… but let me try!
text:
1. The location is perfect. There’s so much to do just a short walk from the front doors and the subway is easily accessible as well.

2. The lobby is a stunner. Chill vibes are conveyed through dimmed lighting, a great soundtrack, wonderful bar staff, and some great art. The seating is really comfortable and well spaced to make you feel like you have your own private area even though there’s usually lots of people around.

3. The rooms are well appointed.  The beds are really comfortable, just the right balance between firm and soft. The showers have tons of pressure and get really hot if you want. AC works well. We had a record player in our room with a great selection of vinyl that was fun to play while we were getting ready for a night out.

4. The thing that really makes this place special is the staff. Everyone is so friendly!  We called down to the front desk a few times to get recommendations on where to go for dinner or drinks and they seemed very enthusiastic about telling us about their favorite spots. Every time we saw a staff member in the hallway they said hello and asked us how our stay and day were going. There were a few times where we left our room for 30 minutes or so and by the time we came back our room was already cleaned!

I will be staying here from now on when I visit NYC and you should too!

title: Making a honeymoon more memorable!
text: Rudy the front desk manager was extremely kind and helpful. All details were covered — ensuring  flowers ordered were  delivered promptly and  champagne  waiting on ice  for  the happy newlyweds upon check in!  A caring staff that goes the extra mile makes all the difference  when staying in a hotel and especially important when it is a special occasion!  Bravo to the staff at the Ace Hotel in New York for exceptional service and for caring. I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Beautiful lobby... don't go upstairs!
text:
As a former New Yorker back in town for a visit I decided to give the Ace Hotel a try because I am absolutely obsessed with the Ace Hotel in Palm Springs --- this was a mistake. Despite a premium price tag (above simply a Manhattan premium) this hotel was anything but luxury. 

The lobby has all the charm I expected and beautiful decor and vibes but everything was disappointing upstairs. I understand the limitations of old NY buildings but they need to do more here with their refab. The elevators are painfully slow; the hallways upstairs are as hot as a sauna and then the room ... 

- despite setting the A/C as low as it could go it was never even cool in the room
- The bed was fine but the headboard is some form of pillow that does not stay in place so you cant lean against it and the bottom fitted sheets did not stay on the mattress so was constantly having to recover the exposed yellow-stained mattress
- the decor is minimalist which is the Ace's vibes but it was very bare and depressing here and the carpets felt like they havent been cleaned in years
- the bathroom is tiny, fine, but the bathroom was scuffed up like an old rental and to sit on the toilet I had to have one foot in the shower. Water pressure was weak and the tub was tiny with a curtain that you kept stepping on and water splashing everywhere.

At least the Wi-Fi worked enough to stream and close to subways, Black Seed and Milk Bar. But also...no bodegas or pharmacies within a 2 block radius so have to walk a bit far to stock up on water or snacks.

title: Awesome experience!
text:
Such a unique hotel! Freddy from the front desk is the best, super friendly!

I will definitely be back to this hotel. I asked for a good view and I got it! Thank you! Close to so many places I wanted to visit! I enjoyed staying  in this hotel! 5 stars

title: Better than most
text: In this price point, Ace is the best. On our past trip we were actually going  to stay in Soho, but upon arrival at the hotel, the rooms were so tiny and claustrophobic we decided to go back to Ace, which is in a better location if you plan on being all over the city. Kind of centrally located, easy to head uptown, downtown, to the east or west side. Rooms give you enough room to breath, unlike aforementioned Soho boutique hotels. Comfortable bathrooms. Great staff and service.

title: Freddy at the Ace
text: The rooms were clean, very comfortable, and the staff at the Ace Hotel were amazing. Freddy in particular provided exceptional service. He went above and beyond to help make my stay enjoyable. He was extremely knowledgeable about the area and recommended places to eat (I’m a foodie so this was a big plus). His service was exceptional and every time I saw him in the lobby he was upbeat, smiling, and eager to help in anyway possible. Thanks to his delightful personality and top notch service, I would definitely recommend the Ace to my colleagues.

title: Great staff at the Ace hotel!
text: I stayed two nights at the Ace hotel and was very pleased.My ac was broken in the first room and Osage,the desk attendent, cheerfullychanged me to a lovely room. The hotel was very clean. The location was walkable to everyplace I wanted to go.

title: Great for family getaway
text: Perfect location - chill vibe - cool for anyone traveling but it’s also cool for for families. Staff is amazing and loved being in the lounge with a cocktail. My son had a great time and loved the hotel room.

title: Great location for large groups!
text: Our team came to NY for a teambuilding retreat, and had a wonderful experience at the Ace. The team loved their rooms, and we used a Loft Suite as a meeting space for our team, and it could not have been better suited. Rudy, and the rest of the staff were incredibly helpful and hospitable at every turn - would definitely return!

title: Great stay for business trip!
text:
I have been staying at the Ace in Manhattan whenever I come to NYC for over ten years now.  The hotel is super cool, the staff is so friendly and super helpful with anything I need.  The rooms are spotless and very comfortable and quiet.
My latest stay was amazing and Freddy at the front desk went out of his way to help me with a few things I needed.  He was so gracious and helpful, I was very impressed!  Highly recommend the Ace in Manhattan for your business or personal trip to NYC!!!

title: Friendly, warm service
text:
We stayed at the Ace in Manhattan on what felt like one of the hottest weekends of the summer. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, we were met with warm and friendly service, a rarity I've found at some of Manhattan's more premium boutique hotels. This is one of the main reasons this stay was so memorable to me. 
Anticipating leaving our luggage with front desk when we arrived, we were accommodated with an early check-in (we arrived around 1 PM) which allowed us a lovely space of time to decompress and freshen up after our travel. 
We did not engage with the staff that often during the duration of our stay as we were quite out and about, but all of our interactions were pleasing. From a location perspective, I absolutely loved having Stumptown Coffee Roasters attached to the lobby, and open early (we for some reason couldn't sleep past 7AM). I'm also a huge fan of Milk Bar, which is also attached to the hotel on the corner of Broadway and 29th. 
The lobby is incredibly chic and loved the old-fashioned photo booth. We didn't have a chance to try the food or drink but the menu looked lovely. 
Our room was spacious and clean upon arrival, and the housekeeping service kept the premises in great shape throughout our stay.
We will definitely be back to the Ace, most notably for the warm service but also for the chic locale and atmosphere.

title: Wicked awesome upgrade!
text: Wow! Our minds were blown when we entered our gigantic loft suite with spectacular view! Thank you so much for the upgrade! We had a blast and everything was perfect! Hotel was centrally located and close to all the things we wanted to do during our stay. Such a cool joint!

title: CLEEEEEAN, fun, great vibe
text: Just had a "moms' getaway" with my girlfriend at the Ace Hotel - 10 out of 10 recommend. Everything was amazing - comfy bed, super clean room, and great vibe in the lobby bar - oh and a happy hour, which was a nice surprise because we figured that wouldn't be a thing here. but it was, and it was amazing. location could not be better either. thanks Ace for a fabulous and much needed getaway for this tired working mom!!!!

title: Great hotel and staff! Great lobby to have cocktails.
text: Staff was friendly and helpful.  Rudy was awesome at the front desk. The room was clean, spacious, great décor, and had a great vibe. The lobby bar was fun. The gym was clean and had a lot of nice equipment. Good location. I will come back and would recommend!

title: Will definitely be using the Ace Hotel whenever I'm in NYC!
text: My experience at the Ace Hotel in Lower Manhattan was just about perfect! Kamani at the front desk was a lifesaver and literally had answers for all our questions! Let us know what the best spots around town were, and was super patient as we dealt with payment issues in the beginning of our booking. Glad it all worked out and we were able to remain at the Ace Hotel! Julio P was a superstar with just about everything, from helping us to our rooms to even gifting us complimentary vouchers for the bar! And speak of the bar, the setting in the lobby/bar area is super relaxing and sociable. The location is superb as well, with so many bars, restaurants, shopping locations and more! The staff really made us feel at home! Will be giving the Ace Hotel in NYC my business consistently!

title: Historic Hotel
text: What a fun and historic hotel! On the night of my proposal I stayed here and it was perfect. The room was clean and beautiful and the staff was so friendly. Highly recommend! I cannot wait to come back.

title: Great hotel, great Staff, great Vibe
text:
We really liked Ace Hotel New York.

We loved the vibe, the location, the big fridge, the lobby, the coffee shop and the room.

But most of all we loved the staff. Super cool, super friendly and totally pro in a very laid back kind of way- just the way we like it.

I would definitely recommend and I will definitely stay there the next time I’m in NYC.

title: We love Ace Hotel!
text: I stayed at Ace Hotel for two nights with my husband and two kids. From the moment we arrived, the kids loved everything about it, especially the vintage photo booth, the decor, and the little sayings printed everywhere. The location is great and we walked to Times Square and Greenwich. Very comfortable beds and love the bathroom amenities. With the Milk bar and cafe on either side, we had everything we needed for a lovely stay in the city. Will definitely stay here again!

title: Great Stay !
text: Great stay at the Ace hotel, the room was very comfortable and the staff close to their customers. The rooms are well decorated, comfortable, cleaned everyday, and if you are lucky, you'll have a view to the Empire State Building

title: Comfortable stay in NYC flatiron district
text: The music-themed rooms make for an original and different atmosphere in this hotel. Room and bathroom were quite spacious compared to other hotels in NYC. The location is optimal, right in the flatiron district.

title: Great hotel service!
text: This is a really nice hotel ! The rooms are well decorated, comfortable, cleaned everyday, and if you are lucky, you'll have a view to the Empire State Building. People working at the hotel are super nice, helpful and reactive if you need anything. We had a little problem with AC and they came strait away and fixed it. You can work from the lounge space of the hotel, really convenient.

title: Great stay !
text: Great stay at the Ace hotel, the room was very comfortable and the staff close to their customers. Loved the experience, very well located in the City and easy to move around for business meetings. Would highly recommend

title: Great Staff and Experience
text: In the heart of Midtown, central to Broadway and Madison Park, this was such a wonderful New York experience. I have stayed in other Ace Hotels, and this one was just as expected. Super friendly doormen arranged cabs and stored my bags, the hip staff was also welcoming and kind. The lobby is lively all day, and becomes your home base while you're there. I'd get coffee from Stumptown early in the morning and send some emails. Then hang out again at Happy Hour with some fries and cocktails, and maybe then a nightcap on the way back to the hotel room. The rooms are all different and cool, art and vintage pieces define your room. I cannot recommend this hotel more: great staff, great location, great lobby space.

title: Amazing service, beautiful room, great vibes
text: We had an amazing weekend staying at the Ace Hotel ! The service was exceptional, the director David, was very kind and helped us with anything we needed. The lobby is a great vibe to either work during the day or grab a quick cocktail before dinner. The room was beyond expectations, will definitely go back !!

title: Great Drink at Ace Hotel New York
text: While I didn't stay at Ace Hotel, I stopped in for a drink this past weekend. The lobby was packed but in a good way. There were tons of seating options with a lot of people hanging out having a good time. The bar was easy to approach and our bartender was nothing but courteous and made a great martini. After having a drink here I am intrigued with the hotel and would very much consider staying here. Thanks Ace!

title: Amazing place…
text: Our stay at  Ace hotel was amazing. From the friendly reception, very unique and modern decor and very clean room. We really enjoyed our stay and we will be back.Hotel is in a very convenient  place close to every attraction in the central area we highly recommend your stay.

title: Coolest hotel in NY
text: I went to NY for the weekend and stayed at the Ace Hotel. It was beyond my expectations, such cool vibes and great location. David was so helpful and nice, I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends!  The lobby was both a relaxing cafe shop during the day and funky bar at night.

title: LITTLE GEM 💎  IN NYC
text:
Visited Ace Hotel for a 1 week vacation in NYC with family,  hotel is centrally located in a Area that is close to everything. Great hotel ambience, great staff and super friendly. 

Hotel lobby is just an amazing place to socialize always vibrant with people working and having fun at same time. Great coffee house that made my life easier in the mornings.

Room was great size, beds are comfy and access was great.

Would definitely return.

title: Good midtown location and good for price
text: Small dark room but decent and clean. It was  good for the price. Great bar on ground floor and coffee shop out front. Stayed for 2 nights and would have preferred something brighter. I also stayed in Chelsea and loved the Gansevoort hotel there.

title: My go-to hotel in New York
text:
Nice rooms, convenient location with friendly and helpful staff.
The loft suites are really quite large, with quirky touches, my last room had a guitar, Smeg fridge, an enormous sofa, and a table that could have hosted a dinner party!

Great location, walkable to central park, or down to Greenwich Village.

The staff are happy to hold bags on checkout day if one's flight isn't until later in the day.

I was recommended this years ago by a friend who lived in NY, it's now where I always stay when visiting.

title: Perfect location and super clean
text: We stayed at ACE NYC for our New York trip with family, we booked 2 LGDD and loved the view of empire building from the room. Room was cleaned every day with fresh towels and linen. Both rooms were very spacious with Smeg fridge, comfortable beds and Martin guitar which we played for our kids. Loved the lively lobby bar with coffee shop attached.  Staff were very friendly that make our checkin and checkout both so easy. It was my first time in NYC and it was fun and I think ACE Hotel added the most to make our trip fun and comfortable with 3 kids.

title: NYC
text: Very Clean and comfy rooms. Loved their shampoo, conditioner and body wash. Everyone was super sweet and friendly. Great location as well for someone who wasn’t familiar with the city. It’s perfect hotel if you want to stay in NYC.

title: Loved our stay at the ACE!
text: From check-in to check-out we had a wonderful experience.  Staff was great, the location was perfect for exploring the city, and the room was clean and very spacious.  We really enjoyed the bar as well.  Thanks for a great stay!

title: Fun time
text:
Stayed here for a stay-cation. What a great hotel
To stay at! Loved it highly recommend. Definitely check out the bar! Staff are friendly and rooms are clean. The ambiance is lively and can’t wait to come back !

title: Freddy elevates hotel service to next level.
text: When we experienced a snafu with our room, Freddy researched all potential solutions, and provided us with a choice of alternate accommodations. We love our new room. He did all this in a  friendly and professional manner, and truly transformed our experience at the hotel. In my humble opinion he deserves both a raise and a promotion. Ace, please know that you have a golden nugget in your midst. Treasure him.

title: Right in the middle of the action!
text: I love the vibe of this place and the lobby energy was awesome!  Highly recommended if you are looking to be in the middle of the action in the NoMad district.  I thought the rooms were tastefully done in a local loft style.  I would definitely go back.

title: My experience was 5 out of 5. I enjoyed myself!
text: My experience was 5 out of 5. Freddy Escorbores  was outstanding in helping. He gave me excellent service. Also everybody at the hotel was outstanding! I will definitely come back. Daniel was great with the maintenance.  The front desk staff gave me information on where to eat at. Every place was great.

title: Best staff
text:
Great location, great atmosphere. Always positive vibes in lobby especially around happy hour (3-6pm)

Staff was amazing but I specifically like to mention Marco at front desk. When I realised  at check in that I left my wallet in the cab, he was super helpful to locate the taxi., contact them and have taxi driver bring my wallet back in couple hrs.

My trip could have been a nightmare without his help.

I will definitely stay at Ace Hotel during my NYC trips.

title: Still the coolest vibe in the city
text: Coming back after a few years, I was happily surprised that this hip hotel still has it. The service is outstanding and the rooms are spacious and with an amazing vibe. I got a corner room and it was bigger than many apartments in NY. I hope the food they serve (I had breakfast there) improves once the restaurant renovations are finished. The best part still is its location!

title: wedding night
text: Me and my husband came here on our 1 year anniversary. Such an amazing day and ended it with such an amazing night at the Ace hotel.  Had a few drinks at the bar. Such amazing staff and the beds are to die for. Very clean and quiet !!! We slept like babies. Will come back again

title: Great stay
text: We were there for the night of our wedding , the hotel was very clean, the staff was very friendly and very helpful. I would definitely recommend anyone that is staying in NYC this is definitely a great hotel to stay at. They knew that we were coming there right after our wedding and they left a nice note with a bottle of champagne ❤️🍾

title: NYC Visit
text: Great room with a view and the all important bathtub. The bed was super comfortable, sound proof and a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. I had a medium size room and it had plenty of space for me to spread out and be comfortable.

title: Great stay, would come back again.
text: Great accommodation for a reasonable price by way of a sale offer. The "single" room was adequate space for a couple with minimal needs and belongings. The location of the hotel was great,  close enough to attractions yet far enough away from overly touristy places. Moreover, there are decent food options within walking distance from the hotel. Parking was convenient at the adjacent lot, you get a reduced rate if you're a hotel guest. Hotel staff was friendly and prompt with service. Superb bonus after the stay: I made a special request that was surprisingly granted so it was life icing on the cake. Much thanks to David, Director of Front Office, for making that happen!

title: The stay was amazing, Freddy is the man
text: I had the best sleep of my life. Low key. High key for that matter! This place needs to be known! I had the best sleep I’ve ever had at a hotel so much so that I’m considering to buy the mattress that they have at the hotel - I asked my girlfriend and I’m certain we’re going to buy it when I’m back home. Freddy. This guy. He’s the hotel manager on site at the New York location and he went above and beyond to help me and my crew out while we stayed here on business. No kidding: every request we had, he met with +1 / it left me saying to my colleague “yo, that guy Freddy, he’s the man, there’s nothing he won’t do!” - head to ACE hotel, you’ll get the best sleep of your life and have a great time while doing it!! Make sure to hit up Freddy at the front desk!!! THANK YOU FREDDY!!!!!!

title: ACE - Best sleep in a hotel I've ever had
text: We came to New York for work, about 7 of us, and all I needed on the trip was a good nights sleep after long shooting days. I slept like a baby: the bed was incredibly comfortable, and every need that our crew needed was met by our man Freddy at the  front desk. This dude went above and beyond every time and it was highly appreciated every time he did - so much so that I'm sitting here in my hotel room writing this review. Next time I'm in NY I will for sure come back and stay here, and will recommend it to my friends. I've never had a good stay in New York but this one went above and beyond!! Thank you Freddy!!! Keep it up!!!

title: I won’t stay anywhere else
text: Great work trip. I had the fortune of staying in the loft room. The staff was extremely hospitable, the loft was amazing, and my expectations were exceeded. In a world where half meetings are in person and the other half are still virtual, I was comfortably situated in this room to work and relax.

title: NYC weekend
text: The Ace has a very unique vibe. If you're looking for something outside of cookie cutter hotel chains, you won't go wrong with the Ace. My room was clean and larger than I expected...with little amenities like a turntable with vinyl available to play, a large table to entertain guests, a very well stocked bar (no, not free). Hotel staff was extremely helpful. There's a lounge in the lobby, with a bar and a DJ spinning tunes in the evenings. And all this smack dab in the middle of NYC. I would definitely come back to this Ace....and would be open to trying out their other locations

title: AVOID
text: NY used to be about service.. there is no service in this hotel, in the morning there is 1 /!!!!/ person serving at the bar, room service doesnt bother to pick up , when u call front desk they tell u they re sorry that room service is not available, whole place smells of pot, incredible…if this would be in Europe most probably it would be a hostel or bancrupt… yeah and there is no daylight at all…it has the vibe of a darkroom…

title: NOWHERE like the ACE!!
text: If you are considering staying at this fine hotel, let me save you the trouble & just BOOK IT! Don't hesitate and go for it! I've always been a fan of the Ace properties, frequent the Palm Springs & NOLA locations. Every hotel feels like a new experience where you are transported into another time. The building itself is very impressive & historic. When you arrive you are greeted by the most delightful front desk staff & instantly you feel like an old friend returning to visit! Just thinking about my experiences so far gives me chills, as I recently started doing work travel again I was a bit nervous to go alone. But when I got to the Ace I felt secure, safe & "at home". The rooms are all unique and feature local art which truly is part of the fun when you open the door. I've stayed twice within the past few months and assure you I will be returning for every business trip if I can. The rooms were spotless & I consider myself on the side of overly critical. Saying that I was truly impressed with how impeccable the rooms were. The lobby is a whole VIBE, where you can relax in the morning with coffee or a cocktail to top off the day! The beds are beyond comfy, love the robes provided & the pillows are made for a princess. I would know, I even bought them for my home! The bathroom showers feel like a waterfall & love that beautiful shampoo, conditioner & body wash is provided. Makes packing a bit lighter & love that it's sourced from Japan!! Special shoutout to David for always making sure I feel right at home. Thank you so much to everyone at the Ace, I can't express how grateful I am to have found such a great place to rest after the chaos of the city! It's great to know I always have a place to call home in NYC!! Cheers!!

title: Great Ambiance and Amazing Staff!
text: I had such a beautiful experience with Freddy today at the Ace Hotel! Even with graduation and a ton of other things going on in the city, he made sure to exceed my expectations. He found a room that is PERFECT for me and made sure to give me a tour before so I knew how everything worked and how to get there. 10/10 recommend staying here, and I hope everyone gets to experience the greatness of Freddy at the Ace Hotel! The lobby (and its staff) are also fantastic! Freddy recommended the chicken flatbread and now so do I.

title: Beautiful, clean, amazing staff!!!!
text: Such a beautiful hotel in the heart of NYC!  The rooms are huge and very clean. The staff is impeccable. I couldn’t gush more about this hotel. I will be spending all my future trips to NYC at the Ace hotel, guaranteed!

title: THE BEST
text: Did a quick weekend here. One of the best experiences in NYC.  David hooked me up and made this weekend very special for my girlfriend and me. Staff, rooms and service is top notch. Best bang for value and the location makes it easy to get anywhere you need.

title: This staff is incredible!!
text: I'm an avid business traveler and travel all over the world, often requiring long stays. And there's no better staff to make you feel welcomed than the staff at The ACE. They remember your name, ensure your comfort, and have the best local reccomendations. They clearly have a few All-Stars, but Freddy definitely stands out. He's got great style, keeps it friendly yet respectful, and has all the best recc's for local fun and dining. The rooms are great and comfortable too with everything you need for a comfortable and fun stay in the middle of Manhattan.

title: Avoid this self regarding hipster place
text:
Apart from its central location, avoid this over priced poor quality hotel which is so self-regarding it’s forgotten that it’s purpose is to serve customers. Obsessive about being so hip, their basic design and customer service is woeful. 

Plus side - the room was big for a New York midtown hotel. 

Downsides - whole hotel is deeply gloomy and unnecessarily dark as was the room which had negligible lighting; shower was very low pressure; the mattress wasn’t the greatest and the bed was wedged between two walls with tiny space to get to it; I don’t need a guitar and a record table in the room, I need drawer and closet space; the lifts are frustratingly the slowest invented.

Don’t bother going to the coffee bar in the lobby because it takes them ten minutes to serve you; the lobby area of which they’re so proud is so dark you can’t work in it and is loud all the time. 

And having left my AirPods in the room on departure, when I contacted security, they couldn’t have been less interested in the fact that they hadn’t been handed in.

title: The most incredible place!
text: What can I say about the Ace Hotel?  It’s not your typical cookie-cutter hotel. It’s funky and cool, with decor like an edgy New York City apartment. The room was comfy, the beds amazingly comfortable, with welcoming touches and fully equipped mini-bar. I wanted to put the cool light fixtures in my purse (but I didn’t!).  The service was friendly and attentive. The front desk staff was so cheerful. We were having trouble trying to stream a show and they sent someone up quickly. He was nice, too!  My daughter goes to school here so I will definitely make the Ace my new favorite place to stay.

title: L’inverse d’un upgrade : un downgrade !
text:
Downgrade in ACE
Image speaks by themselves! 
This is was you get at ACE for close to $500 by night.

Such venues used to friendly welcome their guest in an informal manner. 
That the reason we like to stay at ACME in Chicago, at HOXTON in London and in many other places at Mama Shelter. This use to be the warranty of a nice stay. 

In NYC, August 2019, room 1217 was disappointed after an amazing stay at  ACE in LA. Last December, sister’s houses in LA in Palm Spring was heavenly. Therefore we gave an other chance to Big Apple 29th Street with an upgrade to a larger room. 

In 2019, Room 1217 was a disappointment. The room was clumsy in a form of a Z but the view on Empire State was just amazing. 
This was a medium size room. The proximity with the elevator was an nuisance. It smelled dust around the bed. 
In 2022, Room 919 was proposed. Despite the size of the room, there might be a king of fenshui iatus that make the room quite inconfortable even though  it is large with a couch. 
Opening  bathroom’s door, that a shock.  Toilettes, bath and sink fits in 2 SQM max. Some toilettes are bigger than this.
It is claustrophobic. 
Getting to the reception I explained that I would prefer a bigger bathroom. 
After 40 minutes and 5 to 6 différents people (with a white air guy who disappeared after telling me he would check with his boss). They propose an option. Every single time I had to get back to the desk. This would have been wise to come and get me in the lobby.

They proposed a room and I asked to see it. It “pissed” them off. Finally someone show it to me. The 1017. The same awkward room as the 1217 with amazing view. At least the bathroom was small but from an acceptable size. 

Seal siles are black. I was intrigued the day before leaving. So I used a tissue to check them at the level of my shoulder. This was properly disgusting. I mention it to the desk showing pictures. I recall the downgrade for which they propose a discount of $80 ($40 for two night). We spend the all day out and come back  to pick up our luggage before going to the airport. The same white hair guy was behind the desk. Without saying a word he call someone with his talkie walkie. No one offers to find a taxi for us. We walked under the rain and find one after at least 30 minutes. 
All in all this is not cool at all and such venues should no longer be mentioned into LVMH Guide. 
This was our 25th birthday and you expect everything to be perfect and cool. Such a disappointments.

title: Cool hotel and great location
text: The hotel and room was ace. A really nice size, very cool room and great shower. The bar was always lively and served great cocktails too. The location was perfect to explore all of Manhattan. Highly recommend and would definitely be my first choice.

title: Great vibe and good food
text: We had drinks at the lobby bar which was the best decision. The lobby has a great atmosphere and the fries and Buffalo wings were fire. The rooms were also great. Can’t wait to come back again next time I visit New York City

title: Freddy and Team Go Above & Beyond
text:
Freddy, at the front desk, made me feel so welcome on my first stay that I felt I had just arrived for a family reunion! He was able to upgrade my room and also gifted me a drink coupon to settle in after my travels. I was so impressed, I returned the following week to stay again for 4 nights as I have a lot of consulting clients in NYC.  Freddy and the team were there when I arrived!

And my second trip was better than the first. Also, I was utterly stunned to discover a door from your lobby into the StumpTown coffee shop! It’s my favorite coffee in the entire world so far and there it was! The whole stay was like that — one delicious little discovery after the next.

I love the Ace Hotel NYC and will return. Freddy and team — thank YOU for making it MAGIC!
It receives my highest recommendation. 
PS The sleeping rooms are comfortable and quiet and the bed is bliss.

title: Best stay in the area!
text: If you're looking for a hip, clean, fun hotel full of amenities, the Ace is your place! Their service is top notch, the rooms are comfortable and visually pleasing, and they've thought of all the little touches one could need or want during their stay. And the location can't be beat. I'll definitely be staying there again!

title: Great Time
text: Just had an amazing stay! Everything was nice and clean and the service went above and beyond. We had a drink at the Lobby Bar which was delicious. They had a cool gallery wall of a light installation. My favorite part was the bathtub! Will definitely be back on our next trip to NYC!

title: Exceeded espectations
text: The Ace is everything I thought it would be. The staff the so accommodating. The were able to get me in early from my red eye flight and I could not be more happy for that. the mini room was great with a view of the empire state building. I will be back again and already booked to be back next month for work. Thank you ACE!

title: Top notch hospitality
text: Marco left a great impression on my girlfriend and I! He was super friendly and helpful and we loved his enthusiasm. Everyone that worked at Ace was also really nice and rooms were really clean. Value was really good, we didn’t have any city views, but a 10 min walk from Flatiron building, high line, lots of great restaurants, and theaters. Trendy hotel in an accessible spot

title: 30th Birthday <3
text: Had an amazing birthday weekend!!! There’s a contemporary art gallery at the hotel that’s super cool. Staff was very helpful with suggestions and super accommodating. Ask to be above the 7th floor for a good view! Restaurant has a good burger and great drinks. Definitely more of a 20-30 something crowd. We’re coming back next month!!

title: Awesome stay with a awesome crew
text:
I had an amazing 10 days stay in this hotel. The crew was really friendly and taking guest request really seriously. Had to get one more bed in the room and they delivered it so fast. 
Shoutout to my crewman Friday that took care of everything for me !

title: Great Stay!
text: Amazing stay! An unexpected weekend away was made even better with a stay at ACE NY. Upon arrival we were greeted at the front desk staff who were polite and accommodating. They gave great suggestions for restaurants and bars, starting with the Lobby Bar. Great drinks, awesome staff and beautiful room! We came to NY to see the sites, but where you lay your head is just as important. The room was clean, perfect temperature, and despite being in the city - the room was quiet.

title: The Best!
text: I have a new favorite hotel in NYC! We stayed at the Ace Hotel last weekend and have been on a vacation high all week! The location was absolutely perfect for us, walking distance to literally everything. After running around the city all day it was so fun to come back to the lobby bar for a drink at the end of the day. Our room was the best place to relax and recharge, cute clean and comfortable! Thanks Ace Hotel we had a blast, see you soon!

title: Great Stay!
text:
Definitely one of my favorite hotels in downtown! Great location and I loved my stay there. 

I found all the staff so helpful and friendly, even when I arrived late at night. Jesus and David especially helped me out.

The rooms have a great focus on design, and I found them very clean and comfortable. 

I definitely look forward to coming back!

title: Amazing place to stay
text:
This is a magnificent hotel with superb service. A wonderful & divine experience.
Staff makes you feel special.
Will be staying here again looking forward to coming back. 
Ace hotel has a fabulous vibe

title: A+
text: I stayed at the Ace New York in April and could not express the level of service I received. The front desk was very knowledgeable about the NOMAD area and offered great recommendations for restaurants and bars nearby. They were also kind enough to upgrade me from a mini to a large king for my stay as well. The SMEG fridge in the room was clutch for all my leftovers. The room was one of the cleanest rooms I've stayed in while visiting NYC and the bed was so comfortable. The Lobby Bar was great to sit with a pastry and coffee and a fantastic spot to grab a nightcap. I will 100% be returning for another stay and it cannot be soon enough.

title: RATS!!!!!!!
text:
We stayed at Ace Hotel NYC in February 2022 for 7 nights, costing $1,900 plus $300 daily fees. Our room was a standard king room on the 9th floor.

On the second to the last night, I woke up in the middle of the evening to what sounded like rustling papers. Thinking it was just the wind, I went back to sleep. The next day, we happened to look at the tray next to the TV that serves as the minibar, and were shocked to find the candy bars shredded open as if viciously clawed at, and realized that it was clearly done by a rat (see attached photo).

I went down to the front desk immediately and reported the issue, and before I showed the photo, they apologized profusely and offered to move us to a suite at no added cost (nice gesture, but we realized this means that we're not the first victims). They also offered a free night in the suite in the future (again, a nice gesture, but why would we come back to a rat-infested hotel?). They were initially unwilling to do more than waive the daily resort fees and the one-night stay in the suite. After more haggling and back-and-forth, we gave up and left the next day. 

Few days later, the manager did refund the entire stay with a note inviting us back. 

Needless to say, we won't be staying there again. You shouldn't either.

title: Cool place
text:
We had been to the Ace Hotel 10 years ago - and then now again: still a super nice place to be at. The staff is very helpful and the athmosphere is relaxing and authentic.
Even if while there was a party in the lobby we had an absolute quiet room to recover from the city.
The coffee and the food in the directly connected bar is awesome yummy :-)
Thanks dear Ace-Team for the free upgrade we got.
Next time we will definitely go to the Ace again.

title: Beautiful building, fantastic location
text: This is a fun place to stay in the heart of NY, walkable to the Village and just off Broadway, one of the most convenient places to stay, in my opinion.  Love the vibe of the coffee shop / bar downtstairs too.

title: Great Base for NYC Weekend
text:
My husband and I had a wonderful stay at Ace Hotel NYC over the weekend.  The property is perfectly situated for easy subway (28th St/Herald Square)/taxi/walking access and is close to great dining, shopping and entertainment options.  Stumptown Coffee is located in the lobby level, as is a great little bar.  

As a former work road warrior, the true test of a hotel stay is the comfort and quality of the sleep and shower, and Ace does not disappoint.  The bed was SUPER comfy and the pillows perfection, and we were shocked by how quiet the property was.  Granted, we were on the 9th floor and fully expecting the gentle lull of honking horns and general street noise, but were very pleasantly surprised at how late (!) we were able to sleep.  Our bathroom, and specifically the shower, was HUGE and had perfect water pressure.  

But the best part of the stay was the staff.  Every single person who works here is super friendly, helpful and laid back.  And it was so nice that the hotel was well-staffed!  Our stay happened to coincide with a freakishly warm early spring day, and we were unable to get the a/c in our room to work.  A member of the maintenance crew arrived to get it working in RECORD TIME at a late hour.

I rated Ace NYC as a 'budget' hotel, because the value we received was EXCEPTIONAL for the price.  As former NYC residents, we recommend this property as  wonderfully representative of the city, and for its comfort, location, and exceptional value, as well as its superb staff.

title: Excellent customer service
text:
Above and beyond customer service

Freddy, Kemani, Kodi & Julio - all fantastic. Went above and beyond for everything I needed and more. There was also a 3 AM guy on a friday and Saturday night that was there for me multiple times - for my printing I needed and for a spare toothbrush. 

Whomever the 11th floor housekeeping staff is, they killed it. There was one woman, I wish I knew her name, but she was so respectful & kind to me and kept me feeling like I was at home. 

Pedro at the bar was the friendliest guy - my Tuesday night guy!

title: Spring at the ace hotel
text: We just love the Ace hotel !! Freddy made our stay extra special !! That friendly smile and always eager to help made our Ace hotel stay fantastic !!! Always get to come back to the Ace and see a friendly face !!! See you Freddy and the Ace team in 3 months !! Keep up the great work !!! -heather and Amèlia

title: Amazing Vibe
text: Ace Hotel definitely exceeded my expectations! It was the perfect vibe for me with the record player, guitar, and the room being so non tradional. A few people made my birthday amazing as well like Freddy who was a great host, Anthony was an awesome bartender, and Laura behind the coffee counter was also amazing and made me feel at home. Such a awesome place and will be returning on my next trip to Manhattan!

title: Wonderful stay, fantastic location, lovely experience
text: I've stayed at the Ace in Portland, so knew what I could expect of quality and vibe. There's a certain cool factor that appealed to my daughter, who turned 19 on this trip, and the location seemed decent and reviews here good, so we chose the Ace — and would definitely return. The location is AMAZING, especially for walking. We covered a lot of territory and most destinations were no more than 30 minutes away … and the subway line is close. The staff at front desk and in the lounge are all lovely. The lobby lounge is almost always hopping and is a great place to work, chill or get a cocktail. The room, while a little tight, makes good use of space and was quite comfortable and super clean. My only quibble was how tight the washroom was, especially the shower, It's small, shower curtains all around that cling to you when wet. And hot water wasn't super plentiful. So if you're really into your showers and need to have lots of counter space in the bathroom, the Ace is not the place for you. But that's a small quibble for all the other benefits of this lovely hotel. I like my spacious, hot showers but will definitely choose the Ace NY again should I return.

title: Great hotel lobby but not so great rooms
text:
Loved the lobby has a nice connected bar, coffee shop, bakery and bagel shop.
The room was terrible. The large king room was booked. 
The tub was covered in mold and rust and the single lightbulb hanging above the sink kept flickering for the perfect horror movie setup. In addition there is only a single tap in the shower tub which had only lukewarm water at the hottest setting. 
When asking front desk if anything could be done about the above, I was told an engineer could be sent up. Unfortunately nobody showed up and the problems were never fixed. Thankfully only one night here.

title: Fun hotel, great location
text: Room was perfectly fine and clean, pretty big for NY.  Lobby has a fun buzz and Stumptown Coffee attached - coffee shop vibe during the day and night club vibe at night - we couldn't hear anything in our room on the 2nd floor.  We were there for couples vacation; easy walk to Broadway and great restaurants. Gym is nice (in basement - no windows). This was our second time staying - we'll be back.

title: Nativer New Yorker tells it like it is
text: Guys, listen. This is your hotel. Truly.  It is perfect and just what you want. I'm a lifelong NYC girl until I moved (kicking and screaming) to Boston.  I come and stay here to recalibrate and it never ever disappoints.  The staff is warm, knowledgeable and on-point. The rooms range in sizes, because after all it is NYC but it is NOT  a BS micro-hotel.  The bar is fantastic and the vibe is perfect.  Location is amazing - the commercial spaces are a prefect compliment to anything you want to do if you are tired while being centrally located for anything you want to do - Balthazar in Soho? Easy subway ride.  Theater? Boom, quick ride or a simple walk.  K-Town (Korea Town - please get Korean BBQ - I reco New Wonjo) right there! Priced fairly  for all you get - with a super dollop of hip and cool.

title: Great staff, room, and vibe.
text: I often book a boutique hotel in NYC if I don't stay with friends and this was one of the best!  I will definitely stay here again. A lovely staff, great room with a view of the Empire State Building and the city, a perfect desk for some work, very clean, good style, nice touches like lights that dim, good products, and quiet (12th floor, thank you to whoever chose that!). The lobby was lively but there was always space to sit, work, and meet friends. Great coffee too. A welcoming space for all kinds of folks!

title: great location
text:
I booked this hotel for my daughter's birthday because we wanted to be within walking distance of the theater district and other attractions. Walking in NYC is a sport and we definitely got our steps in but was glad that we were near all of the sites we wanted to see. We went to the Empire State Building, Anna Delvey's much coveted Church Mission Building, Bryant Park, Public Library, MoMA and the theater district.  

As for the hotel itself, check in and out were a breeze and the staff was very attentive. We were lucky to be checked in by the highly referenced Freddy (check the reviews and you will see his name come up often). We asked if there were any upgrades and he was able to get us a great rate on the loft. Our room had the most amazing view of the Empire State Building and was large enough for us to unwind after an all day marathon of events. We were also delighted to find a hand written birthday card and treat from the staff awaiting us upon entering the room. 

This is definitely not your traditional Marriott or Hyatt, so if you are looking for a standard issue hotel, go somewhere else. It is geared towards a younger demographic with loud thumping music, dark interiors and gritty city aesthetics, but it was exactly what we were looking for.

title: A little disappointing
text:
Staff is lovely. Lobby is interesting and vibrant. Rooms are SO DARK which would be ok if I had more than one bedside lamp and 1 glaring ceiling light that was not even in the center of the room.  Also no real place to put clothes? And every junk food and beverage imaginable for sale in the caddy in the room, but not 1 tea bag or coffee?? Not great for early risers.

Lastly, I got charged a hefty fee for a bunch of mini bar items we did not consume. They will refund - but I could have dealt without the hassle of a call post check out.

title: Great Getaway!
text:
I live in Manhattan and took a staycation at Ace with a friend, best idea! We booked the loft suite which was so spacious and AMAZING - incredible view of Empire State, comfiest big bed, record player we enjoyed and lots of lovely details. 
The staff was professional but also super kind and helpful. 
We  also enjoyed the lobby bar, a relaxing cool place to have a drink.
I look forward to going back to Ace, it is a truly special place to stay.

title: Accommodating for Handicapped Access
text: I met a group in the lobby for a small event, I called ahead to see about help with handicapped parking. Julio and Jesus were so kind and welcoming. They helped me park and were very accommodating. Highly recommend!

title: Ace is aces
text: Big rooms (for NYC) very friendly helpful staff and a fun lobby. The location is excellent too! Ten minute walk to Broadway, quick subway ride downtown. If you want a cool hotel where you feel welcome, the Ace is perfect. The only complaint - light level in rooms is low. You may lose a black sock!

title: Rooms designed by a 3 year old with crayons
text:
The few good points:
1.  The people were amazing
2.  The rooms LOOKED cute
3.  Lobby was nice place.

Now the bad:
Completely dysfunctional design to the rooms. 
Bathroom has space for a sink but they opted to put the full length mirror and put the sink out by the bed.  You have to step through the tub to get to the toilet that's right up against the wall so you're smooshed when you sit.  Wall tiles on the floor so super slippery.  Bath fixtures are off centered and awkward so if you shower the curtain sticks to you because of where the water falls (you have to stand against the edge) also getting water all over the already slippery floor.

They don't give you much toilet paper and don't refill the tissues so bring your own.

Hot water died for an extremely long time.

Why so dark?  Clearly the designers were not women who put on makeup.  And there is no lighting you can add to counter it.  I had to run down the drug store to buy a light up mirror that i couldn't take with me.

title: Great stay- great staff
text:
Amazing experience. Freddy at the front desk made our stay perfect. He was kind and attentive when I checked in, and made sure everything was taken care of our entire stay! Amazing staff member and a great representation of the hotel. 

Would come back to the hotel 100%

title: Freddy is Great!
text: Freddy, who works at the Ace as a front desk agent, is consistently helpful, upbeat, and informative. His radiant energy is infectious! Every time I've interacted with Freddy, he's raised my spirits. From the eclectic buttons on his tie, to his great dining recommendations, he's one of the most memorable people I've met during my travels to New York.

title: Delightful stay
text:
I stayed at the Ace NY for about two weeks in February & my original room was so spacious. I was greeted with a handwritten note & complimentary water. They have everything you’d need in their mini bar (band aids, advil, bottle opener, electric kettle). The smeg fridge was such a great size I was able to fit an entire cake for a birthday, that was a plus. 

Additionally Freddy (or Freddie) was amazing 10/10. Super accommodating!!  He was the sweetest and most friendly person I encountered at the Ace. All of the staff overall were nice but he stood out the most. He seems to genuinely enjoy being helpful & he has a great personality. Freddy went above & beyond to help me with specific requests & when I had to change rooms he was able to provide me an upgrade which was extremely meaningful, he was too generous. Thank you so much for all of your assistance. 

I will be back my next time around for business travel. The location is convenient because it is close to my job. Thank you Ace staff ❤️

title: Unique and Exciting Property
text: I was recommended to book at the Ace New York by a friend but didn't know what to expect. This is not like any other hotel in the best way possible. Every detail was thought out and gave a sense that we were staying at musician's loft rather than a hotel. It was such a treat to take in the decor of our room, it was our home away from home. The service was so helpful and welcoming after a long travel day. The room was clean and well maintained. We loved strumming on the guitar and playing the records in our room. They truly thought of every detail. Can't wait to stay again!

title: Huge room, great location, wonderful staff
text:
My teenage daughter and I stayed here for one night.  Everything was great.  I don’t stay in Midtown often but the location ended up being great for us.   We used the 28th street subway stations to travel all through Manhattan.  

The room was huge (1101).  It was interior facing but we still had plenty  of light. The beds were comfy.  

The staff was amazing.  It was one of the quietest rooms I’ve ever stayed in. 

One caveat, It’s an old building…the heat is a little funky and doesn’t come on if it’s warmer than 55F.

title: Disappointing experience - did not live up to hype or brand expectations
text:
I booked the Ace in Nomad after reading overwhelmingly positive reviews on TripAdvisor and Booking.com.

The quality of the hotel was mostly fine -- bed was comfortable and bathroom was clean. All amenities existed as promised online.

I have two major issues with the hotel: 1) the hotel feels tired despite being fairly new. I think the developers did not adapt much internally beyond furnishings when they acquired the building. This can be marketed as "sticking with the heritage of the building," but realistically means that nothing has been upgraded in the building -- this is especially noticeable in bathrooms, which feel that they have the same tile and mirrors as pre-acquisition. Hallways are dark and moody--but not in a chic way. 2) the hotel is formerly a residential hotel, with some of the original tenants still occupying their units (legal requirement of '70s/'80s New York city code); for me, this meant originally being assigned a room opposite an older gentleman who was hard of hearing and had his TV blaring at all hours so that the entire landing could hear it. He also had a sign on his door addressed to food delivery services, which led to my concerns about non-guests/non-residents being allowed into residential parts of the building. To the front desk's merit, the team was gracious about moving me to a different floor once I raised the issue; however, I was shocked that this could even be allowed to occur in the first place. Surely there must be a legal recourse for the hotel beyond just allowing rent-controlled, multi-decade tenants to act as they please vis-a-vis other visitors. I've never seen an arrangement like this and was unhappy to learn of it only upon arrival in my room.

title: Thank you Freddy
text: What a wonderful visit! Freddy at the front desk was super amazing, friendly & pleasant. He made our stay 10x better. Everyone needs to be like Freddy the way he brings joy into the atmosphere. Freddy’s kind service is why I would come back and visit this hotel again. I asked about 100 questions about NYC because I’m not from here  and not once did he seem annoyed or bothered. Most people who work at front desk is in a rush to get the guest out their face but not Freddy he was very patient with me. Thank you Freddy for your kind service, you made my stay much better.

title: Creative Director
text:
The Ace is my favorite hotel in Manhattan, and now in Brooklyn. It’s reached an iconic/classic status for those that like a very cool/chill vibe but aren’t looking for the Spa/Bling factor. 
The rates are incredibly fare. The staff and service are excellent. If you’re visiting NYC as a tourist, I can’t imagine a better location to strike out from each day.

title: The ace is awesome
text: This place was awesome from the gate ! We showed up early after a red eye from west coast just wanting to leave luggage, they offered to see if there was early check In available, they took our bags to room while we settled in to the beautiful lounge for hot coffees an yummy croissants. Rooms were clean an  nicely decorated with lots of space . They tidied up daily, an the staff was friendly an more than accommodating. Would highly recommend

title: Great services and location
text: Great service, very clean rooms, spacious  hotel room with superb View over the Empire state building, hotel staff very warm and ready to help. Hotel is situated in a very good area, close to all the important locations. Definitely reccomend this hotel and Waiting to return.

title: Great hotel, dark decor
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Ace: we had a large room which was very comfortable: the bed was great, nice touches like fridge and record player. Staff were very nice. We didn’t hang in the lobby because omicron was kicking off. The hotel was strict about looking at vaccination certificates so they were doing everything that they could but was still a busy space filled with people drinking and therefore not wearing masks. The only reason I gave four instead of five stars was because it would have been good to have been able to make coffee in the room (stumptown is in the building but no room service due to covid) and also because the rooms are so dark. I know this is the hotel aesthetic (black walls and a carpets old school bulbs) but it really is dark: even in a corner room with lots of windows. This is my taste rather than a problem with the hotel. Finally I think the location is excellent: midtown but downtown at the same time! You can get anywhere really easily and great restaurants in the area.

title: Awesome place. Love it!! 🥰🥰
text:
My family and I stayed at the NYC Ace hotel end of Nov 2021. The front desk caught that it was my bday and Upgraded to a very nice room with the view of the Empire State Bldg. Lobby bar was great, Room was very nice and very clean.
I highly recommend this hotel.
Go  to hotel in NYC!

title: Love the vibe at The Ace Hotel!
text: Have stayed here a few times and the location is perfect for getting everywhere.  The staff is very friendly and we appreciated the stringent COVID protocols.  Rooms are a good size for NYC.  Having the SMEG refrigerator was convenient and this go around we had a guitar in the room (the last 2 times we had a record player).  The only complaint was that the shower on this trip was tiny and water went all over the bathroom floor.  I let the hotel know and they responded that they would make a note in my file and make sure we had a better bathroom on our next visit.

title: Seriously, Ace...
text: Seriously, Ace. What is up with the sad, dreary, dim décor? I really like this hotel. The lobby is a treasure, one of New York’s best, and the attitude is on point. I realize some covid compliance issues probably took a toll. And I acknowledge that I chose your smallest room. Still, it was big enough for one and well appointed…a robe and all the fixings. The steel pipe fitting “closet,” the drab lighting, the lack of any wall art, the over-all palette and style is totally mid-century homeless shelter. Nearby there’s a Courtyard Marriott…I could still hang out in your lobby!

title: Our 2nd Home
text: We love Ace hotels especially this one so glad to be back. Felt very safe with Vaccine checks, windows that open, and welcoming. Had to stay in a different hotel in April when they were closed and it was fun but this one feels like home.

Security is pathetic…Nothing is more important than being safe… A young female guest was very recently physically assaulted in this hotel & hotel security and management did NOTHING at all. Think twice before choosing this place for your stay.

title: Best experience
text: I have stayed one night in Ace hotel in November and I had a very good experience, I went there for a birthday surprise party, the hotel staff was very nice, room was very clean and the hotel is very good positioned. Totally recommend this hotel!

title: The hotel is an Ace
text: We were in Manhattan for a frank sinatra tribute concert at Carnegie Hall.  the hotel was great.  good vibe and good location with a BIG room!  need i say more.  other than to fulfill my character requirement.  Good showers with plenty of warm water.  Made it!

title: Maybe best for a friend group.
text: Third time staying here and I might have outgrown it. Front desk was friendly and fast. Location is pretty much middle of nowhere but convenient to get to other neighborhoods. The king room on the second floor felt like I was in someone’s dark basement with the tiny window. I know you don’t come to NYC to watch TV but this one was so small it could fit in my suitcase. Strange after coming from three properties in the city with 65” smart TVs. Small detail but an empty glass was sitting in the hallway for the entirety of my stay. The lobby bar was full and seemed like the main attraction.

title: Mice in the room and no hot water
text:
Got woken up by squeaking mice racing across the floor of my room more than once. At least 3-4 mice in the room, which was fairly unpleasant.

Also, the shower took about 10 minutes to get up to luke warm, and never got beyond that.

Keep in mind, they also charge a mandatory resort fee, so tack $50/night on to whatever rate you think you're paying. Even if you have a fully prepaid stay, they will charge this rate after the fact. Of course, you can then dispute it with your CC company, but that's a bit of a pain.

title: Amazing Hotel! Thank you to all!
text: Stayed at the Ace hotel in October 2021 and as always, had a pleasant stay.  I always stay at this hotel when I am in NYC.  I am so grateful to the staff.  From the moment I walk into the lobby I know that every dollar  spent  is worth it.  The minute I walk in I immediately enjoy the cool vibe of the lobby and of course the drinks at the bar and the music which kept me dancing while checking in! Makes me not want to leave the hotel  :-).  After an exhausting day in the city it is a great feeling to go to such a nice cozy room - immaculate, comfortable bed, and  fully stocked bar! .  The entire staff  was very attentive and pleased to assist.

title: Literally THE BEST Hotel Experience
text: I just stayed at Ace Hotel for 15 days while I was in between apartments... They knew I was coming with my dog and as soon as we walked into the room, they even had treats waiting for my pup. The staff is VERY helpful with everything and friendly. GREAT service. By day 2 they already knew my name and my dog's name. I stayed in one of their suites and the entire time I felt like I was home. Even the housekeeping was impeccable. To add on top, the location is incredibly convenient, easy access to several subway stations to get around the city and lots of restaurants, cafes around for entertainment. The Stumptown and Black Bagel that are also in the building, were a treat every morning. Hotel lobby is always fun day and night... I will definitely go back for drinks and highly recommend this place (especially if you have a pet don't even consider anywhere else!)... you won't be disappointed!

title: Fantastic Stay at the Ace Hotel
text: I have been coming to New York City for business for over 20 years and I have a few favorite hotels.  I recently stayed at the Ace Hotel because a midtown location was more convenient than my usual downtown location.  What a treat!  The staff were incredibly helpful (locked my keys in my room - oops), the security was great (I'm a solo female traveler), and the Lobby Bar was the perfect balance of chic and fun.  Service was incredible and I would highly recommend this New York City gem.

title: Happy Girl!
text: I had an AMAZING weekend staying at the ACE NYC! From the attentive courteous staff and the attention to fine details made me and my stay HAPPY! The coffee shop is perfection, along with the fun lobby bar! Cant wait to go back again.....until next time ACE HOTEL.....

title: Retro in midtown Manhattan
text: Retro style--see it in the very warm, limited lighting (but adequate in the room), in the restricted color scheme (white, black, deep brown), in the typography (room refrigerator in what looks like a shipping container with "RATIONS" in a stenciled-appearing font). Yet key twenty-first century conveniences are there: fast internet with easy log-in procedure, plenty of AC outlets, USB power at the bedside, flat screen tv. Location was a big reason I stayed there. 28th Street is a local subway stop, and Herald Square 34th Street (5 minute walk even with luggage) has multiple trains. Result: My return to LaGuardia airport on public transit took just under an hour and cost me one subway fare. Also, it was a roughly 20-minute walk to Grand Central Terminal and a shorter walk to the Port Authority Bus Terminal. Service was great. Fast check-in and check-out. Housekeeping cleaned my room even when I didn't leave it til about noon. When I asked where Black Seed Bagel was (in the same building), the desk clerk walked me to the door. My room had a queen size bed and was small but not cramped. Milk Bar (dessert shop) and Stumptown Coffee (incredible coffee) are also in the building.

title: Recharging stay at the ACE hotel
text: We loved the ambience and interior design. Also housekeeping was amazing and every day the room was immaculate. I also enjoyed the little notes they left behind! Having a refrigerator (and freezer) of that size in the room was wonderful too! Everyone with whom we interacted had such a pleasant and kind attitude, this was a true pleasure to stay here. Finally, easy access to Stumptown Coffee and Milk Bar was the best!

title: Great
text:
Fantastic stay. It was really great to spend a few days here. Oooh and breakfast was delicious! Never ending. Hope to be back soon. We will definitely stop at the Ace soon.  
All the best and stay safe.

title: The King of Cool  Retro-Noir
text: I've been fascinated with NoMad for quite some time now, so I booked our wedding anniversary weekend at the Ace. I didn't really know that much about it other than I had been in the cool lobby twice before and knew it had our vibe. From the fast and friendly check-in experience to entering our urban-chic room, I knew we'd made the right choice. The bed and crisp linens were super comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious with a fabulous large window. If you like dim ambience, brushed steel doors and a cool, retro-noir vibe, THIS is the hotel for you. It's really the hotel for anyone: who doesn't want comfort and a friendly staff at every turn?! The bartenders we met were awesome at the Lobby Bar.  Camaaron waited on us when we hosted our daughters and friends. His drinks were wonderful and his friendliness was outstanding. We also had another wonderful time with Pedro the next evening. We met Juan and Julio, the doormen who are warm and funny and aware of everything you need, even before you do!
