Freddie at reception is that person you wish could be around you daily. He is sweet, helpful and he too anticipates needs ; he is eager to make sure you're having a good time. And there is no doubt, you WILL have a good time. Oh, one incredible bartender/server I'd met last month, Meghan, recognized me at the bar and welcomed us back and it was lovely to see (she apparently is now at the Ace Brooklyn).  In addition to my other fascinations in NoMad, the Ace has cemented my decision that our next move will be to this area. In the meantime, I plan to drop in to the Ace at any opportunity, whether to do some work at the lobby tables, and enjoy a drink on the leather couches or the fabulous long bar. I cannot wait to visit that lovely staff again soon!

title: Still Great at the ACE!
text: The place is still classic: lovely lobby bar, super friendly and helpful staff, rooms are just super thoughtfully appointed; and damn, there's a Martin guitar sitting there just waiting to be loved on. Such a win. Thx ACE.

title: Noisy and lacking basic comforts - felt like a hostel
text:
The good:
- convenient location for Broadway, restaurants, bars 
- nice stocked mini bar, cool atmosphere with guitar in room
- good coffee from Stumptown in lobby 
- nice people at front desk and bar 

The bad:
- uncomfortable, hard beds 
- VERY loud - even on 9th floor, the thin / not soundproof windows didn’t keep out honking as well as noisy hammering and sawing from construction at 8 am across 29th. Not a place to sleep well or sleep in.  
- first room we were in (212) smelled moldy. When we moved, the second room was said to be “the same” but didn’t have a desk. This was problematic since we were working from the hotel and wanted the desk but we figured no moldy smell > desk. 
- HORRIBLE showers. No hot/cold taps, just one knob that kind of changed the temp but not really. The first shower in 212 also had a painfully aggressive showerhead that felt like needles trying to tattoo your skin. 
- no Breslin restaurant, thus no room service, not even coffee / tea
- also, no coffee machines in the room, so you have to pay $$$ for coffee downstairs  

Honestly despite the hip atmosphere, guitars, and lots of alcohol (for purchase) in the mini bar, this just felt very lacking in basic comforts. Maybe if you’re a hipster you’ll like it.

title: Perfect Spot for a Friends and Extended Family to stay for a Wedding Weekend!
text: We stayed at the Ace as a wedding guest. The bar lobby area was very comfortable and the perfect place to meet with the group before and after our event. The staff was gracious and always attentive! The rooms were comfortable!

title: 全てがステキ！
text:
ステキな建物、フロントの方がフレンドリーで親切！
誕生日に宿泊しましたが、お部屋にワインのサービスもあり、嬉しかったです。
イタリアンのディナーをコースで食べに行きましたがとてもおいしかったです！！
ジムを無料で利用できますが、ジーンズしかなかったので諦めました笑

title: Excellent hotel, amazing location
text: We stayed at the Ace for a weekend, just to get away and have some fun in NYC. The hotel was great, clean, and staffed by friendly and helpful people. Our room was cool and the bed was super comfortable!! The location is awesome, as well -- we walked over to the High Line, down to Greenwich Village, up to Central Park... Will definitely stay at the Ace again!

title: Wonderful Stay with an Amazing Staff
text:
My company needed a place to work and stay for a group of 20 and Ace is the place! The staff in the hotel was incredible. From the front desk, to the bartenders, baristas at the coffee bar to the cleaning staff, everyone was helpful, smiling and so pleasant. The conference room was a great space to work in and really helped us have a successful week in New York. 

They are very good about checking your VAX card and following all the safety guidelines which lead to my entire team feeling safe.

It was centrally located and so this made it nice to get to see a few sights and grab great bites in the city!

title: Fun stay
text:
Overall- hotel staff is amazing!  Everyone was very nice.  We enjoyed the happy hour in the bar each evening.  Loved the music and dj. All the bartenders gave amazing service.  Hotel was very clean.   

Our bathroom sink was clogged when we arrived.  We called and they sent someone up right away to fix it- great service. Loved the big refrigerator in the room and the mini bar beverage and snack choices.  Also loved the Rudy's barbershop products in the bath.     

Room- Our room layout was a little quirky.  The toilet and bathroom sink were crowded in one corner.  It was hard to stand at the sink without hitting the toilet.  The bathtub/shower was also oddly placed.  It was very narrow and hard to take a shower without constantly hitting the shower curtain (which was a circle surrounding the tub) Our mattress seemed old and caved in a bit.  We had to place towels over the bathroom doors at night as the sunlight still came in through the shades in the morning.  

Food- 
Loved the Stumptown coffee shop that it attached to the hotel.  Very tasty coffee and great service. Also loved the Black Seed Bagel shop. So convenient to not have to leave the hotel for food.   Staff in the morning at the coffee bar was great.  They brought us water even though we already purchased food from Stumptown. 

I would definitely return again but would like to stay in a different room.

title: Dirty and mice in lobby
text:
Staying at the Ace Hotel with my unvaccinated child right now. We are big Ace Hotel fans and frequent the Palm Springs hotel regularly.  Honestly I am afraid to touch anything here. This place is not clean and certainly not compliant with the cleanliness policies they are advertising. 

Walked to the lobby at 6am to get coffee (no coffee till 7am) and saw a mouse running across the floor. Staff saw the mouse but did nothing. Maybe this is acceptable in NYC? Makes me think twice about eating at the Breslin again. 

Doors in the rooms are covered in months, possibly years of grime. Surfaces in rooms not cleaned. My daughter picked up the guitar in our room and then the light caught the dirt and grime build up. It’s probably never been cleaned. 

On the up side, the hotel is in a great location. Reception and building engineer staff are absolutely lovely and happy to help. They are the best thing about this hotel.

I will never stay here again, sorry Ace Hotel.

title: Doing it right
text:
If you are going to Manhattan do it right. Stay In Manhattan but far enough from Times Square so you’re not inundated with tourists. If you’re somehow trying to bring a car into the city there’s a reasonable parking agreement within the same block.

Ace is a place you can grow with—low cost but clean and functional rooms up to full multi-room suites. Variety of food and transport options nearby.

Do NYC right, stay here.

title: Great end-of-Covid experience
text: First trip back into the City as Covid was on the wane. Not our first time at the Ace, though, which is always a great experience. Very good protocols in place for cleanliness and masking, but not overly fussy. Felt like a great balance between safety and fun. Very quickly moved us to a new room when the A/C was having trouble. Easy casting to TV from your own device. Feels well-suited to the modern (and tech-savvy) traveler. Recommended without reservation.

title: A Wonderful Stay in the Heart of Manhattan
text:
My friends and I booked a room at the Ace Hotel, located in the center of Manhattan,  just steps away from the Flatiron building and Herald Square.

We got the Open Loft Suite, which was a massive space and had a beautiful view of the city.

The Ace Hotel staff were all very accommodating and helpful.  A big shoutout to Jenn, Christina and Freddy for guiding us through the booking and check-in process! 

I will certainly be back here again and I recommend this hotel for anyone visiting New York City.

title: A Wonderful Staff & Exquisite Design Rule Here
text: I've stayed at Ace NYC a handful of times during the last 5-10 years & it has always been a wonderful experience. The rooms are all interestingly designed, comfortable, & quiet. The lobby has an amazing ambiance - I wish I could live there! Stumptown Coffee's offerings are wonderful & The Breslin's food is fantastic. Also, Ace NYC is well-located in Manhattan - it's incredibly easy to walk or use the subway to get anywhere.

title: Great location and great hotel
text: The ace hotel in NYC was an incredible stay. The staff was kind, the location is great, and the room was very nice and clean. The lobby bar was fun and the drinks were great. We loved everything about our stay at the Ace.

title: NYC Bohemian Chic. Amazing stay.
text:
Had to stay for a work trip, and instantly fell in love.

The design and atmosphere are stellar. It feels fun, and cool just to be a guest.

The Common area transforms from Day-to-night from being a coffee bar lounge, to a great bar with great bartenders.

Would book here again 100%

title: Friendly Staff, Amazing Stay
text: The staff in the WHOLE hotel were incredible.  From the front desk to the barista at the coffee bar to the cleaning staff, everyone was helpful, smiling and overall so pleasant.  The lobby was a great space to work in as I arrived early and wasn't able to check in yet. I would 100% stay here again!

title: Stellar Staff — they went above and beyond!
text:
The Ace New York staff were stellar!

We got engaged the night before our arrival, and when we entered our room, the staff had hand-drawn a congratulations letter with a special picture just for us. Not to mention that they arranged for a room with a view of the Empire State Building (nice touch).

The staff remained extremely friendly and helpful throughout our entire stay, making the Ace Hotel New York an undeniable contender for our next trip.

Thank you, Ace Hotel New York staff! You made this trip something to remember for a very long time!

title: Very nice, affordable and accommodating
text: They held our bags for us after check out which was convenient for us to go get coffee and breakfast. they also made sure to put aside a suit and computer charger that we left in the room, we realized shortly after leaving and went back to get it.

title: Management went above and beyond
text: Andy Plants took great care of me and my son on our recent trip to the Ace hotel. When the shower was giving us problems he took prompt action to have us moved and comped us with tasty pastries and coffee in the lively lobby. When my son left his fitbit in the room and UPS failed to pick it up from security, he personally took care of it. The Ace Hotel in NYC aid a forever friend

title: Amazing Staff and a great location!
text: The staff at the ACE Hotel was amazing! Anything we needed/questioned - there was no hesitation on making our stay comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want a chic/trendy/fun stay in NYC. The lounge was also great. Great meeting area to meet our friends for a quick drink before we left to explore NYC.

title: Exhale. Everything is perfect.
text: First meet was with Freddy…kind and helpful. Met and was greeted by many more lovely people. The bed is the best and every touch point was perfectly thought through. The luxury is in the effortless way of living at Ace. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

title: Amazing Experience
text: The Ace hotel is going to be our go-to for frequent trips to the city from upstate. The staff is so friendly and accommodating, and the location is great—I love to be able to walk the dogs to Madison Sq Park, and there are so many incredible restaurants in the area. Our room was phenomenal, with a fully stocked mini bar and snacks, and honestly the best beds and shower in Manhattan for this price. The vibe in the lobby is great, and the staff really goes above and beyond to make it a great experience. Definitely book if you have the chance!

title: Stylish Hotel but Needs Updates
text:
The hotel is modern and stylish. Our room was large and had almost everything a typical hotel should have. Two points for improvement here - would be nice to either have coffee in the room or access to complimentary coffee in the Lobby. Also, the TV in our room did not work which wasn't a huge deal for us but should be working in a hotel room. 

The main issue we had with our stay was there was no AC in our room that we were able to control. Our stay was the last week of May so the weather was warm and a bit humid. We were walking around the city and returned to the hotel hoping for some cool air. Our room was warm so we called downstairs to ask why our AC was not working and the concierge was very friendly but told us the hotel was on a two pipe system and we would not be able to adjust in our room. He said the best thing to do would be turn the air off completely. We tried this and ended up sweating most of the night. I'm not sure how people would stay in this hotel in the summertime without the ability to have AC. If the Ace fixed this issue, I would definitely stay here again. The lobby is a fun place to hangout and has a great vibe.

title: Aces
text:
This isn't the sexiest opening line, but I was in town for a Bat Mitzvah. Everyone else was staying at some generic hotel but I decided to give myself a treat: book a room at The Ace.

This was my first trip on the tail end of the pandemic. I didn't know how much I needed it but boy oh boy did I need it.

So great walking the streets of NYC, watching the city wake up from the Hell of Shelter-In-Place.

I loved the vibe in the lobby. I loved the vibe in my room, I even requested a guitar (a best kept secret).

Do yourself a favor, book a room, take a trip to NYC...live again!

title: おしゃれインテリアだけど…
text:
おしゃれなインテリア、1Fのカフェはとってもよかったです。
朝食も1度、1階のレストランで食べました。おいしかったです。地下にジムもあり、長期滞在でも楽しめました。
ですが、フロントスタッフの愛想は最悪です。忙しいのはわかりますが、丁寧さのかけらもありません。アメリカのホテルだなーと、思いました。英語ネイティブでない日本人の私が、聞き返しても、同じスピードとトーンで話すフロントスタッフ。おもてなしとは、程遠いです。
部屋のバスタブにお湯を張ろうとしたら、噂通りの錆水が出てきました。
エレベーター前の部屋だったのですが、夜中まで廊下で騒いでいる人もいました。おそらく、地下にクラブみたいなのがあるのですが、そのお客さんが間違えて、上まで来てル人で、うるさくて寝れませんでした。
おしゃれでいいんだけど、次は泊まらないかな笑

title: Bellissimo
text:
Hotel bellissimo,
Arredamento stupendo 
Servizi ottimi, bellissima esperienza
Cucina deliziosa ai ristoranti 
Consigliatissimo e ben posizionato per la visita alla città.
Atmosfera meravigliosa anche nella hall che e’ anche un locale!

title: Great experience
text: This is a fantastically done hotel. Very cool vibe and decor.  The Coffee/ Bar/ Lounge feel is just perfect.  Ace never disappointing, but this stay was very cool as NYC always is fun.  I recommend asking for a high floor.

title: Another Awesome Ace Adventure
text:
Once again another excellent stay at the Ace NYC— thanks everyone!

The Ace doesn’t have a loyalty program, points or platinum thresholds because they’ve opted to have an amazing staff instead. I’d much rather feel secure, accounted for, appreciated and well-fed by a group of fantastic folks than be controlled by some multi-national corporation’s marketing department. 

The Ace NYC is not just my home away from home— my house is sadly the place away from the Ace.

title: A Night at the Ace
text: I needed a place to crash for the evening and was able to get a room for the night. The check-in process was seamless. The surrounding area is great for quick walks to grab a bite or partake in local activities. I have stayed at several properties (Los Angeles, Palm Springs, Shoreditch and now, New York) and have always enjoyed my experiences. Thank you!

title: Ace by name...and nature
text: So I wasn’t sure what to expect. I travelled with my son and we got a double room with 2 double beds. It was fairly basic but comfortable. Great view of the Empire State Building. Service from everyone was excellent. Really good recommendations for local restaurants.  The vibe is cool but friendly. The bar is very popular and the restaurant is good. Fantastic location in Nomad and extremely reasonable compared to many other hotels including its sister hotel. I’d recommend it for all of the above.

title: Hip and Happy
text: I stayed at the Ace Hotel for 4 nights - and I gotta tell you,  it was great. I never slept so well!! The staff are friendly and responsive. The room was not huge, but laid out very well, and felt more spacious than it probably was. No amenity was spared. Loved the vintage accents with record player and cool records to play. The lobby has such a hip vibe and there were things going every night which made me not go straight up to my room and stay a little longer at the bar before I went to bed. I am happy for my choice and will stay there again and again!

title: Winter Break stay
text: Loved everything about your hotel! The front office staff, bell hop, bartenders... all excellent. Loved the room and the uniqueness of the property. Next time I will try to eat at the Breslin. I heard it is fabulous. You all were very helpful and accommodating. Even helping us get a cab. Can’t wait to come back again!

title: Just Love It!
text: Great place, so laid back. A true icon of NYC. Here for a break and certainly got that. Just stepping inside the doors, you fall into a different world of; slow, relaxed and quirky. I would recommend this place to anyone. Have stayed in NYC a few times and this is the only place to stay in future. Breakfast was good, service was attentive, reception was responsive and the room very cool and individual.

title: Great Experience
text: I've traveled to NYC regularly but recently took a job that is headquartered off Canal Street. I stayed at the Ace Hotel and the staff was exceptionally helpful, offered recommendations for food within walking distance and were all extremenly welcoming. There's also a tremendous coffee shop, bar and restaurant at the base of the hotel. Additionally, I filled out a survey that was sent to me and mentioned that a few treadmills weren't working, The front desk manager reached out to me directly to apologize and let me know they have replacements coming in the next few weeks. This kind of attention to detail makes means the world to me while Im traveling for work. Even though its an 15min uber ride away from work, I'll be staying here again. The name Ace isn't a coincidence, this place kicks ass.

title: Best boutique hotel I’ve stayed
text:
I was mumbling to friends about thinking I was getting too old for boutique hotels after a couple of bad experiences but staying at Ace in NY changed my mind.

They do the cozy, hip thing right and they don’t forget about the details you’d only thought to find in big chains, such as an amazing restaurant (do try the lamb burger at The Breslin).

The room was bigger than most places I’ve stayed in NYC and the location is perfect, as up midtown as I’m comfortable visiting.

Ah, and if you have a beard like I do, they have a discount at their neighbor Rudy’s.

Will definitely stay again!

title: Consistently Awesome
text: I've stayed at ACE NYC a number of times.  Every time things are just perfect.  Gracious hospitality, clean extremely well appointed rooms, great lobby bar and superb staff.  Thank you for always making me feel at home - away from home!!

title: best hotel to stay in New York
text: very warm welcome at the reception, the room was very clean and homey, hotel stuff very nice and helpful. the hotel is placed in a very good location, walking distance from all important places to visit, very near to Times square, excellent position, very good experience, I would definitely go back and strongly recommend it

title: Amazing Experience!
text: For my husband’s birthday we stayed several nights at the Ace hotel last week. I thought nothing can surprise us as we travel a lot, but I was wrong. We stayed at a really nice and spacious suite with an amazing view on Broadway. The hotel room felt like at home, which does not happen often. Also, staying at Ace hotel, I felt like a time traveler. Its vintage style is unique. Moreover, my room had a vinyl record player with discs and a real guitar! Can you imagine that? My husband plays, so this was a real treat for us. It is important to mention how comfortable the bed was.The food in the Breslin is delicious, and the hotel staff is helpful and very friendly. The location cannot be more perfect – it is the heart of Manhattan. Definitely, we will be coming back. Thank you for this wonderful experience!

title: great hotel on great location
text:
I stayed for 5 nights in January and I must say I really enjoyed my stay.
Nice, stylish and clean room with a fantastic view.
Good gym, open 24/7
Great atmosphere at the lobby bar with DJ. 
Friendly and helpful staff.

title: Great Location
text: Room extremely comfortable, loved having a turntable in there, and a super hip place to stay. Staff was extremely helpful and kind. Great location and would go back in a minute. Also, the coffee shop, bagel shop and The Breslin was all top notch!

title: the coolest, nicest, most accommodating hotel
text: the staff at the Ace went above and beyond to ensure that I had a comfortable stay! They even left me flowers in my room :) I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to sleep like a baby in their ultra comfy beds and be treated with 5 star care. I felt very at home at the Ace and am looking forward to my next trip.

title: Buena ubicación y ambiente newyorkino
text:
Este hotel tiene una situación buena y estratégica en el mapa de la ciudad de Nueva York: está próximo de atracciones turísticas como Times Square y tiene muchos servicios cerca (metro, Starbuck's, restaurantes, centros comerciales...). Además, nos dieron una habitación con vistas al Empire State, algo que no nos esperamos. Las habitaciones están bien equipadas y son bastante amplias (al menos la doble de 4 personas). El personal de recepción y limpieza es muy amable y eficaz y en el bar, hay siempre mucha gente y marcha. Todo esto a un precio bastante razonable para un hotel con esta ubicación y características en Manhattan. 

En cuanto a cosas que mejorar, creo que deberían revistar el sistema de las ventanas pues entra un poco de frío en las juntas. Pero únicamente lo digo como sugerencia, porque repetiría sin duda en este hotel.

title: An incredible stay
text: We spent a week in this fantastic hotel. The ambiance was amazing, the staff friendly and accommodating. The room was incredible, with both rooms having views of  Empire State Building. It was perfect...

title: Hip stay
text: Ace is a hip hotel. Everything in the room was good. Good big table to work or eat. Big comfy bed. But it would have been nice if they provide at least 2 bottles of water as complimentary. The bar downstairs is always happening but I think it was too dimly-lit and made the lobby and lift area way too dark.

title: Finally a decent hotel in NYC
text: I had a good stay here in mid December and would recommend it to anyone.  folks were friendly, the room was good and I enjoyed the bar.  Stayed at a bunch of similar places in NYC and this is the best..

title: Great hotel.
text:
An excellent stay over the Christmas period at Ace Hotel. 
Lovely hotel with the added bonus of a coffee shop in the lobby which was very welcome. 
The staff were very helpful and our room was kept immaculate. 
Perfect location for exploring NYC.

title: Ideal for the Under Assistant West Coast Promo Man in New York for Meetings Who Wants to Work on His App on the Side
text:
TL;DR: More stylish than most; may not be approporiate for all business travelers or your parents.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Ace Hotel in New York, though the hotel may not be for everyone.  The room is like someone's downtown studio apartment, not a hotel room.   This is reflected in ways both good (great decor, record player in the room, super comfortable bed with nice wool blanket) and somewhat annoying (no place to put toiletries near the sink; showerhead is directly overhead; why does the TV face the bathroom door instead of any actual seating surface?!?).   But you're not staying at the Ace to drift off to Law & Order reruns with a half-empty glass of minibar chardonnay on the nightstand.  Truth be told, as I got used to the room's idiosyncracies, I started to enjoy them.  And most importantly, the service was excellent.  

A word on the lobby: it has more millenials hunched over laptops than you can shake a stick at.  The lobby bar, coffee shops, and restaurants connected to the hotel are good, but the vibe might be too hectic for some people.  Great if you're a junior brand manager who's used to hotdesking it; less great if you're hoping to have a casual, quiet meeting over cocktails.

There are a lot of fun, cool hotels in New York (especially in the NoMad/Chelsea/Gramercy area); the Ace is one of them and I'd definitely stay there again.

title: So much fun you don't have to leave the hotel.
text: I come to NYC once a quarter and I can honestly say that I love coming and staying at the Ace.  Yes, some of the small rooms are SMALL, but if you go for a medium room or larger you'll be just fine.  Hey, you are in NYC, get out and enjoy the town.  Also, the great thing about the Ace is that if you don't want to go exploring there's a lot of social activity down in the lobby.  I haven't been in a hotel that offers the scene that the Ace does.  If it's raining or snowing and you don't want to fight the subway, just go downstairs for a cocktail and do some people watching.

title: Disappointed with Ace.
text: Ace is known as a hipster hotel, and I have visited the Los Angeles ACE hotel and observed the Ace design format and the many people around the property working very hard to seem and look very hip, but I did not see much that impressed.  So,

title: Cool hotel downtown!
text: We loved our stay at the ACE. We’re “Boomers,” but it is so much fun to stay at a place with a punk vibe - the “basic black” design is wonderful - the staff was great, loved the room service - and the Stumptown downstairs - what more can I say?

title: Thanksgiving week in NYC
text: Arty hotel. Cool decor. Got a spacious room on the top floor. Lovely view from my window. Snow was so beautiful over the weekend. Lobby is always crowded. Milk Flagship store is just at the ground floor of the hotel.

title: Very Good, Very Good ... Very Good
text:
This unique hotel is unlike other chain hotels.  It has their own style with a clean, well organized, back to 50s antique taste that stands out among other hotels. They even have a guitar with artsy paintings in their room....very unique. Their location is very convenient that's walkable to everywhere as well as nearby subway.  Their coffee shop as well as their restaurant/bar are right there in the lobby area along with their chefs and stuffs are just awesome, friendly and courteous.  They even have a gym that's located in the basement area. Please take note of this hotel's busy event schedule with a monthly listing of events that fit for everyone from music, dancing, shopping or simply speakers on various topics.
Overall, I will give an "A"ce to this hotel for very good location, very good food, very good stuffs and services, and very good and unique styles.  The only drawback from giving a 5 rating is their tight space as well as their low lightings (with everywhere painted black).

title: Definitely will return
text: The room was immaculate and the location is excellent.  The staff was incredibly friendly whereas other hotels in the area has had staff that is somewhat aloof and disinterested. Based on the service and the quality of the room and the price comparable to other hotel rooms for the same price in the area, this is a complete win.  Other hotels that are more expensive don't deliver for this.

title: Good location
text:
A well located hotel in the Midtown South area near Koreatown. I mainly selected this place based on location and price. It is definitely a boutique hotel  with a dimly lit lobby that also serves as sitting room from people ordering from the bar or the coffee shop.

I had a small room which was a bit bigger than what I had imagined it to be. My only complaint was that the heater overheated and I came back to a room that was 90 degrees. You aren't allowed to control the heater on/off switch so staff had to come and manually shut it off. Since the weather was not bad I decided to go without heating rather than have to call staff to turn the heater back on and hope it didn't overheat again.

title: Ace hotel awesomeness!
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Ace Hotel. Loved the convenience of the coffee and bagel shop! The orange juice that we were served in the lobby was AMAZING!!! Maybe the highlight of the stay....seriously!

title: NYC for the Holidays
text: Friendly staff across the board!  Nice accommodations.  Descent location.  Coffee shop,  bar, restaurants all on site and or within minutes away.  Not as congested as Time Square area.  There’s always some kind of renovations or construction,  pan handlers,  garbage,  along with the tens of thousands of people on the street making your walk-a-bouts a bit annoying.  This place is just off the beaten path to at least cross off the super congested...

title: Great stay!
text:
Our stay at Ace Hotel was awesome. The staff there is very friendly and was always helpful whenever we had any requests (including storing our bags on our last day after we checked out.) 

The rooms were a great size, especially for New York. Felt very clean and had everything we needed. The location was perfect - far enough away from the chaos and crowds that you didn’t feel constantly emerged in it, but close enough to all the main attractions. My wife and I walked mostly everywhere, but did use the subway a few time’s for some of the further destinations and the Ace Hotel is perfectly situated to catch the subway easily. 

Would definitely stay there again when we go back!

title: The coolest hotel in New York!
text:
The vibe at this hotel is staggering cool.  The minute you walk into the lively lobby it sets the tone for the rest of the hotel.  Rooms were comfortable, complete with well stocked Smeg fridge mini bar. Hot power showers, fluffy towels, toiletries and comfortable beds. No noise. 
Great location. Close to Empire State and Fifth Ave. Easy for getting around.  Every night there are different events held in the lobby, the puzzle night was brilliant and our teenagers enjoyed it. Stumptown Coffee next to the lobby serves the best coffee and pastries. Actually the best mocha I've ever had. There's also a cool shop selling Vans and skateboard gear.  The gym was well equipped. We all loved the photobooth!  We will definitely be back.

title: Very nice stay, very good price/quality/position rate
text:
Everything was great, from the greeting to the closing of the booking. Rooms are nice, room service is efficient, te bar at the lobby is nice and the location is perfectly adapted for people who want to dico et NY. 
Thank you we had a very nice trip :)

title: Expression and Art
text: The vibe at this hotel is cool and comfort! I felt very safe And enjoy the music in the lobby and the hustle and the bustle! The rooms were interesting I had a medium king room and found it cozy. The bathroom was small but I did have a tub. A little hard to shower with the curtain because it’s narrow. Service from housekeeping was excellent. I did enjoy the turntable in my room and only played one record by Charlie Parker. The location was excellent.

title: Great Location, Friendly Staff, Comfortable, Staggeringly Hip
text:
For a quick trip to NYC this was a great place. It's close to most things but not too close, and an easy walk from Penn Station. It is sort of staggeringly hip with it's low light and steampunkish decor. Lots of people hanging out in the lobby area which was, frankly, lovely. It was nice to feel like there was a little community there. Coffee and bagels are within reach for a quick breakfast, and they're happy to get you a cab to wherever. We had a double room, which was cozy, clean, and homey without being overly extravagant. 

I'd stay again for sure.

title: Nice location
text: Perfect room and nice location with sweet services. It's very convenience to visit NYC by walking or subway. The room design is stylish but the mirror position in the bathroom is just a little higher for me(I'm 165 cm tall). Everything is great here, and I'm sure that I will stay ACE hotel next time when I visit NYC again.

title: Good Location and nice quirks
text: I'm a fan of the ACE brand so this hotel didn't disappoint.  Great check-in experience to start with.  Room is a good size for NYC little dark but but everything you need in including iron, robe, etc. I was there for work so was just a base to sleep and shower and so ticked all my boxes.  Bar downstairs was always lively but for trip i would have settled for a more extensive room service menu and a slightly firmer bed.  Nice welcome touches and I really do love the quirky little signs.

title: Underwhelming
text: I stayed here for business so I did not pay for the room but the bill came to just under $1,000 for TWO nights. This is not a $500 a night hotel (tax was nearly $100 per night). The decor has a “just graduated college and moved to New York vibe” including a wood folding table for the desk, peg board for shelves and a lamp on top of the refrigerator. Location would be fine except there is a big construction project going on and it is incredibly noisy at times. The lobby is apparently a hip place to hang out so maybe that’s driving the cost, but you certainly can find better value hotels elsewhere in Manhattan.

title: They don't quite Ace it!
text:
What I love about New York is that there are plenty of quirky hotels to experiment with rather than opting for cookie cutter Marriots of Sheratons.  And this is the point, there are plenty so to do well and get the repeat visitor they have to be good.  To be honest, I stayed at the Ace because it is a block from where my friends live.
The lobby and bar area are cool - I arrived late in the evening and the music was going strongly and there was a good buzz.  
The rooms are the wrong side of shabby-chic.  It could be brilliant, but they need a few more creature comforts rather than trading on spartan.  The pillows on the bed were very good, and the shower strong albeit small.  There are lots of details that individually are good, but they don't add up well.  the gym is good because people are ether too cool to use it, or not up early in the morning when I used it.  Again, its the detail - one of the treadmills was out of order and the bike did not work with the programme settings etc.  For what you pay these things should be fixed over-night.
I also was not happy with the $29.00 per day "destination" charge.  This is a stealth tax by any other name.  For your $29.00 you get free internet (er...that's not free), a 10% discount in the bars etc (er...so you have to spend over $290.00 to make the 10% discount worth it).  I did not have the charge explained to me on check in but was rather abruptly told it was detailed in the confirmation e mail of the booking.  (er..who reads them?). So, I'll make it easy for you - add $29.00 to your day rate, and then the tax and then the New York tax etc etc.  Ace need to drop this charge, it is not a resort where these things are more common.  So, of this style of hotel there are certainly better, and not too far from the Ace Hotel

title: Cool hotel in the heart of the ciy
text: The Ace Hotel is a perfect spot for me to stay while visiting NYC for work or for fun. It's centrally located and within walking distance of anywhere south of the park.  The Breslin restaurant is perfect for breakfast or dinner and stays open late.  The lobby bar is a great work space and I often find myself working late into the afternoon and sliding effortlessly into happy hour without having to change location.  I have stayed here a number of times and would recommend to anyone who wants an affordable spot that's central to all of Midtown and below.

title: Birthday weekend
text: View from our room, great size , super comfy bed, industrial sheik, bathroom kinda tight, Uber hipster lobby club vibe at night, expensive drinks, cool fridge sizes, great location. Would steal that bed, overall nice stay. Did feel it was maybe too cool for us cool 50 somethings,lol!  The large room was awesome space for NYc.

title: Ace New York is awesome!
text:
They are awesome! Great welcome from the front desk, super friendly bartenders, beautiful room that was super clean! 

I would recommend Ace New York to anyone looking for a fun, lively environment to hang out in. The lobby is loaded with people meeting and hanging out. Makes for a great place to grab a drink and some snacks. 

Also, we grabbed a latte every morning from the attached Stumptown, super convenient!

title: Loved it!
text: Have had some terrible rooms in NYC over the years and am so happy to have finally stayed at Ace after many recommendations. The room was quite spacious and super cute. I will definitely stay again during my future business visits as location is also ideal!

title: Totally Ace!
text:
We managed to stay a few nights at the Ace Hotel in New York in their Loft Open Floor Plan room. The room and general hotel services are excellent. The size and spaciousness of the Loft is well worth the price - extremely comfortable and room to move. Given this was a work trip, it was great to have space to work from in the room.

This was important as the idea of working downstairs in the lobby was not an option. It's intensely busy all day as it's open to the public.

Bathrooms could do with some storage space given how big these rooms are - there's really nowhere to put your toiletries but other than that, an excellent stay.

Heating unit is noisy and you wouldn't want that going on during the night, but thankfully we didn't really need it at all. 

The Breslan was excellent, as was the coffee shop doing a mean brew.

title: Hip Even for the Menopausal
text: The best part of the stay was the staff. From front desk, to housekeeping, to room service delivery, everyone was helpful, pleasant and responsive. My only complaint is there’s no place for hotel guests to sit in the lobby. Before and after my meetings it was packed with people working on their computers. Maybe a lounge area exclusively for guests somewhere?

title: Great Funky Hotel
text: This is my 4th stay here this year. I have to say it’s a great hotel. No 2 rooms are the same this time I had a queen room with a view of the Empire State. I also booked a bunk room for my niece while I was in town and this room was great as well. The showers are strong the rooms at night quiet and dark and the beds so comfy. The Breslin next door serves great food the bar is fab and the location and neighbourhood is amazing. I am going to be returning in December . This time in checkin I was greeted by Freddy he could not have been more helpful friendly and polite. Love this hotel can’t wait to come back.

title: Excellent!
text:
the hotel design and the atmosphere outstanding. Industrial design in the room, that are very generous in size and extremetly comfortable. Big design fridge and desk.
Initially the room at the 2nd floor was a bit noisy and with small window, then moved to top floor. Amazing view! All is great, ranging from bedsheets to all accessories in the room and of course the infomal (that is positive in the sense you fell being at home) and extremely good service. 
gym well kept and well equipped.
Congratulation I will be back!

title: Bring your own lighting and check your bar bill
text: We had a room with 2 double beds. The room was very spacious, but there was a lot of wasted space. The hotel was formerly apartments, so it would have been a studio apt. There was ample space to put more storage. The bathroom had a strange layout and no storage. I had to stand in he middle of the tub sideways in order to be under the shower head. The bed was comfortable and the housekeeping was prompt. Now, on to the lighting. The room was very dark. There were a few lamps which really didn’t cast much light. It was very hard to put makeup on. Now for the lobby. There was a hipster vibe with darkness and people just sitting and staring at their computer screens. I don’t know what they do, but it must be the cooler Starbucks crowd who come for the stumptown coffee (there’s one in the lobby).  Our room rate included a destination fee which entitles you to certain discounts at he lobby bar and certain meals in the restaurant. You have to charge it to your room. Not once, but twice at the bar we had to point this out to our server despite the fact that we gave them our room number and it was on the bill. I have a feeling this happens often. I wonder how many people bother questioning it, but for a $29 destination fee I was questioning it. The bar service was extremely spotty and indifferent. Old fashioned was tasty though. There was live opera on one of the nights in the bar area which was awesome. It was a strange mix of beautiful singing mixed with glasses clinking and cocktail shakers shaking. A cool hotel but I think I’ll stay elsewhere next time.

title: I adored staying here!
text: The lobby was a great place to hang out before check-in (or any time really), my room was spacious and beautifully decorated, and everyone was friendly! I loved that the elevator required keycards to operate, I loved that my room had a table in it for getting work done and for eating, and my bed was very comfortable! Plus, the location couldn't have been more perfect. I'm so glad I decided to stay at the Ace Hotel!

title: Super!!
text:
4 fantastic nights! 
The best thing for me was the staff: 
Do you know that feeling that you come to a place and everybody is nice, but you are wondering if they’re just nice for the tip or because it’s their job? 
All the staffmembers I met we’re just nice because they ARE nice persons! Friendly, helpfull and with a real smile. Thanks!
The rooms we’re also perfect and I loved breakfast at the Breslin.
The only thing I could say that you can approve is that it’s really cold in the lobby and the Breslin.... and the t-shirts I wanted to buy we’re not there in every size (Large shirts we’re very rare in All the prints)
Greetings Wil from Holland

title: Home away from home.
text: I have been staying at the Ace since 2011 and it is always a home away from home.  I love everything about Ace; location, photo booth, The Breslin, the cool affirmations written on the walls, etc. You can walk around the corner and get an excellent 90 minute massage for $70.  I will return!  THANK YOU

title: Great Hotel, great location.
text: We stayed at the Ace Hotel during our one Week visit to New York. Really hip hotel at a great location! We stayed in a medium King room which was very spacious. Hotel staff was really helpful and polite. Highly recommend.

title: Needs updating
text:
The positives:
the location is pretty good
the staff were friendly and efficient
The room itself was clean
The bed was comfortable

After that it goes a bit downhill. 

First impressions is that it's trying too hard - industrial run down feel, lighting so low you can't see anything. A very trendy lobby bar that it was impossible to get a space in. 

The corridors are dark and unwelcoming, with people's room service trays left on the floor for hours and hours - I passed some one evening and they were there when I left the following morning.

The room left much to be desired. 
The housekeeping seemed OK - it was clean, just very dated. Everything geared towards the aesthetic rather than comfort. The bathroom again was clean, the shower fairly powerful, but the bath very small indeed and the door didn't close properly.

The room was a touch cramped - you couldn't walk around the bed due to the positioning of the "desk" attached to the wall. Only one bed side table, no wardrobe - just a few hangers and a hook on the wall. Aircon panel partially unattached, staining to the ceiling, old carpet, ripped sheets, the musk of mildew throughout. 

If they switched the effort that has gone in to the "vibe" and put it in to maintenance and some upgrades it could be very nice and a cool place to stay, but at this time it just feels rather run down and expensive for what you get.

title: Cool place in right location
text:
Everything was great! Check in and out was fast and correct. Thanks for the upgrade though. I’m always happy when people/Hotels remember guests for multiple visits. 
Location is great, and Ace is just a cool place - easy said.

title: Lovely is an understatment
text:
Disclaimer: I'm relatively old and normally don't fare well at *hip* hotels. That said, I was blown away by the superb service I received at this Ace Hotel, particularly the staff at the Brexlin restaurant and the front desk. 

Dallin was a life saver after a ridiculously long flight from Seoul. He somehow found a way to help me out at the last minute after my reservation at a nearby hotel was booked on a wrong day.

Above and beyond, lovely, fabulous. All of those words are understatements but I'll be back to experience more and perhaps write more!

title: Superb service
text:
We actually stayed at the Ace for the first time when it opened 10 years ago and were impressed - value for money, buzzy, great location and service.

We were looking for a hotel for a week stay with our two small kids. We opted for the Ace again, but I was apprehensive about the quality given its age.

I shouldn’t have worried. The room was perfect with two large beds (they moved us to a higher floor so we had more daylight - and a view of the Empire State Building). The service was fab - personal, efficient and friendly.

As a base, the location is great and it still retains it’s hip, edgy and buzzing vibe I remember from a decade ago. I just couldn’t make use of the club this time with the two kids in tow!

title: Beware! It’s a prison!
text:
Beware! Stay far away!

Tried to reach my Wife staying at the Ace Hotel in NY due to an emergency.
It was 7am, I told the receptionist Scott Bower my wife’s name and room number...anyone could tell from my voice that I was desperately trying to reach her. Scott said it’s to early to call a guest room as they might wake the guests up. I insisted it was an emergency and he asked to call back at 9am...upon my insistence, he passed/transferred me on to security at the hotel where the person was rude, loud and unwavering, saying that he didn’t care what the reason was, that I should call back post 9am. 

Why would anyone want to stay in a hotel that responds in this way to an emergency that a hotel guest might have with his/her family? ACE, you are not in the business of service? You seem to be running a prison! 

Boycott this hotel!

title: Worst New York hotel experience in a very long time
text:
My friend and I booked this hotel months in advance of our arrival. We spent 5 nights during New York World Pride. We booked this hotel based on friends who loved this hotel in the past. The operative word here is past. 

The glory days of the Ace Hotel New York are in the past. For the price we paid, we expected a first rate experience. It was not. It was possibly the worst hotel experience I've had in a long time. 

I went to visit the hotel two weeks in advance of our arrival. I wanted to see what our room would look like. I waited a full 45 minutes for a sales person to show me a room. A sales person never presented themselves despite asking reception three different times. btw: very haughty staff. 

Upon our arrival we discover that our room is woefully out of date. 
* USB ports? Nope. 
* Old TV that you could not mirror with devices. The TV didn't work for two days. And the channels meh. No premium cable channels. 
* Electrical outlets that didn't work, were too loose to keep plugged in and non-existent.    One side of the bed had none. 
* Musty corridors and carpets
* Tattered furnishings.
* No desk or work space
* Tiny bathroom 
* Old sheets and towels
* Haughty, unhelpful and rigid reception desk staff. 
* A room with barely any electrical lights. 
* A beautiful '50's style fridge loaded with alcohol. When I asked reception to have the booze removed they informed me I would be charged $75 US. This sent me over the edge. Were staff aware that former owner Alex Calderwood, 47, was found dead in the Ace hotel in east London hotel surrounded by alcohol and a makeshift crack-cocaine pipe??

Fortunately, a manager that was brought in from out of town came to the rescue and did the best she could do manage our issues. If it had not been Pride week with all major hotels books weeks ahead, I would have insisted they allow us to cancel our reservation. 

The Ace Hotel was once famous for their fabulous parties. The parties during our stay were a big bust. 

Alex Calderwood ran a brand renowned for its style and affordability. Each of his venues were filled with vintage and reconditioned furniture with street art decorating the rooms that would appeal to the creative class.

Sadly with his passing, so did his vision and extraordinary creativity.

title: Ace Hotel NY
text:
We stayed for five nights and we enjoyed the hotel very much. Our room was very clean and quiet; the bed was so comfortable that we got excellent, restful sleep. 

The bathroom? - slightly tired look but very clean. No complaints there (thank you to the maintenance staff).

The Breslin restaurant accessible from the lobby - good food and great coffee. Their breakfast kept us going for many hours.

We also appreciated some unique touches: the wall against elevators and my favorite - the fresh towel requests instructions. Very funny!

The front desk staff made the check in and check out very quick and efficient.

Thank you for making our stay enjoyable.

title: Feels Like a Cheap Motel
text:
I stayed here for a week for work. There needs to be a lot of improvements. This Ace is not the same as the others I've stayed in. Public spaces were nice but it was a shocker when I opened my room.

Pros:
- Location was amazing. So close to the office and Koreatown!
- Staff at reception was super friendly.
- Room service was very fast, food pretty good.
- Cleaning crew always did a good job.
- View was nice, direct shot of the Empire State Building.

Cons:
- Bathroom is too old, tiles cracking, stained tub/sink, looks like the original tiny bathroom layout.
- Bathtub did not drain well, always water filling up during showers.
- Bathtub was the smallest I've ever seen.
- Moldy smell in the room.
- Plaster on ceiling was cracking and falling off.
- TV did not work for a couple of days. Some channels were not available.
- Called twice to get an extra pillow, staff was nice and said they would bring to room but pillow never showed. This happened at two different times during the week.
- Not enough electrical plugs.
- Lights at bed were not the easiest to turn on and off.
- Phone was confusing to use, room service button always went to reception instead of kitchen.

Overall would not stay here again. I wanted a mid to upper tier, unique hotel but this felt more like a college dorm or cheap motel. Photos make it look hip and cool but in reality it just looks tired and old. Time for a renovation.

title: Clever, charming, comfy...
text:
Definitely different from your bland hotel chain. Surprising touches such as hooded sweatshirt like bathrobes, wonderful black soap, Smeg fridge filled with any beverage you could crave... 
Bed was wonderful and room quiet and clean.
Staff is friendly. Jason at the front desk made check in especially easy!!
Good eats and strong coffee at the attached Breslin Restaurant. 
The only thing I missed was a bathtub.

title: Work stay - 1 week
text:
Firstly I would like to say the that staff on reception are amazing, and so so helpful! Unfortunately I would not stay here again for the following reasons:
- Lobby so full that residents can't relax there/even get a seat. This meant that unless you want to go to the Breslin restaurant it's hard to get a bite to eat unless it's room service 
- Rooms are so dusty and smell of mould. I know its an old building, but both rooms I stayed in were the same. AC units in need of a good clean.
- Cockroaches spotted on 3 evenings. One thing to note was that when I left for work on a morning there were room service trays left outside that had been there overnight, which could be attracting the bugs. 
- Loud (old) pipe system. I was woken up by the shower from next door daily. Not a problem for me as I was working and getting up early, but would have been annoying if on vacation
I've stayed at many of the Ace hotels in the past, and would stay at them again, but I would give the NYC one a miss. Very overpriced for what you get. Thin walls and guests having parties in their rooms with lots of (non paying) guests makes it feel a bit more like a hostel than a premium hotel.

title: Cool and hip
text: A very hipster and nice hotel, the lobby is a large bar with a buoyant scene which you have to cross in order to get to the elevators. Rooms are quite big, and if you read my reviews you'll notice I appreciate space very much; the only downside is that they tend to be a bit murky. The decor is a thoughtful take on rugged/industrial/reclaimed.The desk in room isn't very comfortable, but you can get away with working 1-1.5 hours without discomfort. Overall I would say it is a great place, specially because it feels true-NYC (whatever that means).

title: Ace hotel you did it again! The best
text:
Ace hotel is my preferred hotel when visiting Manhattan. It is the most fun, cool and well run hotel! The little details are well appointed and my room is always clean! The staff is fantastic and make you feel as if you never left home. They help in any way possible and because I’ve been staying here for years now they consider me a part of the family. 

Thank you Ace for another amazing experience.

Tommy Froelich

title: 一泊だけ
text:
急遽NY延泊が決まったのでずっと気になってたエースホテルに。一泊だけで充分でした。一番安い部屋にしたのですが、2人だとスーツケースを広げることもできず、、
ただインテリアは文句のつけようのないほど好み。フロント対応もよかったし、ロビーのバーも楽しかった。暮らすように旅するというにはもってこいの部屋かもしれませんが、一番小さな部屋に2人は無防です。また、周囲にあまり観光地らしいものもないので観光には不便かも。スーパーのターゲットが近くにあるのは◎
ずっとバスタブなしのホテル宿泊だったので、バスタブは最高だった。窓もあるし、備え付けのシャンプーもサラサラです。次泊まるならもっと広い部屋抑えると思います。

title: Très grosse déception
text:
Tous les avis positifs parlent des bons côtés de l’hôtel entre l’emplacement, la vue, et le design. 
Cependant, voici la vérité. 
Une odeur de moisissure permanente dans la chambre. Impossible d’ouvrir les fenêtres de plus de 5 centimètres. 
Un bruit non stop dehors avec les gros travaux de la rue et à l’intérieur avec l’ascenseur et le couloir où vous entendez absolument tout. 
Tout est design mais branlant. La douche s’écoule mal et ne ferme jamais complètement. Les toilettes fuient. On a du appuyer 50 fois pour stopper l’écoulement. 
Pas de rangements de la chambre ! 
Pas pratique du tout. 
Déjà des moisissures dans la baignoires et sur les joints. 
La plomberie est tellement vielle que l’on entend le voisin se doucher.  
Et pour couronner le tout, l’hôtel se garde se garde bien de vous dire qu’ils font payer 29$ par jour plus taxes pour ce qu’ils apparement destination fee qui correspond pour eux à l’accès wifi et à la gym. A ce prix là, prenez un forfait international ça vous coûtera moins cher. 
On se la joue hipster et bobo mais à éviter pour un séjour de plus de 1 nuit car ce n’est pas un hôtel.

title: Ace your New York Trip
text: Great location with a lively bar scene, delicious restaurant and even has a barbershop attached which is excellent. Excellent walking distance to many attractions. Well thought out interiors and beautiful rooms with Empire State Building views. We loved it

title: The Ace Hotel NYC is where it’s at!
text:
I stayed at the Ace Hotel NYC based on the recommendation of a close friend. It’s a very lively hotel located in bustling Midtown. The hotel staff were so friendly and accommodating. The space is visually appealing with artifacts and interesting art pieces that catch the eye. It’s a great place for the single traveler as well as families. 

If I could change one thing about the hotel is the size of the bathroom. The hotel room bathroom was really small.

title: Super emplacement , hôtel Très tendance
text: Sa situation est idéale pour découvrir NY, à pied en métro ou taxi. Les chambres sont assez grandes avec vue sur l empire State building ( pour notre chambre). La salle de bain est pratique mais très grande, comme ici à NY. Il n un pas de rangement , compliqué quand vous êtes en famille avec des enfants. Sinon c est très propre , tendance Hipster, assez dark en décoration et avec un hall d entrée très sympa pour un cocktail avec un DJ qui mix. Rapport qualité prix est top. Ne pas hésiter.

title: Perfect location for a great stay
text:
Really cool hotel in a great spot - we travelled as a family of four and shared a room: we had loads of space and the hotel kindly supplied an extra put-up bed.
The facilities in the room were fab with plenty storage and a huge Smeg fridge. We had a view of the Empire State Building from our window too.
The bathroom cosmetics were delicious too - the sent of the body wash and shampoos were divine!
We used the bar in the evenings and I can recommend the cocktail menu ... and we ate at the restaurant one morning for a delicious breakfast.
The staff were super helpful - we were able to leave luggage after checking out as we weren't due to leave until later that day and that wasn't an issue at all.

title: Hôtel hyppe dans Manhattan
text: Déco très sympa pour cet hôtel, très bien placé dans Manhattan (il y avait même une très belle guitare dans la chambre !) Possibilité d aller à pied à Times Square et métro très proche. La réception paraît un peu sombre mais on s y fait vite, des concerts y sont d ailleurs organisés. Chambre assez spacieuse pour une famille de 4 et avons eu de la chance d avoir une belle vue sur l Empire State Building ( sauf la salle de bain qui est minuscule mais reste suffisante). Par contre, on ne recommande pas d y prendre le petit déjeuner, car assez cher, alors qu à quelques pas de l hôtel, possibilité de se restaurer dans une sorte de dely...

title: new york in style, artist style
text: the staff were congenial + helpful.  i felt the property was clean + welcoming.  my room was nice, clean + spacious.  the hotel vibe is hip, yet inviting.  great food, drinks + crafted coffee.  and there's always a great soundtrack in rotation!

title: Most memorable birthday weekend!!!
text: Can't say enough about how much we loved the Ace Hotel!  I planned a surprise birthday weekend (7/26/19) for my boyfriend Ralph....Christina D. was so very helpful with the details to make this amazing weekend happen and to make Ralph's birthday (in his words) the best one of his ENTIRE life! Christina worked with me for months and really left no stone unturned. Check in was a breeze, everyone was so friendly and helpful... every single staff member we encountered during our 2 night stay went above and beyond in every way possible. When we entered our spacious and well appointed large king room on the 11th floor, we were instantly amazed by the view of the EMPIRE STATE BUILDING directly outside the window next to our bed. We enjoyed the fact that the lobby was always alive with friendly people and so much to look at and experience. Overall, we would HIGHLY recommend the Ace, Christina D., and her incredible staff for anyone hoping to have a memorable stay in the Big Apple..... Thank you, and we can't wait to see you all again!

title: Home away from home!
text: Everyone I interacted with was friendly, helpful and expedient and that’s just the usual service at The Ace. I felt relieved to arrive and grateful for the kind faces after a stressful travel experience. The Ace NY always feels comforting and welcoming when you’re alone and away from home! I love staying here when I’m in the area.

title: Why don't more hotels have turntables?
text:
Stayed here twice for fairly long work visits. I love the atmosphere, staff, location. I've stayed in smaller and larger rooms and the space is always well thought out and utilised. On a March visit the turntable was a lifesaver - was involved in a very hectic and stressful process at work, and being able to return to my room each night and put on some of my favourite records really helped me decompress. The wonderful Stumptown coffee certainly helped too...

If you can get a competitive rate then I fully recommend a stay here.

title: Hip, fun place
text: My husband and I stayed here one night during a weekend visit to NYC. You can immediately tell upon entering this is a place catering towards trendy, modern clientele. Front desk workers were friendly and super helpful. Our room was packed full of amenities. A full fridge stocked full of every kind of alcohol one might need, snacks, and even a lovers kit in case you forget something. Soft bath robes, low lighting, and even a guitar in our room - they have thought of anything and everything. I’ve never stayed anywhere that puts such an emphasis on providing what you need before you even know you need it. We ordered room service and the food was EXCELLENT. The only drawback was the bathroom. There’s zero counter space and the shower head is awkwardly positioned so that you almost fall out of the shower trying to rinse (unless you want the spray beating directly down on your head). All space is utilized so I understand why it’s set up that way, it’s just not practical. I was concerned it would be loud due to the location but I wasn’t woken by any noise outside (although I used a white noise app on my phone that may have helped). I would definitely recommend and stay again.

title: Ace Hotel is the best!
text: This is the only place I stay when I come to New York.  The rooms are comfortable and the decor is very cool. Located in Midtown, it's really easy to get around the city from there and the neighborhood itself has some great restaurants and shops.  The staff is what really makes the hotel, everyone there is super helpful and friendly, really makes staying at the Ace a top-notch experience!

title: The Ace is fantastic, but ...
text:
Overall, I love the Ace.  Have stayed there many times and been super pleased with the staff, the rooms, the overall vibe, etc.  The location is great:  away from a lot of the midtown tourist craziness, close to Madison Square Park, good restaurants, good shopping.  The bar is great, always full of a really interesting cross-section of NY life.  Everyone is kind and has a sense of humor.  This has been our go-to hotel in NY for years.    

Our recent visit, though, was marred by a very un-Ace-like interaction at the bar.  My daughter and her friend (16 and 15, both guests at the hotel) went down to the bar on Friday night to order mocktails.  (My underage kids have done this a number of times at the Ace bar.)  The bartender was dismissive and said he didn't do mocktails.  Then they asked if he could make the most standard and simple mocktail, the Shirley Temple.  The bartender said that he couldn't make one "because they didn't have grenedine."  Really?  Honestly?  He offered no other options and they left the bar frustrated and embarrassed.

My kids have always been shown kindness and respect at the Ace, so I was disappointed to hear about their experience.  The Ace can do better than that.

title: I wish I stayed more than one night
text: I was sooo impressed with the concierge/front desk staff, especially Christopher C. He was friendly, had great energy, and I appreciate his enthusiasm in sharing his favorite food cart. The hotel's interior is well designed and curated. I was so impressed my room had a desk big enough to do good work on, plus a full size smeg fridge, a turn table, and a full sized guitar!

title: A must stay/visit: this place is bonkers!
text: I’ve never stayed any place quite like the Ace Hotel.  Stayed for work and couldn’t believe the most epic lobby I’ve ever seen.  Tons of cool spaces to work and hang out, awesome decor, a bar for drinks, connected to a restaurant and coffee shop.  You kind of don’t even need to leave the place during your stay.  I booked a queen room and was delighted to get upgraded to a loft sweet.  I screamed when I walked into the room.  It felt like I had my own enormous NYC apartment: huge work table, record player with records, SMEG fridge.  This place was well designed with lots of character.  Loved the bathroom products and the claw foot tub.  I only had 2 negatives: the mattress felt a little thin and I didn’t love the pillows, and construction.... there’s a lot of it directly across the street.  I had a few too many drinks at dinner followed by drinks with my coworker at the amazing lobby bar, so I could have done without the 7AM sharp construction noise.  But 12pm checkout gave me plenty of time to clean up, fuel up and pack before heading to meetings.  They did have a key card and WiFi issue while I was there, but the staff handled both things seamlessly (literally dropped guests off at their floor and then ran up and down stairs to meet us to let us in our rooms, LOL.  Issue was resolved and we got keys a few hours later).  Considering how bumping the lobby was at 12AM, it was nice to not hear a peep in the room itself.  Stayed on the 9th floor and never heard a single neighbor.  Definitely the coolest hotel I’ve been to in NYC.  It’s a must see and a fun place to stay.

title: Best lobby bar!
text: I went to the lobby bar on a Thursday night with friends. It was quite busy but a chill atmosphere. I ordered fries and hummus, it was delish! The French waitress Julia, who served us was super nice and patient. The doorman was super cool and polite. This is a really nice place to go to!!

title: Great Room + Amazing Staff
text: It was my first time at the Ace, and I loved it. I go to New York fairly frequently, and, when I don't stay with friends, I try out different hotels. When I saw the pics on Hotels.com of guitars in the Ace rooms, I knew I wanted to try it out. I was down on business, and I knew I would want to be able to practice guitar when I wrapped up my work each day. Such a treat to have a Martin in my room. I picked a medium room, and it was a terrific size. I could write in my room without feeling claustrophobic, and I loved the shower as well. One of the elevators was down while I was there, but things like that happen. I didn't let it get me wound up. I also loved the Breslin, Blackseed, and the Stumptown coffee shop. Finally, all of the staff were wonderful. I especially loved the folks at the front desk. They were so wonderfully upbeat and helpful. I would definitely stay again.

title: My Favorite Hotel in NYC
text: Great location, comfy and large rooms, my preferred NYC hotel.  The beds are super comfy, great towels, robes, and the bar/living room area is fantastic.  Plus having stumptown coffee is a really nice touch!

title: Love/Hate Dilemma
text:
I have stayed here and at the Ace in LA consistently for several years, am back again now in Ny for 8 nights. Love the location, the ambiance, the staff, but cannot understand how this place with a lobby filled with techhies can offer so little in terms of something as simple as electrical outlets. My room has a guitar (meh, who cares), a 33 1/3 turntable + a batch of old records, (again, I don't care). What I DO care about is a place to plug in my computer - and in a double room, 2 computers, 2 ipads, 2 phones and in my case, a couple of plugs for camera batteries. Oh - and the tea pot is a nice touch, but where to plug it in??? One bed has a square outlet with one plug and that is the only accessible outlet in the room....for a place with a sense of the hip and groovy, this is a mystery.

The ACE in LA has a strip of plugs on the desk, makes it really easy. I called the front desk tonight here in LA to see if they would send up an electrical strip as I have already unplugged the record player and TV, but have not heard back from them.I'm discouraged from staying here again, considering other options, but still have a sense of affection for this place. 

While there IS a safe to lock up my laptop, there is not a place to plug it in.

title: Great Artisan Hotel
text: Stay at Ace Hotel last May and had an awesome experience. Great rooms and staff and close to all the happenings in Manhattan. Just get a little noisy at night as there's always a party at the bar. They also have a gym in the basement for all who wants to do some weights or workout. Will surely be back!

title: ACE NYC Awesome Comfortable Entertaining Hotel!
text: I took my girlfriend to the city to celebrate her bday the weekend of 5 Jul 2019. I knew that staying at the ACE (I love to stay there) would’ve been the icing on the cake!  Sure enough, we had a great time in the hotel lobby. The food was amazing and they always have nice music. There was a live DJ that night. We sure enjoyed the comfortable bed and linen after a party day/night. The room was quiet and clean. We enjoyed the unique industrial decorations . It’s a very trendy and unique hotel. More importantly it was clean and the staff was very attentive and friendly (as usual).  I recommend the ACE NYC because it complements the visit to NYC. Once you spend the day in the city and then stay at the ACE you are truly topping it with a nice hotel experience as it has been when staying at the ACE. Thanks to the ACE staff for accommodating us  again at the last minute and placing us in a room with the Empire State Bldg!!!!

title: First Visit at Ace Property
text: Really cool, unique rooms, very friendly and helpful staff from front desk to lobby to housekeeping, reasonable NYC rates. The gym was a good size and had a nice variety of your standard equipment. Great, central location, but also pretty quiet at night (at least on the 9th floor). Would definitely stay here again.

title: Funky but rooms need improvement
text: If you want to avoid the antiseptic same old same old chains and are looking for a hotel that is funky, cool and quirky with loads of atmosphere for your stay in New York, this is the hotel for you. As soon as you walk in through the entrance, its obvious you are in a place that prides itself for being different. This is reflected in the signage, decorations (see photos) and furniture. Its a fun place to stay at. Its also priced well, is in an interesting part of Manhattan and is near a number of train routes. The concierge/check-in staff are also super friendly and helpful. We had a double and the room was surprisingly large for New York. Our room was though showing its age. The furniture was heavily scuffed and run down (see photo). There were no complimentary tea or coffee making facilities and the bathroom was surprisingly quite light on soap.The quality of the room cleaning was also a hit and miss affair. Having said that, the Ace would still be on our list of hotels for our next visit.

title: High quality hipster paradise
text: Stayed for two nights, had a lovely experience at Ace Hotel! Situated in a beautiful neighborhood, close to public transit, food and shops. We requested a high floor room with a view of the Empire State Building, which they were actually able to accommodate! We booked a mini room, which was small but comfortable. The toiletries provided are high quality, particularly the Rudy’s shampoo and body wash. My only complaint would be the lack of an elevated luggage holder. All in all, I would definitely stay here again!

title: Excellent Hotel!! Fabulous staff and accommodations!
text: I was very impressed with the Ace Hotel in NYC. The hotel is clean and modern with a lovely gathering space (sofas, lovely tables) near the bar/restaurant. The hotel room was beautifully decorated and spacious with a dynamic view of the Empire State Building (see photo!!) Staff members were very attentive and friendly. Highly recommend this hotel to locals as well as tourists.

title: Great weekend getaway!
text: We checked in after a full day of exploring NYC and had a great experience with Freddy at the front desk.  He was friendly, funny, and very helpful.  When we got to our room, we realized it smelled of cig smoke so we called Freddy and he fixed it for us in 10 minutes.  He set us up in a different room - upgraded!! - ASAP.  The room was very clean and stylish, just like the rest of the hotel.  Very comfy bed, large bathroom.  Great smelling toiletries available for us.  Every employee we encountered was professional and friendly.  We’ll definitely stay there again!

title: Say Yes to the dress trip in NYC!
text: I cannot say enough nice things about my stay at the Ace! This was my second experience and I will most definitely return. The staff is amazing, the ambiance is incredible, food/bevs are awesome, and the location can't be beat. Thank you Ace Hotel NYC!

title: You wouldn’t believe it
text:
Lets begin:

TV doesn’t work
When i tried to call downstairs, there is no phone line coming out of phone.
Shower constantly drips water
Cold water doesn’t work in the bathroom sink
One outlet and it is loose so it doesn’t charge your phone.
The lobby is mostly a bar with a registration in the corner.
Internet was spotty at best unless you are in the lobby or outside.  I confirmed this with 2 other couples on the elevator.

We spent most of our 3 days out and about and didn’t notice the tv and phone issue until night before we left.  These are all minor annoyances, but, seriously,  i have never experienced any if these in one place before.

On the plus side, the toilet paper was good.

title: Cool Lobby, Good Location, rooms a bit underwhelming
text: Its a great location and a lively lobby, bar and restaurant attached. Rooms are a bit gloomy although a good sized bed for NYC. Room light worked, then didn't, then did again. TV didn't work at all as couldn't connect to network. Shower was very low pressure and dripped for 30 mins after use. Electrical sockets and light switches were loose. Wifi not so good. Overall, you can see the cool design intended but just wish there was more attention to the basics.

title: Lively, well-located, impeccable old-world-meets-modern hotel
text:
We enjoyed our stay immensely. 
- amazingly friendly staff
- wonderful food at the Breslin
- nicely appointed, spacious room with 100% retro furnishings and bath (nice touch!)
- liked having the full refrigerator 

Ace Hotel offered so much more compared to similarly priced hotels. It was a affordably classy and with high-touch service.

Thanks for everything. See you again!

title: Great Stay
text: Stayed in June on a weekend trip. The room was well appointed and had nice amenities. The bed was incredibly comfortable and I slept well both nights despite being right next to the elevators which I couldn’t hear at all. I ordered room service twice, both times it came in a timely manner and was quite tasty, especially the hanger steak. I would definitely stay again.

title: Another great stay at the ACE!
text: This was the third time I've stayed at the Ace this year and keep coming back because of the location, comfort, and service of the staff. Rooms are always quiet (for NYC), beds are always comfortable and the lobby is a great place to chill and work of have a drink. The Breslin always serves up a great meal.

title: Funky and cool!
text: Made my first New York experience fun!  Central to everywhere and the staff were very pleasant.  I wasn't sure what to expect when I first arrived and the lobby elevator was a bit slow - but I discovered the elevator in the back near the bar - much easier and faster!

title: Gorgeous view, spacious room, outstanding service!
text:
The service from everyone was excellent, from those who brought items to my room that visitors had left for me at the front desk to the man who assisted guests outside the entrance with taxis, as well as those who helped my ambulance attendants navigate the routes to and from the service elevator with my gurney in & out.

I am terrible with most names and faces or I would identify all these wonderful people, but the only one whose name and face I can put together easily is my very first contact at the front desk, Claire, with whom I dealt several more times during my stay. For my pre-operative prep night, she gave me a room with a great view of the Empire State Building and of the turn-of-the-century building across the street with the beautiful stone facade.

When I returned to the hotel after surgery, Claire, knowing I was going to be largely room-bound for about a week, chose another room on the same side of the hotel, even higher up, and thus with an even more spectacular view of the Empire State Building. She said if I were going to have to stay cooped up in my room recovering for that many days, I shouldn't have to stare at a view of three brick walls.

As for the amenities, Claire selected a room with one of your largest refrigerators because she knew I could not leave the hotel daily to pick up restaurant & deli food or make repeated trips to the front desk for deliveries, but would need primarily to rely on groceries. The large table made an excellent desk for my computer as well as for dining. The bed was very comfortable, although too close to walls on both sides for a post-op patient such as myself to get in and out easily or painlessly. The aforementioned refrigerator-freezer was wonderful, as was available shelf space and the tea kettle, but the lack of a coffee set with relevant supplies or even a small microwave oven was quite disappointing. The bathroom was large and comfortable for a shower-only room, the guest supplies provided were great and well-thought-out (also, the black hand soap was a particular novelty to me), and I loved the half-flush & full-flush buttons on the toilet. The room was spacious and accommodated my visitors very easily.

Overall, I would recommend this location to anyone, and particularly commend the service. As I was a Medicaid patient (by definition poor), I warned everyone with apologies that I wanted but could not tip anyone for their service, and received the response they do what they do to please the customers not to receive great tips.

Were I in charge of arranging my accommodations, I might come here every time I am in the city, but a government contractor books my lodging for each separate trip, and seems randomly to book me at a different hotel each time, for reasons only it knows, even changing the transportation companies it utilizes each time. I have been booked for a post-op follow-up trip this week--the third trip in a row the contractor, rather than myself, has arranged, and it booked yet a third hotel, and third taxi companies both locally and when I am in the city.

But again, with few complaints and many commendations, I would gladly stay there again, recommend you to others, and considering the medical circumstances under which I had to be there, enjoyed my stay very much!

title: Very cool, stylish hotel, a place for fun, not only sleep
text:
Hi, I decided to try this hotel for the first time and very happy I did so. I was on a business trip but I believe on holiday it is even more fun.
If I would try to summarize the experience, in a nutshell, is that it is the "WeWork" of hospitality. Meaning, the same transformation that we work did to shared workspace this funky hotel does to hospitality.
My room was of good size with a nice place to work. The bathroom was also of good comfortable size. 
The coolest thing about the hotel is the lobby that is live and active most of the day giving you a feeling of a vibrant place even when you are alone.
