Finally, the team very friendly and give a feeling of home away from home...
I'll be back again for sure.

title: Very cool vibes
text: Cool vibes, the energy in this hotel is very young and fresh, which i loved for a change. I also loved the room design and their quirky messages in the room. The staff were very attentive and efficient. I would definitely recommend the ace hotel if you’re looking to stay at a “modern” hotel.

title: Great staff, great location!
text:
Back for another stay at the Ace, and once again delighted to have chosen to stay here again!  The location of the hotel is perfect for walking and exploring around the city - luckily I had the weather for it on my last day (after a very wet weekend).

I had to work one of the mornings, but the team in the lobby were brilliant - they held a space for me on one of the big tables (super cute reserved sign) and brought me copious amounts of great coffee.  

The reception team were very friendly and helpful, they stored my luggage for the day when I went out and even arranged a room for me to shower in before I had to leave for the airport.  This is the perfect time to mention the fab shampoo and conditioner - I'm not usually a fan of using hotel products, but these ones have changed my mind!

All in all, a great stay - the hotel looks fresh too; I love the addition of the flower cart by the front door a fab splash of colour as you arrive and leave.

title: A piece of the PNW in Manhattat
text: Really enjoyed my stay. I've been a fan of the Ace brand for a long time -- first experiencing it (and Rudy's Barber) in the PNW so it was a little bit of home in the middle of the city. Great location, awesome restaurant/bar (go for a cocktail, the bartenders are awesome).

title: Best hotel in NYC!
text: I had a fantastic stay at the Ace New York largely in part to the amazing staff there. I was fortunate to stay in room 911 which was a corner studio suite with a fantastic view. The room featured a king bed, a dining/work table, and a large couch against the window that provided a great space to read and relax. I would highly recommend this room to anyone who has a couple days in the city and is looking for a great guest experience. Christina Delli Santi at the front desk really made me feel welcome upon arrival and made sure I had everything I needed. The atmosphere of all the Ace hotels is incredible and the Ace NYC was no different. Located on 29th and Broadway, the location is very convenient to get to Times Square/Central Park as well as the Lower East Side. The Breslin restaurant is one of a kind and should be considered for breakfast, lunch, and dinner as it offers immaculate food options - definitely have to try the Buttermilk Pancake for breakfast! Thanks to everyone at the Ace NYC for an amazing experience and I look forward to coming back!

title: My favorite hotel in NY
text: The Ace in NY has become a home away from home in NY for me. That’s how wonderful and genuine and just all-around, to-an-individual delightful the staff is. The rooms feel less like a hotel and more like you’re staying in a well-decorated, hip apartment in a fun part of town (nomad is a great location) and the downstairs lobby bar is peerless. As in... it doesn’t even feel right calling it a hotel lobby bar (which I don’t think of as being a particularly cool category of thing...) - most patrons during the day are young ny professionals, laptops out, cup of stumptown coffee in hand. In the early evening, those coffees + laptops trade out for cocktails (notably good here) and bites, and the crowd stays consistently young. If you haven’t stayed yet, do yourself a favor and check this place out!

title: Please Don’t Charge Resort Fees
text: You did wonderful. Have stayed with you all many times since the day you opened. Always my favorite choice. I should note, though, this morning I went online to book a July visit. Your rates looked great, and I started to book when I noted your new addition of resort fees. I chose another hotel. Please reconsider this policy. I feel strongly that this is a fraudulent billing practice, and always choose hotels without these fees. It saddens me to see the Ace add these fees.

title: Cool place
text: Nice Hotel, filled with cool people, with a cool vibe. The room was comfortable, the location was very good. There is a nice Pub connected to the Hotel, which facilitates the decision for the first drink's location!

title: On pardonne les fausses notes...
text:
Le Ace Hotel de la 29th nous joue la partition totale de l’hôtel branché musique dans un style old fashion. On retrouve tout le plaisir (mais aussi parfois les inconvénients...) d’un lobby bondé de hipsters rivés à leurs écrans (difficile de trouver une place), d’une vieille bâtisse mise au goût du jour avec des peintures sombres et marquages graphique « factory », mais où les fenêtres à guillotine laissent passer tous les bruits de la ville et la bonne grosse clim tente de réchauffer la grande chambre glaciale dans un vacarme assourdissant, comme c’était dans les hôtels y a 20 ans. Le design ne fait pas tout. 
Impression mitigée donc pour cet hôtel pourtant sympathique, mais heureusement rehaussée par le parfait petit déjeuner servi rapidement et avec des produits de qualité, par un personnel sympathique.

title: Fun Overnight
text:
We enjoyed our stay , very professional staff , great lobby,the micro room was comfortable. Location is convenient .
Restaurant is very good and Stumptown coffee is excellent.
We will defintely be back .

title: If I ever wanted to be a hipster...this would be a great place to go.
text: Overall, your hotel has a great aesthetic taste - very hipster...very New York. I didn't have high expectations so with that, the room was great, the staff were nice and helpful and the coffee shop and hotel bar were amazing. What I didn't expect was to have very little sleep due to the noise from the street and construction. However with it being a city - I gave it a pass because it is totally out of your control. I would recommend this place to others and if you are asking yourself why I didn't give you five stars because it will help you to stay nimble and I am a jerk that way. :)

title: Great hotel, great location for a business trip
text: I had a wonderful stay. The rooms were clean, quiet and well appointed. I appreciate the design renovation and how the hotel management is interested in maintaining the historical integrity of the building as much as possible. The staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgable. I will recommend the hotel and look forward to visiting again.

title: 部屋は広かったです。
text:
良かった点:
・SMALLのカテゴリーの客室だったが、十分な広さがあり、スーツケースも余裕を持って広げられた。デスクがあってそこで食事を取ったりお茶を飲んだり出来た。
・ハウスキーピングも毎日きちんとなされていた。室内は非常に綺麗だった。落ち着いた雰囲気の過ごしやすい客室だった。
11階の部屋だったので階下の騒音はありませんでした。
・地下鉄の駅が近い

微妙だと思った点:
・今回の滞在中、客室内でミニバー等全く利用していないのにもかかわらず、後から請求があった事。なお、旅行会社のツアーで行ったので、宿泊代金は事前に旅行会社を通して支払い済みだった。旅行会社からホテルにこの件について連絡してもらいましたが返信がないとの事で、この請求に関しては、旅行会社から返金されました。
・1階にあったレストランは閉店しており、改装中だった。
・1階のロビーはいつも多数の人がいて騒々しい。低層階の客室だとうるさいと思います。

※一度こちらに口コミを書いたのですが、書き直しして再掲しました。

title: Not its old vibe!
text:
The lobby recently got a revamp and it's cold and empty now. Gone are the happening crowds and gone is the laptop friendly policy of old. I was told no laptops at the (now empty) big back bar. The new couch arrangements are not as social, and seemingly no laptops are permitted except for the communal table.

I recommend another of New York's high-energy hotels (the W Union Sq., Hotel Indigo LES) if you are a business traveler looking for a hip lobby to hang out in after a day of meetings.

title: bonne surprise
text:
hôtel très bien situé , mais dans une rue plutôt calme, la réception et le bar sont très animés et bruyants, mais la chambre ( pour nous en tout cas ) était calme. On peut toutefois regretter l'absence de boissons chaudes à disposition dans la chambre, il y a pleins de choses mais tout se paye..Nous restons toutefois satisfaits de notre choix.
J'ajouterais que le resto de l’hôtel est très bien , tant pour les petits déjeuner que pour un repas

title: Go-to for NYC trips
text: The Ace Hotel is my go-to for business trips. It is quiet every night and the rooms are very clean. Each visit I know more and more exactly what to expect and it just makes my crazy work-life so much easier to have a reliable hotel. The employees seem to like working there - that makes me happy and relaxed.

title: So-so experience
text: It was a very cool hotel with a vintage high energy vibe. I stayed one night in a medium full room (which was huge, NY standards). Lots of cool touches- Smeg fridge, vintage displays. Also interesting taxidermy-filled lobby and bar. It was nice for the experience, but won’t recommend it for families or if I’m staying long term. It was incredibly noisy late into the night, and had a bad sleep.

title: Great hotel
text: Good services and nice vibe, food is amazing and staff are very friendly, very clean rooms and easy check in and check out. Their hotel is very spacious and i hope that one day I will come and visit again.

title: Amazing customer service
text: We stay at Ace hotels somewhat commonly, however, first time to the one in NYC. I was not disappointed with the room, the lobby energy, the whole thing. What made my stay even better was Ryan, who was a GEM from the start and made sure my stay was as great as possible. I travel a ton and can be assured of a few things: I'm never disappointed with the ACE and staff can make or break a hotel experience.

title: Very good, cool and stunning view
text: Me and my teenage daughter stayed a couple of nights. The hotel and the room was really cool! Nice and helpful staff. We had an excellent view of the Empire State Bld from bed! SMEG fridge and comfy bathrobes. Trendy!

title: One night stay
text: Room space is tiny, I think that is normal for hotels on Manhattan. Have to pay extra to upgrade to a better room. It’s pretty quite on higher floor room. One thing to notice is A/C is old and making loud noise.

title: Family week in NYC in the best hotel!
text:
Thank you for a great stay in NYC, the hotel has a real atmosphere, something which you can't find in 95% of other hotels. In your case this atmosphere is really in phase with that of the city, a sort of modern energy in a vintage environment, congratulation for making this happen and being able to pass it on to the people staying in the hotel.
We were very happy with our room 917, large enough, great view, we appreciate the fact that you took in consideration our request to have a room at a high floor with a view on the city and close to the one that our children had.
All in all a great experience, thanks for making our week in NYC even better!

Alain

title: Straight Flush at the Ace..
text:
Just off the Jet from our Easter Long Weekend in NYNY staying at your Ace Hotel, with thoughts of an awesome Weekend still in the Front my mind and not resigned to the Remember When section yet..

There are however a coupla things that Twisted my Melon a bit, and given that I have been presented with this opportunity, I think they're worth mentioning..

1) No Welcoming Drink. First Impressions stick, and after a long flight [from anywhere to get to NYNY let's face it] a Free Drink woulda been nice.. Water, Fresh Juice, Sapphire Martini, whichever.. I think it would have just made the Destination Reaching more Reward than Relief..

2) Booking of Booths in Breslin. Saturday morning, we headed down for Brekker at 8am only to be told that the Booth I had enthusiastically walked up to was reserved for Non Hotel Guests.. The only question that came to mind then was "What is that about?".. I had paid my Money, I had made my way down early enough to guarantee a Table [aka Booth] and still someone who hadn't laid down the Moolah for the Room was getting the Jump on me.. Not Happy Jan*..

3) Room Refreshments. Again, and this might be beating the Drum from point number 1 in this Review, but as the saying goes "a Freebie every now and then makes even the Glummest of Travellers smile"; actually I'm not sure that's a saying at all, but it should be, because it's true. There definitely isn't a saying "a free Water or Fresh Juice costs a fortune" because that isn't true. I know you have a SMEG Fridge in [presumably each] Room, but it's really doing nothing other than safeguarding Forbidden Fruit, and yes at $9 a Pop, Water is a Forbidden Fruit. I'm not asking for the whole of the top shelf of the SMEG to be Free, that would be silly, but at least one of the Drinks with a "Hey, have me for Free" sticker/label would be nice, especially after a Long Flight / Cab Ride / Brooklyn Bridge Pedestrian Battle..

I think that was about it, not Big Complaints I think you'll agree, and certainly not any that can't be considered or even just fixed straight away.. We loved our Trip to NYNY, it was our First and will not be our Last, and I think I can say on behalf of my Girlfriend too that we will mostly likely stay with you again, because everything else was pretty bloody good. ;)

title: When you come to NYC, come here. Don't bother looking elsewhere. Just book it.
text:
Everything about my stay was outstanding. Upon arriving late in the night/early morning, I was greeted well and taken care of. Even in the bustle of a charged bar and patrons having a great time, the staff there made it feel good to be there and it showed in the way i was lucky enough to get an attic room. 

The place is quaint, clean and spacious, yes even for a NYC hotel. The styling is purposeful and they make the most of each part. The little touches of the fixtures, soaps, shampoo and conditioner are all excellent and refreshing. 

The location is central to many things that you'd want to see in the City and really the staff makes all of the difference in the world. I know that I will be visiting this place again the next time I come to NYC.

title: Buzzy Hip Pad
text: My guy and I had a very nice stay at the Ace. We were able to walk all over the city from here, or hop on the close by subway if needed. The lobby is very hopping with folks on their computers being alone together. Stumptown off the lobby had amazing scones. The room was mighty small, as expected from the "micro" or "mini" in the descriptor but not a problem for us since we were there to be out and about. Hip and affordable!

title: Great location, Restaurant to die for!
text: Had a fabulous stay at ACE recently whilst celebrating my wife's birthday with friends and family.  Location is superb, the Breslin is to die for and the hotel is always very warm and welcoming.  Not a huge fan of shower curtains I have to say but with Carolina looking after us for my wife's birthday, that didn't matter in the end...had a lovely room and a big enough shower to avoid the dreaded SC!  All in all...a great time had by all.  Thank you.

title: Coolest hotel in NY
text: One of the best hotels to stay in NY. The rooms are nice, the staff professional, and there is always a cool social vibe in the lobby. Plus there is a coffee shop right in the hotel. Would definitely come back!

title: The perfect NYC hotel
text: Maybe it's just us, but this is pretty much the perfect hotel. Great location, amazing rooms, terrific, accommodating staff. Every detail from the mid-century furnishings to the turntable to the Martin guitar was appreciated and used. After decades in the West Village we sold our apartment a few years ago. We come back to the city often, but only the Ace feels like we're truly home.

title: Best vibes in town!
text: Stayed with my girlfriends and we had an amazing time! The staff is incredibly nice and accommodating and the hotel lobby is very artsy and has the best vibes. Also, trying their cocktails is a must!!

title: My favorite lobby bar in NYC
text: As a lobby bar aficionado, I like to scope out the NYC hotel scene. Although new additions are always coming in, the Ace Hotel lobby remains my absolute fave! Great drinks, awesome vibes! Great place to get work done but also meet really interesting people and have a delicious drink while you’re at it.

title: Cool hotel, great location, excellent staff.
text:
Ace is my new favourite stay in N.Y. Absolutely loved the hotel. Superb location, comfy rooms with a personal touch, excellent staff and service. The lobby with the bar had the atmosphere any hotel would kill for. An extra shout out to Rodney who served us coffee and croissants each morning during our stay. He was in his first week but already a true pro and a great representative for your organisation. He's a keeper. 

As Arnold would say: I will be back

title: Great location and great staff!
text:
Our first stay in NYC was very great, thanks to the location of the ACE hotel and the kind staff members. The lobby might be a little bit dark but it's the spirit of the building I guess.
Sometimes rooms can be a little bit noisy due to NYC traffic.

title: Excellent staff and cool vibe
text:
I had stayed at this hotel a few years back, and I chose to stay here again with my partner this time as I remembered I had a good time. The staff is very attentive; I had mentioned in my booking that it was our anniversary and it was lovely to find a bottle of red wine welcoming us in our room with a handwritten message as well. We stayed in the medium room which was great for the length of our stay (6 days). A personal thank you to the lovely lady that assisted us at the check-in (I didn't ask your name, but thank you again for your very kind welcome). The vinyl player is a nice touch in the room; it gives a nice homy and cosy feeling. The fridge and the snack area in the room are very well assorted, if you are in a lazy mood, you have everything you need, including room service from the bar and restaurant downstairs. The location is excellent, rooms are clean, and the bed is very comfortable. Ah! And the morning coffee from the Stumptown coffee roasters downstairs is a must have in the morning, I am very critical about coffee, and this is very good. A bit of queue (moving fast) but it is 100% worth it. 
The only downside of the hotel is that the lobby is generally very crowded the entire day as the Ace is very well known as a nice coworking space. It is not easy to find space to have a drink and relax at the end of the day if you don't want to go back to your room immediately. Apart from this small detail, I would book this hotel again in the future.

title: Excellent hotel, very popular.
text:
Staff all brilliant, ditto bar, food and general design. Drinks vouchers and other touches were much appreciated.

2 things that would have improved my stay:

The window or possibly the air conditioning unit in 1124 is allowing a lot of street noise in, I felt much more than usual in NYC when I generally expect some noise.

A shaving mirror with light would be helpful

Otherwise a great place to stay.

Coffee bar on ground floor is also amazing.

title: Great Stat
text: Always a great stay, that's why we always stay at the Ace annually. Great service and great rooms. Super fun bar. They have all the amenities that you need. I needed a button on my jacket to be fixed, which they did.

title: Excellent Experience
text: My room and the bathroom were super clean. The staff allowed me to check in at 3am because I was running late. Friendly staff who were very accommodating and considerate! This is my new go to hotel when I need to stay in the area!

title: Ace is my first choice in Manhattan
text:
Hello! I exhausted myself writing a stellar (5 star) review on Expedia, so I'm keeping this short. Ace is my first choice in Manhattan. I do stay at other places, but I prefer Ace because it's close to Subway, coffee downstairs, Breslin, etc. (What happened to John Dory--I liked that place??) But mostly, despite the fact that Ace is labeled as a hipster hotel, everyone is friendly, handle my wants and I love the rooms. Not to mention the Martin guitar. Which helps me get stuff done when I'm in NYC. If I could move in, I would)
- PH

title: Rough around the edges
text: The Breslin is always good and there’s great coffee accessible from the lobby. The hotel and rooms really go for a particular brand of tech bro cool, and for the most part they nail that aesthetic if that’s what you’re looking for. Purely as a hotel, it’s a little beat up and uncomfortable, so you’re paying for a medium-range hotel that’s much cooler than something directly comparable.

title: Long weekend in NYC
text:
I've stayed at The Ace Hotel since I started visiting NYC again eight years ago and as ever I had an excellent stay. They were kind enough to upgrade my room to something very special as way of thanks for my loyalty. I appreciated the wine, flowers and note.

Unlike so many other big city hotels they have a genuine regard for their guests. While some mind find it informal, it represents a breathe of fresh air, particularly with big corporate hotel groups taking over the industry.

I'll be sure to stay again the next time I'm in town.

Best.

title: Just Stay here Fun and stylish in the heart of the city
text:
A design hotel at its finest.  Beautiful hotel with a look that is completly New York yet welcoming and comfortable.  The rooms can be small but if you have every stayed or lived in NYC the rooms can be small... 

The lobby the pace and the rooms are everything you could ever want from a NYC hotel and then some

title: Hope it gets better because I love THE ACE!
text: I consistently have a great experience when staying at The Ace in general and NY is no exception. A few hiccups this time around though with the elevator continually breaking down during my stay without any communication from the staff, the cleanliness of the room was less than desired and the thermostat had a mind of its own. I’ve been a devoted fan of The Ace in many many cities, I think over the years this location has become a bit rundown and I hope to see a renovation/update soon for a future stay.

title: Tiny bathroom! But great hotel.
text: I stay with you guys two or three times a year, so I was pretty bummed about the bathroom in 620. In fairness the guy who checked me in told me it was a small room and if I wanted to change I could come back down and ask, but it was super late and I was just off a long flight. Still love the hotel, and will come back, but you should reward loyal customers!

title: Good, but a few details to iron out
text: This is a good hotel. We were upgraded to a larger room that was very nice. Staff was very helpful. Some details didn’t work as smoothly. The shower temperature was nearly impossible to regulate and the WiFi was erratic. But, they are a good hotel for sure. We appreciate that shampoo and such didn’t come in small wasteful bottles but a normal big bottle.

title: Cool, quirky, industrial fun at The Ace
text:
We stayed a night at The Ace for a quick weekend away in the city. The location is great near 5th Avenue and 29th, parking garage is a quick walk away. 
Walking in, despite the low light, there’s an ambiance of warmth and community - always a large crowd sharing the Wifi in the central lounge area open to the lobby bar.
The staff is friendly and helpful. I thought I had a problem with my bill when I got home, so I emailed the contact who responded quickly and nicely explaining my error.
The feel of the hotel is very industrial yet welcoming, not cold. The room furnishings are interesting with lots of metal and wood. The bathrooms are full of subway tile. I guess my only complaint would be the shower. Although it looks really cool positioned in the middle of the bathroom, it was very hard to maneuver inside without water getting out and everywhere because the shower diameter is so small, at least it was in our room.
Overall, it was a great experience. We’ll be back!

title: like home away from home
text:
love this hotel! been staying here for over a decade and it feels like my NY home. the food/ the staff/ the lobby, it is all amazing!
i have come for business and fun and every time i look forward to the comfy rooms, the restaurant and the goof vibes.

title: Cool hip boutique hotel in Midtown
text: This is a very unique hotel for the area.  It has a cool hip vibe and it’s lobby is a favourite hang out for New Yorkers needing a spot to stop and work.  The bar is vibrant and the resturant is excellent.  The rooms are vintage style and have guitars and turn tables.  The rooms are not modern but are very comfortable and a have a through back vibe.  The Gym is OK but limited.  My 20 year old daughter loves this hotel and asks to go back when we visit the city. Service at the hotel is friendly and attentive. The hotel is a great value for the location and quality. This is a hotel I often return too.

title: Inspiration
text: I recently stayed at the ACE Hotel and I have to say, having stayed in many hotels in many Cities mainly for Business, this was an absolutely awesome experience on so many levels. Apart from its wonderful location and wonderful accommodation ticking all of the boxes you would expect. However the ACE provides something special, its atmosphere and dynamic environment provides and inspirational energy for any business trip. I could not recommend the ACE Hotel highly enough to any of our fellow business travellers. I had the great pleasure of staying in one of their signature loft rooms - I have to tell you guys if you can treat yourself, this is an experience above all others. Their ain't enough stars to enable my rating of the ACE Hotel.

title: So much I loved about this trend place
text:
I chose this hotel based on finding the lobby on an earlier trip - a place where it was difficult for me to tell it was a hotel lobby! As an extrovert I loved having it be a gathering place - with a coffee shop, a lobby bar with great cocktails, and a busy delicious bar/restaurant also attached. (I used them all and enjoyed every bit!) Still felt safe going up to my room due to the elevator's requirement that you scan your key before hitting any floor.

The hotel has several levels of pricing where the rooms are pretty well described. Traveling alone I didn't need a very large space but still chose 2 steps up from the smallest. My room was completely big enough, with a great bed, great pillows, and enough room. The bathroom was also fine, the shower was FANTASTIC with water pressure pouring so much hot water on me I felt guilty! Decor was weirdly attractive given it looked very much like a guy's college dorm room - Pendleton wool plaid blanket on the bed, wood crates to hold my clothes, desk lamp straight out of Target's college selection. Maybe I have really great memories of college < ; Also - given the business and house music playing in the lobby I expected disruptive noise. NONE. Great soundproofing in my room.

Only reason this hotel isn't rated as a 5 is that there's a little quality issue on some of the aspects of the room - for example the pole for the desk lamp is not solid. I'd still stay here in a skinny minute.

title: Better than I expected!!!
text: I was impressed with online reviews after learning of “The Ace” via Travelers Company’s Traveler’s Notebook blog! When I booked and checked in with the extremely friendly and helpful staff, I new I was in for a treat with my stay!  My room had a very cool mural on the wall, with the eclectic, interior decor very fitting of this city’s magnetic, invigorating pulse!  My room was set up where the impressive desk space and bed were organized neatly and efficiently, I have to find the furniture this hotel uses for my home office; wow that desk was useful and inspiring when I needed to take quick notes without feeling cramped!!  Make no mistake, when you stay at The Ace, this hotel will keep that magical New York pulse with you during your stay!  Unlike the thin walls in the room I stayed in at Hotel Pennsylvania, it was nice to be in a room where you couldn’t hear the guests next door.  If you want to chill at the Hotel during the day or evening you can relax in the lobby with nightly music and DJ keeping the crowd as lively as the New York nightlife outside! You’ll find comfortable seating in the lobby with a nice table space if you want to work with your laptop (be warned, it does get crowded), and you can order their famous Stumptown coffee while you’re working!  Speaking of which, the Stumptown blends at the cafe next door rocked my world!  Call Room Service and splurge on a pot with a heated scone if you need a cup to get your morning started; you won’t be disappointed!!!  Never felt this type of vibe or electricity when I stayed at The New Yorker or Hotel Pennsylvania, then again I only wanted to be closer to the train station.  The Ace is still very accessible from NY Penn Station if you choose to walk; get your bearings and head in the direction of 29th & Broadway!!  A classy looking building that feels like a time capsule on the outside when you see the name “Ace Hotel” in lights, and just as classy, artsy and with a very eclectic feel the moment you walk in!  The service and friendliness of the staff helped to keep me in sync with the Manhattan vibe, enjoying my stay while mucking about town for a mini-Birthday vacation!  Still plenty of Manhattan points of interest nearby, including “The Eataly” near Madison Park and the Empire State Building if you have spontaneity for a midnight view of the city’s skyline!  At checkout the staff were kind enough to hold my baggage so I could explore the city and extend my visit before heading home later that evening.  The excellent care given to the building and rooms, the kind, friendly and engaging hotel staff, and most of all the feeling like I stepped off of The Doctor’s TARDIS walking into this hotel as if I were transported to the 1940’s or 1950’s.  The Ace feels like a genuine part of New York’s iconic architectural history!  I’m coming back to The Ace for more visits when I want to get a film festival fix, muck about town or just feeling like my favorite Timelord and travel back in time!  The staff were extremely courteous, including the front desk, housekeeping, room service and the awesome gentleman who retrieved my baggage held for me while I spent more time in the city after checkout!!!  The staff, room and quality of service are everything to me when I’m traveling, The Ace is nothing short of those expectations and I can’t wait to book my room again!!

title: Best Place for An Epic Birthday Weekend!
text:
We had decided to celebrate our 14-year-old twin's birthday in New York City (since they were born there!) with a weekend of theatre, food, and fun.  We chose the Ace Hotel and let them know we were celebrating.  First of all, the place is flat out cool, with a very international vibe.  We went up to our room, which was spacious and hip.  There was a darling note welcoming us, with flowers and 2 chocolate ganache birthday cakes for the twins!  It was such a lovely touch - they were delighted.  And the cakes were delicious (I got only one bite...).  

We had the birthday dinner at The Breslin - what a treat!  We walzed right downstairs and had a fantastic meal - it was the birthday experience we sought as a family.  Breakfast was both interesting, healthy and delicious as well.  

I used to come here for business meetings all the time when we lived here and always loved the Ace Hotel...I said it before and I'll say it again...this place ROCKS.  Thanks for giving us a weekend to remember!!

P.S. An extra shout out to GM Adina Han...this would not have happened without you...thank you so much!!

title: お洒落だけど、、、お風呂が狭い
text: エースホテルシリーズは好きでロサンゼルスでも宿泊していますが、お風呂が狭くて使いにくいでした。ツインの部屋に３人宿泊でしたが部屋自体は充分に広くて、３人のスーツケースを広げてもスペースは広くてよかったでした。エースホテルはシャンプー、コンディショナー、ボディソープが備えられていますが香りもよく、帰りにボトル買いしました。

title: Do you like birds?
text: My room had a 7 foot mural of a giant bird. That’s truly all you need to know. I would stay here again just for the bird mural. I told a girl that I painted it and she may have believed me. I told her I’m the bansky of hotels, just leaving bird murals in every room I sleep.

title: Great location, unimpresive hotel
text:
I got this on a name your own price deal. It was over New Year's and hotels were fairly pricey. I really wanted to like it. But as much as they try with the dark lighting, different music and unconventional decor and art, it's just not that nice. New York City hotel rooms have a reputation for being small. I've stayed at several others, and this room was SMALL. Could barely keep our luggage in the room and walk around the bed. 

The biggest issue though was the heat in our room went out, twice! And this was with 10 degree weather outdoors and poorly insulated windows. Our TV also lost the cable connection, then the guy working on it tried to say it was because I plugged something into a different HDMI port (I didn't, and had nothing with me I could have). 

They are really trying hard to be a cool hang out spot. But failing pretty hard at being a comfortable hotel.

title: Truly ACE!
text:
Great hotel so well situated and a perfect place to meet up with a friend for the weekend 
Hotel room was sizeable for NYC and well appointed with comfy beds. To be honest 5 stars could easily just go to the fact I’ve found a hotel room with a plug under a long mirror! Lighting also great as often US hotel rooms are dingy!  Finally awesome bar and restaurant where both food and drink are highly recommended

title: Great hotel to stay!
text: Loved this place, truly a great experience. The room was fantastic because of the cleanliness and the whole aura of it. It just had a different vibe then what you normally associate with a hotel. Loved the vinyl records and turntable in the room and the style of the bathroom. The room had a rustic style to it and the proximity to the subway was so convenient. If you got bored in the room, you can easily go down to the bar for a few drinks or even chill in the lounge and meet new people. The hotel itself had a fantastic nightlife and if it's not up to your standards just head out the door, you're in NYC! We definitely recommend it to you and the family, our kids loved it.

title: Better than expected ideal for NYE in NYC
text:
Hi after a few of the mixed reviews we weren't to sure about the Ace. But it turned out far better than expected.

It started all well when the check in suggested we wait for an hour and could get a far better room, so we went and had a coffee at the bar which btw was great coffee. Reception was very helpful.

The lobby is very crowded, but tbh we hardly used it.

The location is excellent you hardly need to use the Subway, an easy walk to pretty much most places. We walked back from a NYE party in Times Square - NYE no issue at all.

The room was far bigger than expected, an excellent bath room with traditional fittings really made it feel special, the bed was very comfortable plenty of storage space. WIFI was excellent.

Two things for improvement -

The room is a little dark and I suggest install of better lighting. 

The fridge was encased in a annoying steel box, no really need for that, the door was problematic and I suggest it would of been better in just a plain cabinet.

Also had a meal in Breslin, which although pricey was very high quality.

All in all a good stay.

title: Excellent service and we love Steve the doorman
text:
We didnt actually stay at the ACE this time but at a hotel just next to it.  
My husband and I were outside in between the 2 hotels trying to flag down a cab to take us to the airport to go home.  A few cabs pulled up but said they wouldnt go to the airport.  As we neared towards the front of the ACE, a cab pulled up and the guy said he would take us but it would be $85 which is against the law in New York, it's a city wide set price of $55, so we told him we wouldnt go with him and kept walking trying to flag a cab.  The guy backed up and followed us to start yelling at us that we wouldnt be able to find a cheaper price and we dont know New York rules.  At that point we were getting upset and worried wed not get to the airport in time.  Before we could do anything,  STEVE the doorman at the ACE overheard us and the cab driver, swooped in between us, exchanged words with the shady cab driver about the prices in New York and as the driver started to block the oncoming traffic to yell at us, Steve then yelled for him to"get the helloutta heah!" He then immediatley jumped into the street and right away flagged us down an honest taxi.

  For us to not even be ACE hotel guests and for him to go out of his way to show us service and help us out like that was truly amazing, and I felt he deserves a shout out.  We will definitely book ourselves at the ace next time were in town.

title: The Only Place I Stay When I am in NYC
text:
I travel to NYC frequently for work.  I have a tried a number of hotels - many of which were great, but after my very first time at the Ace, I never stay anywhere else.  They have a great selection of rooms with different price points, some extremely reasonable.  There is so much care and character in every room - from the art that differs in every room down to the vinyl selection in the rooms with record players.  Each room I have stayed in has been unique and thoughtful, with playful messages, the most comfortable robes, and the best hand soap I have ever used in a hotel.  The hotel lobby bar is always hopping, so you don't even really have to leave the hotel to have a great time, the coffee at Stumptown is to die for, and the room service is fast, affordable and delicious (best hummus I have ever had).

All of the above is great, but what really keeps me coming back is a front desk attendant named Kimani.  I met him the first time I stayed there.  Kimani has so much good energy, I wish I could bottle it up and sell it.  He is fun, attentive and accommodating, and it comes so naturally you know that this is more than just a job to him - he actually cares about your stay and wants you to have a great experience.  Before my first visit to the Ace, my regular hotel was the Marmara Park Avenue.  After I discovered the Ace and met Kimani, I have never gone back. 

In addition to Kimani, I have only had great experiences with the rest of the Ace staff - from the doormen, front desk, security, bartenders - they have all been fantastic.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Room with a view
text:
Im brand loyal to the Ace having stayed in the Palm Springs, Seattle, and NYC locations but I wanted to post a review about my last trip.  I checked in late and was helped by a manager named Ryan  who was so nice and made the check in easy and understood what i was looking for in a room choice. He was very helpful during my stay.  Helping me with getting an appointment at Rudys the barber shop and a good place to grab dinner. 
Again super friendly and will hopefully see him and the great team on my next visit. 
-Philip

title: Fantastic Stay!
text: Stayed at the Ace Hotel NYC for the second time. It won’t be my last time. Excellent hotel! Room was spectacular in every respect - room, great bed, awesome feel. Staff were super especially Ryan on the front desk who was friendly, helpful and made me feel at home. I stay at heaps of hotels and Ace Is right at the top of my list of preferred places to stay.

title: Another Great Stay at The Ace
text:
After two stays Chicago’s Ace hotel, I booked a Medium room in midtown even though it was a hike to my Wall Street meetings but based on my Chicago stays I gave it a go. Good decision. 

Clearly a very old building converted which has some challenges like slow elevators, darker, and a bit gritty around the edges. But I think it’s the approach to running the hotel that I like - it’s not stuffy, it doesn’t feel like a museum, it feels like someone living room. Someone I would hang out with. 

First night had delicious oysters and beer at their John Dori spot and breakfast one morning at The Breslin Lounge which was also very solid. 

I don’t know this area of NYC but found the R train totally convenient to Wall St and the neighborhood was clean and safe. 

Tom A

title: Love this place!
text: I love the Ace, I have stayed here every time I come to NYC for over ten years now and the experience is always top-notch.  The customer service is fantastic and friendly, they are very helpful with any requests.  The rooms are very comfortable, the restaurants are great and the lobby bar is killer-cool.  Highly recommend staying here for your NYC trip, the whole experience is fantastic!

title: New York at its core!
text: I could stay in any of the big box hotels in New York, but when I stand in their lobbies, or wake up in my room, or eat from the "breakfast buffet", I could literally be anywhere... but when I stay at the Ace, I am in New York. From the design, the awesome restaurants (raw bar tower at John Dory Oyster House FTW), the vibe of people in the lobby... it's an experience like no other.

title: The Ace is my Place in NYC
text: I love this hotel.  The lobby is banging, the restaurant is great, and there's coffee too.  Rooms are modern but cozy.  I love the service.  All around its my favorite place to stay in NYC.  Everyone wants to come hang at the Ace.  Great central location in Manhattan.

title: Ending 2018
text: Ace hotel was the perfect sure to a horrible 2018. My wife and I enjoyed the room immensely. The refrigerator was well stocked and everything was super comfortable. I almost moved in permanently. Great job Ace Hotel, your staff and rooms are all amazing.

title: Home away from home
text: I work in New York very frequently - sometimes once or twice a month for four to five days at a time. When I have to book my own lodging, I always stay here. You cannot beat the price for the quality of service and location that you get. They give you top notch customer service and it is a very comfortable room with great accommodations. The restaurants attached, The Breslin and Stumptown Coffee are pleasant and delicious. It has become my home away from home when I'm in NYC. You won't be disappointed.

title: FIRE 🔥
text:
I have stayed at the Ace Palm Springs and was eager to check out the New York property. I have been to the city several times and stayed at different hotels each time. But I’ll be coming back here for sure on my next visit. 

People here were legit. How is that even possible.. in Manhattan? Breslin served up the best food each day and their breakfast took my breath away. 

Everyone in that place was beyond professional, efficient, and equally pleasant. Room service was bomb and housekeeping made me feel like a king - even in a medium room! 

I’m so impressed. This hotel is fire.

title: Romantic Weekend - Thanks Ace
text:
Having stayed at several of the Ace Hotels, I was delighted to get a great rate for a January weekend for 2 nights including breakfast.  I knew from Chicago I could email the hotel and ask for some special attention.  I spoke to Molly (?) and she was really kind , looked up my booking and promised to make it special. 

When we arrived, our room had been upgraded to a bigger room, a birthday welcome note, some goodies, and a bottle
of wine.  It really got a special weekend off to a perfect start. 

This is a darker, older Ace, which seems ready for a decent makeover - but I was very happy with our room and weekend
And staff was great. 

Rob

title: Another great stay at Ace NYC
text:
Thank you Ace front desk team and in particular, shout out to Ryan Frostig who got me the best view in town!

I always feel like I’m at my home away from home when in NYC. 

You guys are the best, can’t wait to come back soon!

title: very good
text:
ニューヨークに行くことが決まり航空券より先にここに泊まりたくて予約しました(笑)
雰囲気、デザイン等とてもかっこよく自分までかっこよくなったように思える数少ないホテルの一つだと思います！特にスタッフの対応はフレンドリーで良かったですね。

title: Hip Hotel
text:
In town to see a play in Chelsea. Our room on the 12th floor was spacious and charming.
Lo-tech with a big refrigerator, comfy beds, Pendleton blankets, good lighting, turntable and records plus a good radio. Were to meet son in lobby, but brought him up to room to hang. Lobby while beautifully restored was clamoring on a Friday night.

title: Definitely the OG - but needs some refreshing and soon
text:
I've been staying at Ace in NYC since before I booked hotels according to Trip Advisor. So my heart won out and I am reviewing based on my history here.

Many a night spent in Breslin and the lobby (which is currently under construction which may signal good news?)  Delicious English Breakfast at Breslin, my favorite coffee at Stumptown and the neighborhood which has finally caught up with the hotel. Unfortunately, the hotel seems to have fallen behind the neighborhood and no longer seems exciting or quite as engaging.  We had a drink around the corner at Nomad which did have that energy and freshness.  Being brand new always helps. 

I will always try and come back to Ace but not sure I can quite feel it's worth 5-stars any more.

title: Chic, Choice, Charming!
text:
The place is beautiful and charming. The staff is friendly, thoughtful, helpful, and very good at making a guest feel welcome! Ryan at the front desk took great care of me- his hospitality was genuine and he offered some great tips on the local scene. I've stayed at a lot of classy places and Ryan could teach the staff at the Four Seasons a thing or two about guest services! Stellar. 

The location is perfect. The rooms are well-appointed with great views. Even in a small room, one feels very special in this unique and reasonably priced get-away! The lobby is a cozy hang out and the bar staff knows how to pour. The restaurant is very good for that special occasion and the coffee bar is just perfect for the early check-out. By far, the Ace is my favorite spot for a weekend (or mid-week overnight!) stay in NY. I'll be returning soon and will certainly recommend it. For anyone looking for more than just a generic, anonymous hotel, this place can't be beat!

title: Do yourself a favour and stay at this hotel!
text:
ok, so I am a little biased since I got a random, un-asked for upgrade which completely made my day, so a big thank-you to ACE Hotel!!
The staff at the front desk are very friendly and helpful.  The hotel is very eclectic and modern, so much character.
Some of the best coffee in all of NYC in the lobby in addition to a few bars/restaurants and room service.   Small gym downstairs.
Great location, a few blocks from Penn Station, easy to walk everywhere.
Some of the softest and nicest towels ever.
Will most certainly stay again.

title: This place made us happy
text: Booked for spontaneous NY weekend to escape being housebound in PA during a snowstorm. What a find! Kind and efficient lobby staff. Our 'small' room was very thoughtfully designed - nothing is cheap, bland or missing for comfort. Real art on the walls, luxurious textiles all around. Full size bathroom with lots of hot water/pressure, nice to have a steaming hot bath after being out in the cold. Quiet at night, loved the coffee shop downstairs in the a.m.. Easy access to uptown/ Met where we spent most of our time.  Planning our next visit!

title: NYCに期待していたけど
text:
昨年ロサンゼルスのAceHotelに宿泊してとても感動したので、NewYorkはさぞかし！と思い込んでしまっていたこともあってか、期待が外れた感じだったかも知れません。部屋のことだけでいうと、ロスの時と同じダブルルームでしたが、ロスの方が広く天井も高く雰囲気があり、ゆったりできました。
こちらはちょっと飲み物を置いたりするための場所（台など）がなく、お湯を沸かしてもお茶を作るスペースに困りました。マグカップも一つにヒビが入っていたので漏れ出して慌てました。ロビーやレストラン、コーヒーショップ、地下のトイレはとてもいい雰囲気で、全体的には素敵だと思います。

title: Ottima scelta
text: Io ed il mio ragazzo abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel,dal 30 dicembre per 5 notti. Ottima posizione per visitare New York, camera calda ed accogliente, bagno ok. Ambiente informale, personale giovane, ben preparato, amichevole. Quando torneremo a NY, sceglieremo di nuovo questo hotel. Bravi!

title: Great New Year’s spot
text:
My wife and I decided to do the New Year’s in Times Square this year and we decided to stay here since they are one of the few pet friendly hotels in the area. The rooms were nice and so were the amenities. What got us most was their welcoming attitude. While parking our car our dog went into a bit of a spaz out and started barking. Despite the number of guests that called to complain (which we apologize greatly for) the shift manager addressed situation in an awesomely calm way. Needless to say our pup had no further incidents but just the way they addressed the situation kept us in awe.
We will certainly return to this hotel when in the area since the time we spent there made our New Year’s celebration a great one. Great location close to Time’s Square and many other locations. Friendly atmosphere and from the number of guests congregating in the lobby something is always going on. Overall great place to stay. Thanks guys!

title: Hippest Hotel Ever
text: I stayed at the Ace for a girls' night out and it was perfect - the view, the decor, the vibe, the food... and shout-out to the amazing Front Desk staff who was willing to help out to make it the most memorable girls' night out ever. The room was spacious, well-lit, and extremely clean (the housekeeping team deserves a big thumbs up, I'm a stickler for cleanliness, and I couldn't find a speck of dust, they are VERY thorough...) If you stay in NYC and you want a real experience, you need to stay at Ace Hotel; you'll enjoy it as part of your experience, not just as a hotel you can return to just to sleep. (Speaking of sleep, those mattresses are super comfortable!!)

title: Wonderful stay at unique hotel
text: We stayed on Jan12 in King Suite Loft. The room is pretty large with empire state view and everything in the room is unique and pretty. Bathroom has bathtub and separated shower room which are also pretty cool. Staff was friendly and nice. We enjoyed food at oyster bar as well. It was absolutely the best memorable stay ever. Thank you for wonderful experience!!!

title: Very Unique Hotel for a Memorable Trip
text: This hotel is one of the “coolest” we’ve ever stayed at. The room was awesome! We had a king size bed with a sitting area, which we opted for based on other reviewers complaining about small rooms. Another common complaint was the cold, but our heater was always able to warm up the room quickly. Check in was smooth. Bar scene was always happening. Nice adjacent restaurant and coffee shop. I liked the central location to be able to go north or south, and walking to Times Square, for example, was not too far. Neighborhood seemed good. We would stay here again and definitely recommend!

title: Perfect Location for Muslim Travellers
text: Alhamdulillah. Fantastic halal food just in front of the hotel called Chandni. Just beneath it a Mosque to perform your Solah. Location of this hotel was just perfect for us. Central to most location we went for sightseeing and shopping!

title: Ci Ritorneremo
text: Abbiamo passato 5 notti siamo stati bene ..Hotel gestito da ragazzi giovani,La struttura molto easy ma molto carino nei particolari...la camera pulita e spaziosa..La posizione a 10 min da Time Square...Ci torneremo

title: Wouldn’t return
text:
We stayed here from the 28th of December through to the 2nd of January 2019. Didn’t see great value here. The room was tiny and  while in bed I could hear people talking while walking down the hallway. 
The day after we checked in we complained to the lady that;
- the shower drain was blocked (bath would fill up during a shower)
- the extractor fan in the bathroom didn’t work 
- leaking tap
We were told these things would be addressed by the time we arrive back... returned and nothing was done. The lack of a window or working extractor fan 
In the bathroom  meant we had to have the bedroom window open (0 degrees!) which was also very noisy - there was a loud fan going 24/7. Hotel also had a very damp/mouldy smell. 

Location was slightly too far south. Streets a little rough. 

Not a great NEw York experience. At over $2400 NZD for 5 nights i was  expecting better value.

title: オシャレで便利
text:
1階がノマドワーカーのスペースになっており、誰でも入ることができるのでいつも賑わっています。
そのためか宿泊フロアに行くエレベーターは、カードキーをかざさないとボタンが点灯しないようになっていました。

部屋の中もオシャレで、ニューヨークで一人暮らしをするような雰囲気を味わえます！
アメニティのシャンプーがとても良かったので、買ってくれば良かったと後悔してます…

ただ照明は暗いので、ベッドサイドにあるライトも使ったほうがいいです。

中心地から近いので、バスや地下鉄、徒歩で色々な名所にアクセスできます。地下鉄の駅から3分くらいですが、使う時間によっては人が少なくなりますので注意が必要です。
また、ホテル前の通りも夜遅くは少し怖い感じがしました。

コリアンタウンやマーケットも近く、食事はデリで十分満足できました！毎日外食だととんでもなく高くつきます。。

title: Excellent experience at Ace
text: Very cozy rooms, hotel lobby stuff are very helpful, restaurant is very nice and food excellent. An experience that I reccomend and definitely will be back again! The hotel is very near the center area and Times Square, I had a room with Empire State View, unique view!

title: Awesome hotel with great service
text: I stayed at the Ace Hotel for several days and loved it. Hotel rooms are cozy, neat, and clean. The location couldn't be better with a nice view of the Empire State building. We celebrated a special occasion and the concierge went above and beyond to provide awesome service throughout our entire trip (big thank you to Ryan & Christopher!) I would definitely recommend this hotel. Can't wait to go back again!

title: Interesting hotel from not-quite-hipster point of view
text:
3.5 star would be more like it. 

Heard a lot about Ace hotel franchise over the years and finally had a chance to book Ace NYC in December. I think the hotel was pretty much what I expected (small, good location, "hipster" vibe, warm lobby, pretty cheap for NYC, stumptown coffee, etc) and some were better than expected (noise level at level 10 wasn't bad at all, staffs were courteous, a lot of power outlet). Having said all that, it's hard for me to come back to the hotel and it mostly comes down to whether I'm willing to tolerate some of its deficiency as "hip" (I don't think I am).. things such as instances of rust in water, black carpet making it harder to spot/clean , super slow elevator, lobby that's full basically all the time except very early or very late. I admit that Ace hotel has a way to make me feel less annoyed than I normally would (could say it has its character) but NYC has seen a lot of these millennial oriented hotels lately that it's hard to justify coming back here again. 

I would recommend this to Ace brand diehards, people who like Nomad area.

title: Very good hotel
text: Hotel rooms are very cosy, nice view to Empire State building, hotel staff is very nice  and helpful and also a very nice restaurant they have! Also the lobby is very chic and the bar there they have a wide variety of special cocktails!

title: Best Lobby Vibe
text: Went with friends to meet up after work and had a great time in lobby bar, I hung out in the lobby for a bit before my friends arrived, got some work done and really enjoyed the atmosphere.  Clean, cool and comfortable place and I will be back again.

title: Almost perfect
text:
The Ace was perfect for me as a solo female traveller in NYC for the first time. 

The room: I had a mini room, which I would say is best for a single person. The room would also be fine for a couple with small suitcases who just needs somewhere to shower and sleep. 

Bed was comfy, pillows amazing!! Great TV, well-stocked mini bar if you want to fork out a LOT of money. There’s a comfy robe to use, ironing board, safe, desk and suitcase rest thingy. 

I also had a direct view of the Empire State Building! An insanely good view. 

Very small bathroom but had great water pressure and good soap/shampoo etc. 

The hotel: 
Cool downstairs bar but always crowded. 

Stumphouse coffee is great! Expensive but for the US, it’s so good to have proper coffee right there. 

Reception was friendly enough but not overly helpful. Which was fine because I never know if I’m supposed to tip for advice and things (not American). But would have been nice to have at least been offered some local tips on food and drink, an intro to the bar and what’s in the hotel. 

Room service was quick but overpriced for the quality (had club sandwich). Obviously room service in NYC is a dumb idea with all the amazing food on offer so I guess that’s my fault.

The downside was the noise. It was fine for me as I am a heavy sleeper but I was woken each morning earlier than I wanted by garbage trucks, people yelling, taxis beeping. But I guess that’s New York... if you want a more relaxing, deluxe experience, get a bigger room and ask for a room NOT right above the bar on West 29th St. Or a higher floor (I was only on the 4th). 

Overall, a really good experience. You’ll have to compromise on a few things but if you want to be close to Manhattan and in a busy area, this is perfect.

title: Excellent service, stylish boutique hotel
text:
Once we got here on a Friday night they upgraded us to a medium room on the top floor— great start! :) The hotel itself has a very stylish, hipster vibe-- even the other guests were wearing muted shades of gray, black, and navy. The staff is fantastic, they're super accommodating, pleasant, and helpful!
The only reason I deducted a star is noice. I was feeling poorly when we got there (we had to be in NYC and I was at a tail-end of a nasty cold) and I wanted to sleep in. I could hear street noice until very late at night and then around 9 AM the house-keeping knocked loudly and came in. They knocked and woke me up a couple of more times later in the AM (even though we had a late check-out) until we finally gave in and woke up. The front desk people were fantastic and very apologetic, and even offered me a tea/coffee voucher for the hotel coffee shop. 
All in all-- I'd recommend this hotel! Excellent service, beautiful space, but bring some ear plugs if you end up having an exterior view room.

title: Ace is Aces
text: Set in a historic building in the Flatiron district, the Ace is where you want to stay if you'd like to feel as if you've been dropped into a modern work of film noir. You also have all the comforts of a hip modern home—a record player, a Smeg fridge stocked with small batch everything, a plush long hoodie that acts as your bathrobe, and a minimalist design aesthetic splashed with bold Insta-worthy mantras. The bed is soft as a cloud and the walls, thickly insulated, so prepare yourself for a big indulgent sleep. Of course, this is just your room. Where it's really at when you're at the Ace is the restaurants and lobby. The Breslin's dark Deco design is ideal for late night bites, with cozy mahogany booths and romantic lighting. On the other side of the hotel, is the John Dory where you can get your happy hour oyster fix, take in some of the restaurant's exotic sea fare or comfort bites (hello burrata salad and best Parker House rolls ever) and tie one on with something from an exceptional cocktail list clearly built on care and craft.

title: Ofräscht och otrevlig personal
text: Bokade direkt via hotellet och fick ett väldigt bra bemötande. Tyvärr var inte hotellet eller rummen som på bilderna. Rummen är extremt små, i väldigt gammalt skick och luktar unket. Den unkna lukten försöker döljas med airspray men som bara gjorde det värre. Det var svårt att få varmvatten i duschen. Vi fick väldigt dåligt bemötande av personalen vilket är tråkigt. Vid ankomst Av många hotell vi bott på i New York så är detta absolut det sämsta så vi kan inte rekommendera att bo här även om man inte generellt sett inte spenderar mycket tid på hotellrummet.

title: Steampunk Hotel
text: Hotel was very dark. Room was generally ok but very minimalist and felt dingy maintenance wise. Hipster concept was interesting if you enjoy that sort of thing. Nicely stocked mini fridge. The radio / music player was cool.

title: Expensive, dark and difficult
text:
As with all hotels in New York this was not cheap and I believe that there is a need to provide both a reasonable service and good accommodation. 

It started badly in that when I arrived (after the check in time) my room wasn't ready. Reception weren't interested in being helpful and just told I could wait in the bar or leave my bags. 

When I finally arrived in the room it was badly lit and poorly furnished. The sink was in the main bedroom (rather than the bathroom) and the lighting was so bad that shaving was difficult - unbelievably turning the light on almost made things worse rather than better. 

The air con didn't work well and was noisy whilst the bed sagged in the middle the shower had a circular curtain which clung to your body and there was nowhere to hang the towel. 

The only redeeming feature was the bar which was pretty good as was the food but you don't have to stay to use these so I suggest that you give the hotel a wide berth.

title: Don't Stay Here
text: I spent over 600.00 on this hotel and it was awful. Small, stuffy the rooms were SO HOT and they can't turn the heat off. The rooms are dark gray and dingy and depressing and the lighting looks like you are in a bad dorm room.

title: Average
text: So I had written a review before about Ace. I deleted it as I wasn’t sure editing was fair. So checked in and that was perfect as host was very friendly and professional. Room was ok size but if you had a kid with you it would probably be very tight. Bathrooms are small and not much light although we understand the hipster theme. Bedroom itself was not very bright although the lights had dimmers still very dark in our opinion. To add to this our room never got done or changed and when I called for towels they happily delivered them to us however no apologies were offered nor an attempt to make our room at that point. So I wouldn’t rule out the hotel but certainly had a few glitches.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text:
Amazing staff, beautiful hotel and such relaxing rooms with the perfect evening to night atmosphere in the lobby.  Check-in is easy and the staff were always there to help with anything. Go-to hotel in NYC ! 

Location is easy to get anywhere in the city.

title: Lovely place to stay
text:
My mum and I stayed here from Monday 19th November to Friday 23rd November 2018.  The hotel receptionists were very nice and welcoming.  They upgraded us to a larger room, and the room was lovely. We stayed on the sixth floor.  The room was large, nice clean bathroom and very comfortable beds.  Location was perfect, we weren't five minutes walk away from a range of different restaurants, bars and fast food places.  10 steps from the hotel entrance and you can see the Empire State Building.  
The lobby area was really nice and 'trendy'.  
Highly recommend this place to stay.  From JFK airport we took the Airtrain to Jamaica station then took the E train to 34th Penn Station and it was about a 5 minute walk to the hotel.  The whole train journey cost us $7.50 each.

title: Bring water, PJs and ear plugs
text:
Bring your own water or its $18/L for the minibar. The tap water tastes like a muddy pond.
PJs, because the heat may or may not be working.
Ear plugs because drivers in the city love their horns more than air. Nothing better than an air horn blast at 03:00. Be sure to ask for a room not exposed to a street / Ave. 
NY is insanely expensive and the Ace fits in perfectly. For your hard earned money, you'll get a small, dark, cold and noisy box.
4 stars? Maybe if you count 2 per person.

title: Hmmm getting hipper and older.
text:
I stayed there for 7 days. Once upon a time the hotel was hipper and cooler. The design 5 year old hipster place. The coworking lobby is very very cool. The staff are awesome. But the rooms are getting little bit older darker. 
The coffee shop is awesome and there is always a queue.
Location is awesome and very central.

Hope they renovate soon

title: Best Spot in NYC!!!
text: I’ve been coming to the Ace NYC for the past 7 years and it never disappoints!!! From the friendly staff to the unique decor.  The lobby is always alive both day/night. Great Music & Drinks....Love their coffee shop. It’s a definite must when in NYC.

title: Viaje soñado
text: Me encanto el hotel!!! La pasamos re lindo, muy buena la ubicación! Habitación super cómoda. Veiamos el empire desde la cama!! Wifi perfecto. Super recomendable!Mucha onda.Los chicos/as recepcion muy amables! Vuelvo!!!

title: Everything you need
text: Staying at the Ace is always fun! The hotel has everything you need right on property. The Breslin and the John Dory Oyster Bar not only have awesome food and service but great just hanging out or meeting for drinks. The hip lobby space and lobby bar has always a fun and energetic vibe in the evening but great just lounging during the day maybe getting some work done. The Stumptown Coffee shop off the lobby has the best coffee in the city! The trendy Nomad neighborhood has many other cool spots to hang our and has central acccess to get downtown or uptown easily. With such a friendly staff and great environment I find myself often hanging out right on the property most of my trip.

title: Awesome lobby and cool vibe
text: The staff is super helpful and cool. We hung out in the lobby before dinner because I had to finish some work and the atmosphere was mellow. As the night progressed the lights dimmed and the lobby transformed (which signaled to me it was time to log off and enjoy our evening LOL) great drinks and atmosphere so I highly recommend to all. The Ace is my go to in midtown and one of a kind.

title: Expensive for what it is - but that's New York
text:
We opted for a medium to big sized room, and it was worth it. The room was big for New York standards, with a sofa and desk. However, when local taxes were all accounted for our stay came to £400 per night. While the room was nice, it was sparse and didn't feel plush or luxurious in the slightest given the price we paid. 

You're basically paying for the location, which is fantastic. You're a couple of blocks from the Empire State Building and well positioned to go uptown and downtown. We stayed our final night in Soho House in the Meatpacking district. Granted, it's not such a good location for sight seeing, but for less money we got a much nicer room.

title: Cool hotel in great location
text: Stayed here twice now for NYC sight-seeing trip mom/daughter.  Booked a double double room each time - spacious rooms with two double beds.  My early 20's kids loved the vibe (as did I) but I would say hotel really appeals to younger ages due decor and atmosphere.  Lobby is huge with a bar and lots of seating and is always full of people on laptops (non residents) presumably working or having casual meetings.  Decor is dark and slightly shabby/industrial with some funky art work around the place and cool signage.  Staff are super helpful.  The restaurant is supposed to be excellent in it's own right.  We only used it for breakfast which was delicious.  There is also an oyster bar attached and a juice/coffee bar which are all part of the hotel.  Our bedroom this time was on 9th floor and had amazing view of Empire State building and Broadway.  The location is perfect.  Central - half way between Flatiron and Times Square - and easy access via subway to both uptown and downtown. Plenty of bars and restaurants within easy walk.  I would recommend.

title: Habilt hotell
text: Bra puls och atmosfär utifrån ett bra läge bara något stenkast från Empire State Building. Försöker kanske vara lite väl coolt för min smak, hade hellre sett att de fokuserat lite mer på att förbättra finishen.

title: Awesome lobby, great vibe, centrally located to all
text:
Amazing staff I dropped my wallet and was very fortunate to have it returned.My third visit to ACE Hotel NYC and the hotel has been a consistent experience.
Ilook forward to returning on my next visit to NYC.

title: Cool place, disappointing visit.
text: The Ace Hotel on 29th and Broadway has a great vibe, great decor and more of a club/bar/lounge vibe. If that’s what I was looking for it would be great. But I was looking for a hotel to sleep in and they fall short. I was there with several colleagues and VIPs and everyone had problems with their rooms. Smell, temperature, noise. Several people had to move ... one at 3am. When I got home I was telling someone about the experience. They had been there 2 weeks prior and reported the same thing! The Ace certainly has a “too cool” vibe to it, which is awesome, but I also need to sleep comfortably! It’s a shame really, lots of potential for this place. They should take a page out of the Bowery Hotel which I think does a good job of balancing the two.

title: Hipster hotel lacking certain necessities
text:
We stayed at Ace Hotel for a quick one night stay. After researching it online compared to some of its competitors around the area, we choose ACE due to its hipster vibes and cozy decor. 

We weren’t disappointed just yet. The lobby was cool, the fact that they had a coffee shop attached was a nice feature and the restaurant is open until 2am with room service available until then as well. But then we were hit with a big disappointment when it came to our rooms. 

We had a double bed room that seemed to have it all: Two cozy looking beds, a stocked retro fridge and even a Martin guitar. But you know what it didn’t have? A/C!!!! Granted we stayed on a fall day that happened to be warm. When we got into the room, it was extremely warm. We tried opening the windows but the breeze was non existent. We thought the room would cool down after a few hours but nothing changed. We tried turning the thermostat on only to find it blowing hot air. When we called the front desk they said “since the building is old. Once it hits a certain temperature outside we keep the heat on and don’t turn on the ACs anymore.” I have NEVER heard of this. This is a HOTEL not a apartment building. Your guests have different comfort temperatures that you should be able to provide for them when they’re staying in your rooms. I like to sleep cold, and they couldn’t do anything about it besides offing me a FAN. 

I was shocked and utterly disappointed. It made my whole experience do a 180. I slept terrible and wouldn’t stay here again. 

Some other things to note:

The lighting in the rooms are horrible. 
The bathrooms are VERY small 
The pillows are really soft and don’t offer any support. 
The restaurant attached is very pricy.
The lobby is PACKED all the time since people like to just hang here even if they’re not guests. 

My opinion is to stay someplace else that can accommodate your sleeping needs. Next time we won’t make the mistake of staying at a hotel we never herd of.

title: Hip hotel in NYC
text: This hotel was a little too cool for us (super dim lights, dj in the lobby, ironic catch phrases stenciled all over) but we liked it nonetheless. The mattress and pillows were comfy. The location is great. The room had was large by New York standards. The shower was definitely form over function, but we figured out how to make things work. All in all a good place to stay, especially if you are not paying full price.

title: Fantastic bar for a pit stop
text: I just returned from a long weekend in the city, and the lobby bar of the Ace was one of the sweet, little highlights. Although I was visiting family, I had a lot of work I needed to do. I had already booked in at another hotel, but I came across the Ace lobby bar and made it my working spot for the weekend. It was everything you need in a bar-- good beer, great atmosphere, free wifi, power, and great bartenders. The bartender recognized me with a warm welcome when I returned and took great care of me. Hoping I can book into the hotel itself the next time I'm there.

title: fun, stylish, get the late night room service cheeseburger, fries and cookies
text:
We absolutely loved staying at the Ace in NY! My boyfriend got us tickets to Sleep No More and we wanted a reasonably priced, convenient place to stay. We looked into other options and all were about the same price as the Ace. 

When we got to the hotel, we were able to drop our luggage off and explore the city easily! We used public transit and walked everywhere we wanted to go, so the location was very convenient. When we got back to the hotel, we received a complimentary upgrade (TY!) and were able settle in and take a quick nap before heading out to our show. 

We had a perfect stay here. The room was nice and cool, the bedding and mattress were super comfy. The little touches like the soap (made in PDX, hey!), robes, stationary, aux cable/radio, wall mural and wine glasses made us love the room and our stay even more.  

After the show, we came back to the hotel, snapped a quick photo in the photobooth and had late night room service. I think the cheeseburger and fries were easily one of the best I've had in my life. PS order the cookie, it came warm and gooey and was delicious. It wasn't noisy, we slept well, the thermostat worked, we got a good night's rest and our stay was definitely a highlight of our trip.

title: A dog's night
text: I booked a 2 bed room at the top floor to spend a lovely 4 day weekend with my wife and 8 year old doughter. I have been a few times at the ACE and have really enjoyed my stay. Amaized how they could put together a kid next door to a room with a dog that was barking for more than 2 hours non stop. Best remedy for jetlug as you could imagine. I'm checking out this place the minute I find another option today. Say away from the ACE!!!

title: Beaucoup à dire et à redire ...
text:
#la chambre
12ième et dernier étage. Plutôt cool sur le papier. En plus la chambre 1217 est plutôt grande. Mais elle serait plus adapté à un lieu de stockage tant sa proximité avec les ascenseurs est dérangeante; bruit de machinerie, signal d’arrivée à l’étage, les gens parlent à toute heure du jour ou de la nuit. 
La forme en zigzag donne une impression d’espace, mais c’est surtout de l’espace perdu car il n’y a aucun endroit où s’asseoir sinon cette chaise d’architecte vintage tellement inconfortable.
Le lit est coincé dans une sorte d’alcôve. Du côté droit on a d’autre choix que de rentrer par l’extrémité. 
Il y a comme une odeur de poussière dérangeante quand on s’allonge sur le lit. 
#la salle de bain 
Le risque de tomber est légitime dans la douche. On se rattrape de justesse. Le système de dispenser est branlant rendant la douche jusqu’à être désagréable. On peine à faire couler l’eau et il faut s’y reprendre à plusieurs fois pour que la douche arrête de goutter. 
#le service 
Le room service atteint des prix siderants 113$ pour 2 club-sandwiches et 2 cocktails. Les prix des 50cl d’eau à 9$ donnent le ton.
#le lounge et restaurant
C’est tellement bruyant que nous avons opté pour le room service. L’ambiance bat son plein et c’est plutôt sympathique même si on n’y trouve pas sa place, 
Quand on demande très clairement au concierge s’il peut trouver des places au Joe’sPub sans dépasser les 30 dollars. On lui précise quand on comprend qu’il passe par un agent. On est quand même surpris de recevoir un mail avec ces mêmes places à 295$ que nous mémé trouvions sur place au guichet à 30.
Qu’est-ce qui sauve un peu les choses. 
La vue de la chambre est incroyable mais les fenètres si petites qu’on en profite à peine. 
Non, il y a trop à redire pour un hôtel si cher.
Ace à certainement ouvert la voie aux Hoxton, Yuurban, Mama Shelter qui eux ne prennent pas les clients pour des vaches à lait. L’Ace nous avait incroyablement gâté à LA. Pas à New York, signe que ces lieux sont des loteries. 
Mais a-t-on envie de jouer à 400€ la nuit ?

title: Seriously overrated
text:
I am writing this review while staying at the Ace Hotel in NYC on a 4-day business trip. I come to lower Manhattan often for work and usually stay at the far better Walker Hotel, but on this trip it was fully booked. Unfortunately, the Ace does not remotely stand up to the Walker, which is the far better place to stay. Next time!
My arrival at Ace was fine. The check in guy was very pleasant and recommended a good restaurant nearby for dinner. So far, so good. 
When I got to my room, it was uncomfortably stuffy and very warm. So I turned down the thermostat. Nothing happened. So I didn't unpack, in case I needed to move rooms. After an hour, I called the front desk and another guy told me - "we either have heat or air conditioning on, and right now it's heat. Turn off the system, open the window, and if you need it we can send you a fan." Unbelievable that for $400/night you cannot control the temperature in your room. I had a restless time on an unusually warm October night.
This morning, I had an early meeting, and decided to grab breakfast in Breslin's restaurant at 7.15 am. While the food was very good - poached eggs on lentils - the waitress told me there was no coffee. They hadn't brewed any yet. What restaurant opens for breakfast and doesn't have coffee ready? And, although I enjoyed the dish, the waitress also didn't tell me my eggs came with bread. So I ordered toast, which was not only unnecessary, but cost an additional $5. 
Honestly, I've stayed at budget hotels in out of the way places that were better equipped to deal with - and more pleasant to - their customers. And I've stayed at boutique hotels like the Walker and Soho Grand, and they're vastly superior. 
I strongly recommend you to steer away from the Ace.

title: Service, Comfort, and Style
text: The ACE hotel in NYC is perfectly located in Manhattan. Whether you're taking the subway or going on foot, it is easy to get everywhere you want to be. The concierge service is top-notch. They took fantastic care of my wife and I with all of our questions and needs.

title: Dorm Room Vibe
text: I was surprised by the many positive reviews for this place. I agree that the staff was friendly and the beds were comfy, but our room was reminiscent of a poorly decorated dorm room. The dark walls, dark floors, dim lighting and small window created a bleak and depressing atmosphere. I craved natural light during my stay!! Room design and furniture placement were nonsensical. The desk was the size of a TV tray table. One multi-purpose piece in the room served as a safe, nightstand, beverage center and an exposed closet. Your clothes hung over the tea kettle which was a fire hazard. In addition, the tv broke twice, the bathroom door wouldn’t close completely, and the door chain was broken. While many would enjoy the atmosphere of the Ace Hotel,  I expected much, much more at this price point.

title: Nice option for the 25-35 demographic
text:
ACE’s decor is bold “love or hate” kind. It’s cool, with a clear attitude to please 23-35s with details such as vinyl players and guitars at the rooms. 

That being said. Service is solid and attentive with comfortable and very well equipped rooms. 

Location is also very good, close to good dinning options and subway stations.

title: Week Stay in Gramercy
text: I stayed at the Ace Hotel New York in July following Pride week. I arrived the day of the big parade and although the route ended at the hotel, I was able to get in and out without issue and still had a quiet night's sleep. The coffee shop is convenient and the lovely flowers for purchase to spring up your room were a special touch. Drinks at the bar were average NYC hotel price and the vibe was worth it. My room was clean and comfortable and the full size refrigerator made my week stay even easier. The location is prime and staff are friendly!

title: Amazing stay at The Ace New York!
text: The entire experience was truly enjoyable, the room perfect, the service top notch and meant to wow the guests, the location perfect for our recent trip, our special occasion was acknowledged wonderfully...Many thanks Ace Team!

title: Beautiful Oasis
text: Absolutely love the Ace. The staff were beyond friendly and accommodating; excellent service in every way.
