The whole vibe of the place is easy and fun and such an oasis from the bustling city, while being in one of the most centralized spots in the city to use as a home base. Our room was so quiet and beautifully appointed; very clean and so relaxing. I will recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone I know who will be visiting the city, and this is now my one and only place to stay for trips to NYC. Also, Stumptown is delicious and so convenient!

title: Incredible location. Great hospitality.
text:
I recently stayed at the Ace Hotel in New York for the first time and was incredibly impressed and thoroughly pleased with my visit. The staff is kind and attentive, and provided all the extra courtesies that made our experience as smooth as possible. We were given directions, recommendations and they held our bags on requests (plus were incredibly expedient in fetching them for us). 

Our room was fantastic. The bed was the stuff dreams are made of. Ample pillows, comfortable linens and all the necessary accoutrements to make things as comfy as possible. We even had a bathtub, which was well used after miles of walking in the city. 

The lobby is bustling and well thought out. It was the perfect space to have a snack or cocktail while getting some work done. Also Stumptown coffee is 💯. 

We can’t wait to return to New York & to the Ace. Smiles all around.

title: Hipster place that has preventable flaws
text: We just returned to this place after staying here 6 months ago. We liked the feel of the place, the location, etc. That first time we booked a medium room which we liked but by most standards is really small. But they did seem to make the most of the space. This time we booked a large room. We got Attic 11, which is on the very top floor, above floor 12. Huge room - so far so good. But... very, very dark! The windows look out on a wall a few feet away, so no natural light. But virtually no artificial light either. There is a ceiling light in the entranceway, one bedside lamp (sorry, person who sleeps on the left side, no light for you) and a small lamp on the desk. The problem is that none of those 3 lights come close to illuminating the huge leather sofa in one part of the room. Lovely place to sit but you can't read there. I guess hipsters only read on electronic devices so don't need a lamp? Plus a variety of annoyances like a small sink the tilts away from the wall so that anything you put on top of it slides off and down in the sink, no soap at the sink, so you have to grab the body wash bottle from the floor of the shower to wash your hands, electronics unplugged so you have to figure out how to reconfigure everything. Simple things that could easily have been fixed. My suggestion is that someone in charge spend a night in that room and see how everything works.

title: Love this boutique hotel! Great coffee from Stumptown and a flower cart to brighten your day
text: Had a great stay at the Ace Hotel. Was in for a few days on a work trip. Good location, Stumptown coffee, flower cart to treat your self, great customer service (they sent someone right away when the volume on my tv seemed to not work, it wasn't the TV it was the movie I rented), delicious room service (had the club sandwich and grilled cheese), really fun after hours with a DJ and couches. Will definitely stay here again!

title: Good boutique hotel with great restaurant
text: Small rooms but comfortable and well equipped. Make sure you don't go for the smallest type of room.  Main reason to stay is location plus great restaurants and lively lobby area. Staff all cery friendly and welcoming.

title: Super plan
text: Ayant quitté un hôtel parce qu'il n'était pas à mon gout et trop sale, je me suis retrouvé sans endroit ou dormir heureusement j'ai trouvé cet hôtel très bien placé près de l'Empire State Building seul problème l’hôtel est aussi une boite de nuit

title: Hotel for hipsters
text:
I’ve stayed at the ACE a couple of times and it is brilliant if you like an ultra cool, hipster type place.

The lobby is amazing with friendly staff and good vibes.

The bar is also great - one of the best in midtown and I go
there a lot after work.

The location is also great - 5 mins to Times Sq and 5 mins to Flat Iron building.

The rooms aren’t really to my liking but nice enough if you like that style - record player, craft beers in fridge etc...

Definitely give it a go if you are in town for a weekend but there are probably more suitable work hotels that’s what your looking for.

title: ニューヨーカーになりきれるホテル！
text:
ホテルに一歩入ると暗すぎるくらいの照明でオシャレなニューヨーカーしか存在できない！そんな空間です(笑
日中のロビーラウンジは、宿泊客ではなさそうなノマドワーカー？な若者が沢山いて寛いでいました。夜はまたガラッと変わってオトナな雰囲気になります。
1階のスタンプタウンコーヒーはいつ行っても並んでいますが、すぐに行けるのはこのホテルのメリット。
部屋のインテリアには、アコースティックギターがあったり、窓からはエンパイアステートビルが目の前に見えたり、最高です。
唯一、水道管が古いためか、お風呂のお湯に赤茶色の錆が大量に出てきて止まらないので、せっかく湯船があるのに浸かる気がしませんでした。シャワーをサクッと浴びる程度にした方が良さそうです。

title: Great stay at Ace Hotel NY
text: Had a quick overnight stay at Ace Hotel and was treated to an upgrade by the wonderful front desk crew (shout out to Christopher). I’ve always been a great fan of Ace, 29th street in particular, and you’ve made this stay extra special. Thank you for recognizing the fact I’m a frequent guest, you guys are the best!

title: Fun Night in the City
text: My friend and I stayed at the Ace Hotel for one night during my trip to New York. When we got there, our room wasn't ready but they took our bags and gave us free tickets to the Museum of Modern Art so we could go there while we waited. The actual room was very nice too. It was very unique and different than any other hotel experience I've had. We could even see the Empire State Building from our window. Overall it was the coolest hotel I've ever stayed in and I would love to stay there again.

title: The only place I will stay in NYC! (so long as Christina and crew are running the show.)
text:
Amazing service from check-in to checkout.  Big shout out to Chistina and her team!  They made the stay enjoyable & stress-free from Sunday to Friday.  I would recommend this hotel staff to any person traveling to NYC!  

Business or leisure, the management and staff (housekeeping, front desk, dining & security) are top flight.  Need a package delivered to the hotel ASAP?  Security handled everything without batting an eyelash.  My mail was already in the room when I turned in for the day.  Hungry after a long day?  Hotel dining goes out of their way to make sure you are ready for the next day with great food & amazing service.

Big shout out to the entire staff for always being on top of their game during my stay!  I had one issue and it was with a third party vendor.  Ace Hotel management, specifically Christina, went above and beyond the call of duty to remedy the situation.

title: Birthday Fun, Ace is the Place!
text:
Cannot say enough about this fab hotel, the staff, the room, the location, the vibe, the amenities, Smeg full size fridge fully loaded, the coffee shop, the photo booth, the lovely neighbors in the adjacent room! Spent my birthday weekend in New York. I go fairly often and have been very loyal to the Marlton Hotel, but no more. I enjoyed this hotel and all it offered.

The rooms are spotless. They are large and nicely done. Loved the Martin guitar. Loved the turntable complete with album selection. The shower pressure was beyond my wildest dreams.

Above all, the location can’t be beat. Saw Ringo Starr at Radio City and will see Billy Joel in October so I hope to stay again soon. 

Lastly, a big thank you to Jason and his staff for taking excellent care of me on my birthday weekend in New York! Memories abound.

title: 젊은 느낌의 부티끄 호텔
text: 추운 겨울 이용했었는데 호텔 스텝들 친절 상냥하고 로비는 쉬기에 안락한데 사람이 너무 많았다.. 스몰룸에서 묵다가 퇴실하고 기상악화로 뱅기가 못떠서 혼자 다시 가서 미니룸을 썼는데 방구조랑 뷰가 스몰룸보다 괜찮았다 1층에 커피숍도 먹어볼만했고, 위치도 조용하지만 접근성 나름 양호한곳에있어 좋았다

title: good
text:
another good experience on another ace hotel

the reception got our room wrong in the first day but than upgraded for a way better on the second: the amazing loft bedroom

area is ok but not clean (that ny alright)

prices are worth it. 

come with no luggage and just buy it all at Opening Ceremony on the street level.

enjoy!!!

title: Bumpy start but thoroughly enjoyed our stay!
text:
We arrived around 7pm and our assigned room had a bit of a damp, musty smell. We were tired and hungry after travelling all day so we went straight out to dinner but when we returned, the damp and mustiness was much worse. We requested a room change from the front desk and to their credit they came up immediately with new room keys. Our second room though wasn't what we had requested (was on a lower floor with no bath tub and had a sink within touching distance of the bed which was quite odd) so we politely asked if it was possible to change again, which the front desk gladly accommodated. Third time was a charm as our new room was much better!

There were a few more hiccups in store - our safe broke with our belongings inside, which security had to come and fix (again, to their credit, a very nice man from security arrived immediately and was very friendly and fixed it without issue). And on the first night or two, the neighbouring guests in the room next door were having a party and there were people talking really loudly in the hallway and coming and going all night so we didn't get much sleep. But this wasn't really the hotel's fault and i'm sure if we had complained, they would have dealt with the issue. I suppose it comes with the territory of being a cool hotel in central NY with a young, fun clientele.

Following a bumpy start to our stay, the rest of our stay went by without any hiccups and we thoroughly enjoyed our time at the Ace. Location wise, i don't think it can be beaten. We didn't take the subway once as we walked everywhere (including to Brooklyn, but that was a ridiculously long walk and not sure i'd recommend it!)

The room was spotless and the bed was incredibly comfy that even with the noise disturbance i was able to get back to sleep ok. The staff were friendly but not sugary (which i liked!) and it made such a refreshing change to stay somewhere unique and non-corporatey.

In terms of improvements, it would be good to have a few more personal touches, e.g. during check in to ask guests how far they'd travelled, if they'd been to the city before, needed a map or directions from the hotel to certain tourist spots, needed help with any restaurant reservations etc. It always amazes me how many hotels get this wrong and don't bother interacting at all with guests, it's such an easy thing to do and really sets hotels apart and gives a positive first impression. For example, my husband had requested some restaurant recommendations via email before our stay but got no response which was a bit of a shame. And it was my 30th birthday but this was the first hotel i've stayed in during a special occasion that didn't wish me a happy birthday or post a little birthday note through the door at some stage. 

Anyway, minor grievances in what was on the whole a very enjoyable stay. Will we return soon? Most likely!

title: Super great location. Very happy
text: I Was there with the family and had the best service ever!! The staff is super pleasant and helpful. The place is super clean. Will be back soon since I don’t have to look for another location. Loved it!!

title: Vibrant and eclectic
text:
My wife and I stay at the Ace NY a few times a year when we visit family in the city. Staff is friendly and responsive, and consistently take good care of us. The rooms are very comfortable and well stocked (the beds in particular are some of the very best we've slept in). And the lobby is always vibrant and exciting, with a variety of interesting installations happening. There's a little street noise on the lower floors, but you're in the city. If you want total quiet, go to the country!

We're big fans, and we'll be back whenever we're in town.

title: Cet hôtel m'a réconcilié avec Manhattan
text:
Je n'aurais jamais pensé aimer dormir en plein midtown, mais l'Ace a changé ça. Les chambres sont confortables et bien insonorisées. Le petit bureau est bienvenu pour travailler un peu, la salle de bain est stylée et confortable (mention spéciale pour les incroyables robes de chambre mises à disposition). 
L'esprit global est bon : le personnel adorable, le hall rempli de hipsters sur leur mac est dépaysant et démesuré à la mesure de la ville. 
Enfin, et c'est un point important, on est au coeur de la ville. Il y a des stations de Citybike tout autour, et on peut être en moins de 15 minutes à Central Park,  de l'East Village, et rapidement à Brooklyn en métro.

title: amazing stay
text: We stayed here for 5 nights, we just had the mini room as there was just 2 of us and we found the room to be perfect, amazing shower and the hotel was in a great location. Staff are very helpful, from room questions, to recommending somewhere to eat nearby. Would stay here again

title: 薄暗くてテンションがダウン
text:
初めてのNY一人旅。人気のエースホテルに1泊しました。ミニルームでしたが、テレビの配線がおかしくて映らず。照明が最低限の為、昼間でも夜のようでテンションが下がります。冷蔵庫やポットがあるのは良かったけど、テーブルもイスもないので不便でした。
リピートはしません。

title: Funky and a solid choice
text: I stayed at Ace NYC the first weekend in May, I was in town for a conference. I found Ace online and thought it would fit my needs since it was near Penn Station and they didn’t require a deposit, just a card on hold until you arrived. The front desk checking in did not tell my they hold an additional $100 on top of the rate/tax for a mini bar fee, which I wasn’t expecting and it wasn’t explained by the front desk people, who mumbled the total anyway. As someone who works the front desk of a motel, I expected better. The luggage storage attendants were very nice. The room I stayed in on the 8th floor was great, the AC was exceptional and the view was nice. Love the full size toiletries in the shower and wall art, as well as soap on a rope. I slept comfortably and it was not too noisy all considering. For $300/night for a double room, I was satisfied and would definitely consider returning.

title: Bad. Afraid I might get a lung disease.
text: This hotel is just bad. Bad. Bad. Bad. Came in for one night and had this hotel picked because was curious how it is. But what a terrible choice. It literally smells like pee from the minute you walk out of the elevator to the moment you enter the room. And when you enter the room, good luck! The smell is even worse, the radiator is incredibly filthy and I was literally afraid of breathing. It’s disgusting. The room is cheap and poorly decorated as if designed for a boy dorm. It’s hipster wanna be gone really bad. This is probably the worst review I’ve ever written, but believe me, this is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in.

title: A me piaACE
text:
Quasi una tappa fissa. Hotel Hipster, giovane, incasinato e roboante. Non avrà’ i servizi di un 4 stelle e neppure le camere da 4 stelle...ma a me tutta questo mix industrial indie piace: sara’ che mi fa sentire piu’ giovane e decisamente a NY? Comunque: se scegliete bene la camera, le camere sono anche abbastanza spaziose, la zona per me e’ strategica. Poi da non perdere: al Breslin, se trovate un tavolo e sopravvivete al casino fanno un fantastico LAMB BURGER! E al coffe’ shop, stumptow coffe, la qualita’ e’ eccelsa tanto che la mattina si formano lunghe code.
Io ci tornero’

Grazie per l’ospitalita’.

title: Cool Hotel, OK Rooms
text:
I stay at this Ace from time to time for business. Central location, buzzy lobby, two solid restaurants, plus Stumptown and Black Seed for on-the-go. Trendy, diverse, creative-industry guests vs midtown touristy vibe. Choose this hotel if you appreciate these features of a property. 

If your room is your top priority, know that they are hit or miss. Some have been quiet, comfortable and well maintained. Others are noisy and in need of repair. My current “medium” room on the second floor is so dark and dreary it’s difficult to know whether it’s day or night.

title: Nothing cool or fun about Ace Hotel New York
text: The lobby is dark and crowded with non-hotel guests and elevators are small.  Our room was dreary and uncomfortable, perfectly described by another reviewer as a boy’s dorm room.  The room smelled of (urine? wet dog?) the entire time and brown water would come out of the bathroom taps from time to time.  Rooms to the street (even on high floors) are noisy with construction and traffic.  The location was ok.  The only positive was that hotel staff were pleasant and accommodating, although no staff helped us with doors/luggage/hailing cabs.  Would not recommend this hotel with so many better options at this price point.  Staying at this hotel was the low point of an otherwise great trip to NYC.

title: Stylish hotel close to it all!
text:
This was my first time in New York, and after much searching and review reading, my partner and I settled on Ace Hotel. I'm so glad we did, It was great! From the customer service in the lobby to the thoughtful touches in our hotel room, we couldn't have picked somewhere better suited for us. We'd just finished up a 3 week road trip around the USA, and we wanted somewhere close to public transport, and to all the 'must-sees' in NY. We were within walking distance to the train station, and could easily walk to Chelsea, East Village, Soho and more!

The room was spacious, and bigger than I thought it would be. I loved the small, stylish touches, felt very welcomed by the staff and the coffee shop downstairs was great too. The only criticism I have is that I would have loved to have had a drink in the lobby, however whenever I went down, it was very busy and seating was hard/impossible to find so ended up going to a bar elsewhere. 

I would stay here again for sure!

title: Great hotel to be snowed-in in!
text: You really get to know a hotel when you're snowed in! The Ace was very comfortable for us to stay in, we had a junior suite with wonderful views and a dream-worthy bed. Our dogs were with us and we were very thankful the Ace is pet-friendly. It was a nice staycation kind of vibe! Stumptown Coffee in the lobby was essential and the adjacent restaurants were delicious. Having an Opening Ceremony through the lobby didn't hurt any either. The location is great - not TOO downtown and not TOO uptown, and yet also not TOO midtown. It suited us just fine, and we couldn't be happier with our stay. It was a great value, and we recommend it to all friends and visitors coming to NYC.

title: Wonderful Stay in NYC
text: This was my first time staying at an Ace property and it will not be my last. The lobby ambiance was cozy with oversized couches and seating - a great place to relax and unwind after a busy day of exploring the city. Our room was very spacious and clean and had a picturesque view of the Empire State building peeking up above the adjacent building. Every associate we came into contact with was helpful & pleasant. Thanks for a wonderful stay!

title: Fun boutique style
text: We had a room with two double beds so the room was nice and large with a foyer , large fridge , ironing board , safe and open  closet, the window gave a view of the Empire State Building. The staff at the front desk are young and very helpful. The lobby is a happening place with lots of couches and a bar at the back that also gets very busy. The lobby is very dark though the young people seemed to love it. Clean rooms and constant flow of fresh towels. Good internet connection.

title: Best hotel in NYC!
text:
Absolutely love this hotel, perfect location, great staff, amazing rooms.

Ideal for a business trip as there is everything you need and did many of my meetings at the hotel or just near by - also great oyster place just next door!

title: Great Location
text: This was my first time at the Ace; I was there with a friend for a girl's weekend. The service was great from the moment we got there - the front desk attendant was able to get a us a room right away so we could make our late lunch reservation. The lobby and decor throughout the hotel are very fun and the coffee shop off the lobby is a bonus. Super comfy beds and a view of the Empire State Building. The room was a little musty and damp. But the biggest complaint is that there is only one mirror in the entire room and it's in the bathroom. How are two people supposed to get ready? Why isn't there a full length mirror anywhere? There's plenty of room on the blank wall that only hosts the TV. It may seem like a small thing but when you are traveling with friends, it's super inconvenient. Other than that, the location is awesome. I love the trees lining the street out front. And again, great service from the front desk and bell staff.

title: Great Two-Night Stay
text: This was my fifth Ace Hotel (after LA, Palm Springs, Portland, and New Orleans) and I was happy to find it consistent in comfort and style to the rest. As I had hoped, the bed was incredibly comfortable, and I slept very well. The room was not huge but it was well-designed to not feel cramped. The big fridge full of refreshments was nice. The location was superb. Walking to the Empire State Building, Keens Steakhouse, Grand Central Station, Times Square, and other locations was no problem. I don't know NYC that well and I don't know if this is typical, but there was no valet parking. I parked in the lot a couple of blocks down the street, which offers a discount for Ace guests. The service was good - maybe a little less warm and fuzzy than California - but completely fine. The attached oyster bar was a delight. I wasn't as thrilled by the super-meaty menu in the main restaurant, but what I had there was good. The lobby scene was a little loud for me (and surprisingly dark) so I didn't spend much time there. Overall, I'd be happy to stay here again.

title: Team ACE NY always delivers
text: I stay at the ACE NY quite often for work and for fun. It’s only a few blocks from Penn Station, a quick walk to Times Square, and really in the heart of midtown. Front desk and door staff are always friendly and efficient, the food is always fantastic, and the rooms are fun and different, and beds super comfortable. I won’t stay anywhere else in NYC!

title: Beautiful New York, New York, New York
text:
I arrived to hotel in buisness, from the walked in hotel seems so nice and tidy, 
Reception staff very nice felt me welcime warm, 
Hotel is at great location 
My room was very special and beautiful with great bed
Only my one let down was restaurant staff and service 
Didn't felt that extra mile costumer service and not warm welcome even wasn't busy enough 
Generally recommend this hotel beacouse is worth it 
And I love New York 
We done team and management

title: 생각보단 그냥 그랬어요
text: 기대가 너무 컸나봐요. 기대보다는 그냥 그랬어요. 하지만 침대도 편하고 방도 꽤 넓은 편이었으며, 수납할 공간도 넉넉한 편이라 대체로 만족합니다.

title: I appreciate that my age doesn't fit the profile of this hotel
text:
ACE Hotel is similar to a Soho House type hotel but in my opinion not as good, although I should state that I've only ever stayed in one Soho House Hotel which is in Berlin and is a great hotel.

ACE Hotel is very well located in Manhattan and within walking distance from wherever I wanted to go. Staff are friendly and always eager to help. It's a hotel designed for the younger guest with great touches and I suspect I was probably twice the age of the average guest. That didn't bother me but because non residents are encouraged or certainly not discouraged from using the lobby as a place of work, it's not a relaxing environment nor I imagine designed to be.

Rooms are small which would certainly put off my wife who suffers mildly from claustrophobia. I appreciated the fact that I wasn't charged for breakfast because a simple request took so long to arrive that my breakfast was soon rendered tepid. 

Would I stay here again, probably not simply because there wasn't enough to draw me back but I'm sure there are others who are repeat customers.

title: Good location
text: Room was clean with a well stocked fridge of expensive items. A great location: around the corner to the subway stop and only a few blocks to the Empire State building and Penn Station. Simple breakfast is served in the lobby, with a coffee bar right there.

title: Very good and very different
text:
I checked out this afternoon after six nights on a business trip. This hotel as a hotel is great I love the vibe the service the rooms the design the comfort it all rally very good. I had one of the best beds I have ever had! The combination of old fashion style design with good casual service is great. The restaurant need a stretch I think it can do a lot more. The oyster bar next door is very good and the coffee bar next door is really good (Stumptown). 

Despite all the goods a few comments;

1. We checked in last Friday on 2 rooms our flight arrived at like 05:30 am so we got to the hotel at 06:30 am. When you ask for a room earlier than the normal check in schedule they say yes we do have a room unfortunately it’s not the room you book but you can upgrade for an additional this and that. They know that you are tired after along flight, all you want is to take a shower and relax and they take advantage of you. Not nice! On the check out date we specifically asked for a late check out and after a few emails back and fourth we received an email confirming that we can stay until 2 pm on both room despite that a guy came to one of our rooms and asked that we vacate the room immediately. I have file a complaint with the front desk but all I got was “I apologize “
Hotel has a great gym and a great staff and most of all a great location thanks

title: Super Cool Hotel
text: I have stayed at the Ace in NYC twice and I love the dark masculine tasteful. Super comfortable bed, great coffee shop and the restaurant and bar are great (the lamb burger is amazing). Staff was friendly, yet not over involved. First time I was there I was upgraded to a bigger room.

title: Just about cool enough for the Ace Hotel
text: I stayed at the Ace Hotel last year for business (recommended by a friend) and then a solo weekend in New York. It's a great midtown venue with clean and well-described bedrooms; many of them are small but they are certainly adequate and well-appointed. I visited again this year and the restaurant was too busy to get a table (so I assume it is popular). I had requested a quiet room, and was happy with what I was allocated on one of the higher floors. I would certainly stay again, and recommend it.

title: Dark Noisy No Coffee
text: Maybe for young people? Beware even as you enter the lobby is like a party, loud music and really dark. Rooms are tiny need some renovation, dark also, and bar is full, yes but nothing is free. No coffee or tea in the rooms.. You can ask them for tea and they will bring it..  Gym looks small but works 24 hoursbin basement.. Restaurants look popular..

title: hip!
text:
I stayed here over Memorial Day weekend for a solo trip. I flew into EWR from San Francisco and took the train to Penn Station and walked 10 minutes to the Ace Hotel. Check in was easy, I arrived around 1AM so there was no line. I got into my room and was amazed by how hip and fun it was! A little dark in the room and it was small, but I have stayed in smaller rooms before.

I loved the coffee shop downstairs and went there every morning! The hotel is very close to the subway which is just around the corner and very central in Midtown. It is walking distance to Times Square(about a mile). Koreatown is a few blocks away, there is night life and late night eats there.

I would not hesitate to stay here again!!

title: Great place to stay
text: Good spot with access to multiple metro stops and easily walkable to different neighborhood and sites. Stayed in a bunkbed room and it was perfect. Beds were comfortable and the room/floor was quiet even with some much going on around. Bar downstairs was good as well.

title: Anniversary
text: Great stay overall. Complimentary bottle of wine  from hotel management in our room and delish. Totally comfy bed and pillows. Great oysters at John Dory restaurant and string cappuccino at coffee bar, both downstairs, almond croissant esp. yummy indulgence. Love this neighborhood lots to do.

title: Trendy Hotel
text: We came to stay here for a quick visit in New York for a friend’s wedding. We come to NYC pretty often, and I think this hotel was one of the few we’ve stayed in that made us feel like we’re actually on vacation.  We came in a half hour before check in and they also just had a room ready for us.  Also, we had brunch with friends at the Breslin (one of the restaurants in the hotel), and it was delicious.  We called a few minutes in advance and they didn’t have a table available in the normal seating area,  but when we told them we were hotel guests and had a bus to catch, they reserved a bar table for us.  Downside/reason for four stars: most other hotels will give you extra time to check out for free, but ACE charges a significant amount.  The amenities were good, but not sure it would be worth it if we had to pay 300+ for a mini room (we found a discounted rate online).   Otherwise loved the hotel!

title: "Cool" spot but dimly lit and pricey.
text:
The Ace Hotel is clearly a brand first, a hotel second. All over are witty puns written graffiti style into the walls, logo t-shirts for sale. Nice touches. 
A very busy lobby means space is hard to find even as a guest, but unfortunately the business is more comparable to a popular internet cafe, than a socialising space. 90% will be on their laptops.
The room itself (mine was marked as small and had an internal view) was well kept and had a good shower, but breakfast was not included and the hotel restaurant was very pricey. 
Ther lobby was so dim, all day round. Why?!
29th and Broadway is a very good location and that was a big plus. 
I'll look for a less fashionable hotel next time with a larger room and breakfast included. Shouldn't be hard for $2500/6nights!!

title: ACES
text:
The vibe in the lobby is reason enough to stay at The Ace. So is the coffee shop. So is the speed bag in the gym.

Walking distance to Union Square, a short jog across town to the High Line, sexy!

Ask the front desk to leave a guitar in your room. Next time you visit NYC, do yourself a favor: stay here!

title: Total dump - why would anyone stay here?!!
text:
Why would anyone stay here?!! I’ve stayed in hostels that are much nicer than this. I can't figure out how this hotel gets away with charging the prices they do, which are on par with legit nice hotels in the area. The value proposition is terrible, unless you really enjoy staying in a dump. I’ve stayed in a number of very cool boutique hotels that delivered an incredible experience (the original Redbury in Hollywood, the Surfjack in Waikiki, the NY Public, the NY Standard). This hotel is like a bad frat house that needs to be condemned. 

The overall vibe. Too cool for school. If you’re older than 30, you’ll feel geriatric. The lobby is crowded all the time, with no place for actual guests to sit. The front desk was almost friendly, but very disinterested. 

The room. It’s hideous. The only thing on the walls is a large graphic that says “RELAX”. The lone window has a cheap roller-shade that’s cheaper than the window covering in my college dorm. Your options for light are a bright ceiling light or a broken task light above the desk that will no longer hold the position that you try to aim it in, as it keeps falling back down. The bathroom – wow, it’s worse than what I’d expect to find in prison. Dirty looking tile and a horrible small shower surrounded on 3 sides by shower curtains that are too small to actually enclose the shower, hence you inevitably get water all over the tiny space. Horrible – I couldn’t wait to get out of this room.

The noise. I very clearly heard EVERYTHING in the rooms around me. The woman next door was talking on the phone, and I clearly heard the entire conversation, and that’s just the PG stuff….

I’m still in shock that people are willing to pay as much as they do for the serious abuse that this hotel offers. I ended up canceling a final night and moved to the Nomad hotel a block away, which was an incredible experience for the same rate I was charged here!

title: Great stay
text: Loved everything....clean, great service, great lobby, great coffee shop, close to subway. Got a room with Empire State Building view and sofa ... I just loved it! One recommendation more lighting in the room. I will be back very soon

title: a night to remember
text:
I’m a wanderer. Short term on the weekends, regional until I can push the walls out, and these past 13-weeks within range of the Capital of the World—I know how you see yourself NYC, no false modesty in your house. I wanted a night in town, central to adventures after dark, but still within range of the shops and restos up-, mid- and downtown. The Ace did not disappoint. 

I’d never stayed at an Ace, but its status for stylishness precedes it and, feeling randy, I went all in. To be clear, my adventures take all forms and I’m as likely to use the tent I keep in my car as I am to grab a last minute airbnb or a new friend to rest my head as the body commands and the mind obeys. The Ace, set as the staging area for my night in the big city, was a level up to the gentle pretentions of your friend in finance who moonlights as a creative from his loft in Williamsburg. 

By day, the part of Midtown in which the Ace finds itself is exemplary of the tarnished brass of new New York: Gotham neighborhoods in transition from sooty film noir to shiny juice bars, hip restaurants and boutique shops that, shuttered and streetlit by night, reveal a glimpse of the timeless metropolis of 20th century film and literature. From the Ace, you can and should walk everywhere, day and night—just not at rush hour.

Arriving at the hotel, vaguely designer understated city clothes on display, I walked into a space that felt as equally composed for business professional events as singles conventions, with floor tiles that could have served in a Roman bath. The room was no less impressive: spacious (by actual, non-New York standards), comfortable, with a vintage fridge and an aesthetically pleasing if functionally anomolous turntable (fidi friend in wburg). The staff, when I was present in the hotel to interact with them, were friendly, helpful and, in some cases, engaging to look at. 

Overall, and very much owing to the Ace, a very productive night in the city.

title: Over stylized but nice!
text: The service here was phenomenal and I had a very nice double bed room that was large. I gave four stars because the aesthetic and vibe is all very specific and planned that it was a bit predictable and too much for me, but that's a personal  preference. If you are looking for an energetic and stylish place to stay, give it a try!

title: Trip #3.  Happy Birthday to me!
text: Upon check in they told me happy birthday and upgraded me to a loft!  What a great gift.   The loft was amazing and full of character.  I spent my first night soaking in the claw tub with a glass of wine.  Everything was clean and fresh as usual.  There was a little street noise but for me it was part of the NYC experience so I kind of liked it and slept with no problem.  The staff couldn't be nicer.  I truly found a home here and can't say enough great things about this place.  Looking forward to next time!

title: One of the best experiences!
text: The rooms are very clean, the hotel stuff is very nice and helpful, the rooms are very clean and tidy. The hotel is very near city center, just 5 blocks from Macy’s and you can see Empire State Building from one of the rooms. Wonderful experience!

title: Perfect NY Staycation!
text: I was able to secure a fantastic rate during a weeknight at the Ace NY and decided to do a mini staycation. My experience as a guest was flawless! The front desk was super friendly and I was lucky enough to get upgraded to a higher room category. I had a gorgeous view of the Empire State Building, what a treat! I indulged in a lamb burger from The Breslin (THE BEST) and listened to records provided by the hotel. The lobby is the best if you need to get some work done + enjoy the best coffee ever from Stumptown. I highly recommend as a local or a visitor you check out the Ace Hotel.

title: We keep coming back
text: Went to NY for 3 days to celebrate a special occasion with our son. The staff was very friendly and engaging. We've stayed there multiple times, and between the staff and the location, we'll keep doing so!

title: Great once again!
text: I really do love the stay here. I actually look forward to it every time I visit NYC. The staff is super friendly and very accommodating. The rooms are super clean and I even got a free one night upgrade on my room and not to mention the great room service. If I had anything negative to say about my room would be the little street noise but it didn’t really bother me. This is NYC after all.  Great job once again Ace Hotel to you and the entire staff for making me feel welcomed!

title: Went the Extra Mile
text:
I booked a room to celebrate my wedding anniversary, and went to the check-in desk early that day to plant a gift for my wife.  When we arrived, they not only had my gift there, but they upgraded my room and left a lovely card and a bottle of champagne.
Class act all the way.  Plus, the place was really cool.

title: Buyer Beware
text:
I stayed here for one night for business and never plan to stay here again. I had to change my first room as the locks wouldn’t work and it smelled like mildew. The second room what somewhat better but the TV didn’t work and the hot water kettle leaked. There didn’t seem to be any coffee or tea in the room - just some dusty snacks in the mini bar area. I also had a hard time getting past the weird soap on a string in the bathroom. 

The hotel tries to have distressed-chic vibe but I found it dirty and cheap looking. The location is good, the lobby and bars are busy and the staff was very nice.

title: Cool and fun hotel in NYC
text: We stayed at the Ace for one week in January. This hotel is hip and quite busy, with a big lobby that attracts the young crowd, maybe because it has a good bar and  two wonderful restaurants, The Breslin and  the John Dory. We booked two different rooms, small and medium. They both have a good size, although the bathroom is quite small. The small room didn't have an outside view, so it was quite dark. Both restaurants, as previously mentioned, are great. There is also a coffee shop at the lobby, good for  a quick caffeine fix. The location is great, with many attractions, shopping and good restaurants nearby. I highly recommend The Ace for people looking for a comfortable and modern place to stay in NYC.

title: Awful Dump
text: For the price this is the worst hotel we ever stayed in. The room looked like a bad dorm . It is in a decent location and Caesar at the front desk kindness and patience is the only reason I gave this dump two stars. It did not feel clean.

title: Reliable hipster hotel in nyc
text: I've stayed here a few times over the years, most recently last month, and consistently recommend to friends and biz associates. The staff is always cordial and the neighborhood terrific.  I'm knocking off one star for the facilities themselves which have shown some wear and tear since I first started staying here in 2013! The hotel itself has not been kept up as well as it should be.  The rates have been lowered it seems tho, so still well worth it.  The in house restaurants are also very good and "sceney" for our of town guests, which is good; the ny vibe is strong.

title: Overblown- overhyped- overpriced.
text:
This property is literally ALL hype. Yes, it has great restaurants and it's in a convenient location, but you could stay at a more adult hotel for this price and walk over for food or a cup of strong coffee. I travel for work frequently and can stay in my choice of hotels. NoMad was sold out- so our travel department recommended Ace based on reviews. Never again. Lobby full of hipsters on computers- no room for guests. The room I stayed in was tiny- so I moved to a larger room - only to discover the mattress wreaked of URINE, the shower did not drain and I was standing in a foot of water by the end, the room was so dark you could not even see to put makeup on- absolutely no lighting anywhere, and the outlets were so loose that you could not charge a device without the plug falling out of the socket, completely impractical and dirty and dark... but it did come with a guitar in the corner- absolutely a joke. Also, there was not even lotion in the bathroom at this price point---- not a cheap hotel. 
I tried to inform management of the issues- they told me they would follow up - and they did not. After several phone calls, saying something at checkout and emailing them- I gave up. The service people at the front desk made me feel as though they were doing me a favor by talking to me. After traveling all over the world and staying in phenomenal hotels- I can honestly say this stay felt like a total practical joke on me. I would not recommend this to friends or those I work with. There are tons of options for great hotels in the city and in this area- try another!

title: Good service and location
text: My stay was very comfortable, hotel staff is polite and kind, good and clean rooms. But the room was very small and had no view. Great location and close to the subway station. So overall is a good stay!

title: Trendy hotel, kleine Kamers
text: Trendy hotel aan broadway en goed gelegen om in Manhattan uitstapjes  te maken. Kamers hebben een oude Jaren 60 uitstraling en zijn oud gemaakt, maar wel schoon. Enige minpunt is dat de kamers wel erg klein zijn, op de foto is de hele badkamer te zien op 1 foto. Verder prima voor een overnachting.

title: 十分復古帶時尚的旅店
text: 是老飯店改的，很有復古風格，房間也是很美式的風格，工業風很極致，但因為浴室也是走老舊路線，由於前兩天才住過MOXY, 相較之下，會比較不適應光線總是暗暗的ACE。地點一樣很棒！如果想體驗看看，還是可以來試試看！

title: All around great stay!
text:
We love this hotel. The basics are well taken care of, I.e.- it's clean, the beds are so cozy, the shower has great water pressure, the staff is extremely friendly and caring, the building is beautiful and the location is perfect. Then there's the difference makers... The environment is so fun and full of great vibes. The lobby turns into a fun clubish hangout on weekend nights, Breslin restaurant is my favorite in the city and stumptown coffee is off the hook! There's only one place I stay when I'm in NYC and it's here at The Ace hotel!!

Thanks for another great stay Ace!

title: Mini room was impressive
text: Amazing hotel, cool vibes and fantastic room. I was in a mini room and it was one of the most innovative rooms I’ve stayed in! Did not feel small at all, it was really generous and had a full sized bathroom with a quality hair dryer. Loved it and am keen to try more locations.

title: Nice!
text: Looking to get a last minute booking in the city, my cousin recommended the Ace as a very cool place to stay.  Lucky to get a small room that fit my budget!  When I showed up - the front desk person said they upgraded me to a medium room, which in additional to a nicely stocked fridge also provided a guitar - apparently they have never heard me play.  Bottom line - from the front desk to the excellent bedding and wonderful food staff person who hustled to get me my toast and coffee within 15 so I could catch my ride - great experience!  Thank you for the great night!

title: Hotel tres bien placé à quelques mètres de l’Empire State Building..
text:
Branché oui!
Clientèle sophistiquée mode, ciné etc
Lounge incroyable avec DJ tous les soirs..
Beaucoup d’humour au Desk et inscriptions rigolotes dans les chambres ..
Mais, mais hôtel avec une très mauvaise insonorisation ..si vous voulez savoir ce que fait le voisin, c’est le bon endroit!
Le double vitrage non plus, ils connaissent pas..il vaut mieux donc, demander un étage élevé et une chambre sur la cour...
Ah oui, si vous n’avez pas vraiment besoin de l’air conditionné très bruyant, oubliez le!
Bon.. on a quand même bien aimé..

title: Amazing Staff - Amazing Stay
text:
I recently had to put myself and 5 clients up while shooting in NY and we were very fortunate to stay at the Ace Hotel NY. 

The rooms were great, comfortable and the perfect size to come back to after long work days.  The location was right in the heart of the Flatiron District so walking out the door for dinner, drinks or just to take in the city was super easy and convenient.  The hotel lobby can be kind of crazy busy, but that is what adds to the charm of the place.  Most of our clients were from Paris and they loved the true NY feel and vibe of the place. 

And lastly I cannot say enough great things about the staff.  We had a few changes and requests we needed to make during our stay and the staff was always friendly, on top of it and consistently there to try and make happen whatever request we threw at them. 

If you are looking for a place to stay for work or even just for a get away, Ace NY rocked in my opinion!

Ron

title: Super Estiloso
text:
Hotel bem localizado. Perto de tudo! Possui uma decoração unica! 
A noite há DJ agitando o Lobby. Muito legal e divertido.
O quarto é aconchegante e possui um excelente enxoval (cama e banho).
Staff muito simpático.

title: Excellent Hotel, great location, awesome atmosphere
text:
I stayed in the Ace, based on a recommendation of a friend as I travel to NYC monthly from LA for work. A travel agency books our travel at work so i didnt make the reservation myself. When I checked in, I discovered that the room was booked for the wrong week, it was also passed 11pm so I couldn't call the travel agency. The front desk staff were amazing and booked me a night at my original rate so that I could call the agency and book it the next day. I spoke to reservations who were also incredibly helpful and accommodated me for the week. I was then expecting a terrible room, but was surprised at the size. The bed was amazing and the shower is fantastic. Order the club sandwhich from room service, it's AMAZING.
Everyone was really helpful even down to house keeping, already booked for the next trip to NYC

title: Decalé
text:
Ayant bénéficié d'un surclassement, nous avons séjourné dans une suite de plus de 30 m2 avec vue sur Broadway. Bien insonorisée, volets intérieurs, décoration très décalée, avec un énorme frigo vintage copieusement garni. Une guitare et une platine vynil, si vous êtes musicien et rétro.....
L'ambiance du lobby est surprenante :studieuse le jour avec des dizaines de geeks sur leur PC portable, ambiance disco le soir.
Service en chambre correct mais cher.
Idéalement placé au centre de Manhattan.

title: Recharge Visit
text:
I used Ace for a few hours using Recharge. Recharge is a fairly new app that allows users to stay in hotels by the minute. I stayed due to the checkout time at the hotel I was staying at and my late flight out of JFK. I chose Ace because it was the only Recharge property that would let me book in advance.

Before booking at Ace do your homework. The Ace is not for everyone. It is a dark hipster property that is a bit overdone in my opinion. The checkin staff was very nice. The lobby was WAY overcrowded. I mean packed with people who were obviously hanging out after checkout time.

Rooms are tiny (typical in NYC) but again, do your homework. The rooms are clean but very “stylized” in a hipster bygone era style. I was only there to spend some time before flying out so don’t want to go too deep into bed comfort etc. bathroom was roomy with all the essentials. Absolutely no view from the room and the room was overall very dark.

Buggy TV, and a weird radio sitting on the AC unit.

Obviously the Ace has found a niche — just not my style.

title: Great vibe in the spacious lounge
text: Fortunate to experience one of Brooklyn's finest DJs, Conrad Clifton. He commanded the Ace lounge, and turned up the vibe during his set. The bar and food service was exceptional. If Conrad Clifton were the only DJ, would've earned 5 stars.

title: NYC WEEKEND - ACE
text:
Went to the ACE Hotel with my 16 year old daughter for a weekend trip to New York.
Loved the vibe. Loved the design. Great location. Beds are so comfy. Rooms are cool. Staff very helpful. All in a great hotel.

A very clean hotel with the comfiest bed Ive ever slept in. We stayed over the weekend when it was very busy. 10 floors up.. quiet as a mouse. We both really enjoyed our stay and would defo come back. Excellent location. Easy to navigate around NYC from here.

Downside. Tried brunch in the Breslin. For the price we paid the pancakes weren't up to much. A tad tasteless. Better eating out. Apart from that nothing else to complain about.

title: Great vibe, even better design
text: The best hotel staff I have ever encountered. Plus, it's vibrant when you enter the lobby, it has character when you enter a room, and it has details in its design everywhere that just keeps you smiling. As a regular I'm a big fan.

title: One of my all time favourites!
text: I absolutely love this hotel, an excellent recommendation from a friend. The interior is chic and one-of-a-kind. The lounge area is cozy and spacious with big brown leather couches where some dog owners bring their pets for a coffee in the morning. The Coffeeshop has the best coffee in town and delicious pastries. The bar serves great wines, beers and exquisite cocktails. Reception service is excellent and check-in is quick and easy with friendly staff always lending a helping hand. A MUST try is the Breslin restaurant, the lamb bacon is to die for and the dinner menu is also packed with goodness. Each room is uniquely hipster designed and our double room had a guitar and a record player! Smaller rooms have bunk beds as an option if you are keen to share. The location is another favourite, the hotel is based north of the Flatiron District and east of Chelsea. The 28th subway is about 2min walk. This hotel is a must try if you are a foodie, if you love good quality ‘proper’ coffee and if you looking for a one-of-a-kind interior design experience.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text:
Comfortable beds, great coffee, great vibe, and location is perfect.  Can be in times square in 10 min.  two stops on the train.  I travel to NYC at least once a month and this is my spot.

Any forgot to mention, they really inspect the rooms for cleanliness.  All around solid hotel.

title: Fantastic
text: Arrived at The Ace yesterday, and just have to say how fantastic this place is. Second visit, super friendly check in, fabulous room, just love it!  Don’t want to leave........ could sit in the lobby all day but there’s that little place called Manhattan just outside the front door and I guess it has to be seen........

title: Excellent location, spectacular service, and super comfy bed!
text:
My husband and I travel a lot, both domestically and internationally. Whenever possible, we stay at an Ace Hotel. We love the young vibe and the bustling lobbies filled with interesting people (and old fashioned photo booths!), and there's always good food nearby. 

The NY Ace is one of our favorites! We've stayed there twice, and are going back again this weekend. Staff there is super friendly and attentive, and the rooms are very comfortable and well-equipped (their little packets of cashews are SO good!), and clean. The bed especially is deliciously comfy, which we so appreciate (and our backs thank us for). We also appreciate that some rooms include a sofa that turns into another comfortable bed (big enough for our 6'4" son).

The hotel is in a busy part of the city (the view of the Empire State Building from our window was gorgeous), so there is some noise. But the windows and shutters do a great job of blocking it out. 

Plus, the city bustling means there are loads of great restaurants, bars, and shops nearby. The Ace's restaurant—the Breslin—is insanely good (and busy, so make sure to make a reservation)! We ate there several times during our stay, and loved every meal. One night, we had such a fun experience trying the most amazing gin drinks from one of the best bartenders we've met on our journeys. 

There's also a Stumptown in the lobby, if like us, good coffee is important to you. Plus, there's an adorable little gift shop next door with all sorts of fun and unusual gifts (that's where we usually pick something up for our kids back home).

The lobby is almost always busy and bustling, filled with travelers from all over the world. And there's often something cool happening there that involves music. We never know what we'll find there when we come down from our room, but it's always upbeat and interesting. The hotel is also dog friendly, which we appreciate!

If having a comfortable bed and well-equipped room is important to you, you want tasty food and drinks nearby, and you enjoy being around creative and interesting people in a great part part of the city, the Midtown Ace is a perfect choice!

title: Good hotel.  Good venue for corporate event.  Poor elevators.
text:
I organized a week long corporate workshop for 70 people, with as many rooms.  We also rented the Liberty Hall, as well as several lofts, and the conference room.  It was a great success.

The staff were very helpful in trying to satisfy our various needs.  The John Dory restaurant was great.  

My only compliant is that there are too few elevators and they are too slow.  But I got lots of exercise walking the stairs. 

Overall I was very satisfied.

title: Hôtel branché bien plzce
text:
Grande chambre. J avais pris la chambre « médium.
Déco assez branchée : mini bar dans un flycase etc..

Bémol : chambre assez sombre pour moi.
Lobby très sympa mais très bruyant le soir car le bar de l hôtel est branché et il y a beaucoup de monde.
Ma chambre était au 7eme étage et je n ai entendu aucun bruit.

Petit café attenant à l hôtel, sinon il y a des cafés partout pour prendre un petit dej.

Le métro est à 2 pas. Hôtel bien placé dans Manhattan.

title: Great place to stay!
text:
Our family of three (boy, 10 yrs) stayed here for a week, and the hotell was great in every way; good service, great location, fun and hip vibe and, finally, a really nice room.
The hotel is easy to find, and is located close to the Empire State Building. Subway right around the corner.
Our room was spacious, with two good-sized beds. Bathroom was a bit small, but not so small it was an issue.
Very comfortable room, all in all.
Service was always good and everyone was helpfull. We had to extend our stay by one night because our flight was cancelled, and the staff sorted us out in no time.
The vibe of this hotel is hip, and what I guess is, very NYC-cool. The lobby area always buzzing with locals. 
This place is great for anyone who's really hoping to find that NYC-vibe, even though it is a bit pricy. It's worth it.

title: Home away from home
text: Most recent stay at the Ace NYC was for work. I love staying here when I’m in town. The front desk staff are friendly and efficient. Location is great. Food and drinks are always superb (breakfast from the Breslin is my favorite - try the three cheese sandwich with ham and egg!). I’ve stayed in all different style rooms here and each one has its own charm.  I love having the minibar options, and room service is quick and beautifully presented. I feel right  at home when I’m here. I also enjoy the hotel lobby vibe and the unique artwork in the gallery. The Ace is less a hotel and more something to be experienced. I can’t wait to be back again!

title: Overall experience
text:
I have stayed at a lot of business oriented hotels in NYC, and The Ace is definitely a do over. I had several associates who stayed there as well and we were able to share notes on our various rooms. It has an interesting early industrial feel. Comfortable beds, glorious shower! The toilet could easily handle an executive class growler without a hint of clogging.   Plenty of space and creative storage!, I liked the fridge, radio, and desk area. Lighting is low key, which is tasteful. Each room seems to have unique wall decoration scheme, mine was quite odd, (quite amusing! think hamburger bob meets clockwork orange).but art is what it is, and that is always a positive. 
Service was top drawer, from the desk staff to housekeeping and room service. Great hamburger too! The lounge/lobby is jumping with activity. Nice area to hang out.
Lots of eating establishments in walking distance. Great stay!

title: Un 4* davvero scarso
text:
Camera buia, luce da parete solo all'ingresso + due lampade da tavolo sui comodini, finestra oscurata - risultato: camera illuminata per metà, l'altra metà buia. Rumore fastidioso del frigo durante tutta la notte, lenzuola della prima notte rotte, non c'è l'armadio (ma una rella con grucce), il rubinetto del lavandino perdeva acqua. Attenzione scarsa per i clienti, non è fornito nemmeno il dentifricio (mai visto in un 4*). In breve: per essere un 4* è davvero scarso, la cosa positiva e vincente è sicuramente la posizione.
Non ci ritornerei, non lo consiglierei.

title: Mixed feelings
text:
The location and onsite Seafood and oyster bar, coffee shop and gastro pub (where breakfast is available) are excellent.

Staff at check-in and check-out were efficient and helpful. The lobby is a bar, making the place more lively than many other hotels. So as expected.

We had a medium room and paid USD 400-600 per night. What you get for it is nowhere ok on the planet, but possibly in New York. Size and design as expected, but minimum size blinded window facing a very dark inner yard. Feels like a garage. The hipster style minibar is nice, but prices are ridiculous ... so completely useless (USD 10 for a small bottle of water). Also the entire concept is a bit questionable: if individualism feels like copied for 100 similar rooms, what’s the point. On top of that, with Jet lag we had to listen to the activities of the neighboring room (I mean professional activity). Really poor all together. 

Well, I highly recommend the breakfast in the pub, food is from heaven, for coffee and seafood go next door, also excellent, and for a room go somewhere else.

title: Perfect location and lovely room
text: The location was perfect and easy to get out to all the key tourist spots. We did have a some noisy neighbours which it took the management a while to address but other than that we found it a great hotel. Nice food, clean, the reception for funny and happy to greet us.

title: great hotel, location, etc.
text: Convenient location to get most anywhere in Manhattan. The neighborhood has changed light years from what it used to be- tons of great shopping and food nearby, The ACE has a great vibe, good people, excellent service, restaurant, bar, etc. Perfect home base for a visit to the city.

title: a great part of visiting NYC
text:
We travel to NYC once in a while for business and we always make sure we spend extra day/days to have personal time in NYC. New York is always full of wonders and we always go to discover more, and one of the discoveries was Ace hotel which I would like to stay every time we stay in NYC. The rooms are very interestingly furnished in a contemporary modern style that is not like ordinary hotel room. The room spaces are not too large and that makes it very fun. 
If you are the kind of traveler who comes to NYC to go to MOMA then I'm sure you will love the design of this hotel.

title: Coolest hotel experience ever
text: I stayed at Ace around 10 days. The room was AMAZING: first of all it was big (very unusual for NYC standards), super cozy with its cool and elegant decoration. The fridge is full of treats and there was an electrical water heater, it was so nice to go back to the hotel to chill and have some tea in the room. Plus: we had a view directly to the Empire State Building! Location is perfect. We had 4 days of spring in February (thanks to global warming) so we really profit from the walking distance to almost everywhere, and 6 days of rain and cold weather... those days we could take the metro around the corner. The hotel has a delicious coffee place downstairs and a very cool atmosphere at the lobby. But the best part from the whole journey was the hotel team... so lovely everyone...   They made us feel at home. It is a stylish place full of personality and tenderness, i can only recommend.

title: Great hotel - Minimal room space is immaculately designed
text: I love the aesthetic - enjoyed staying here, and I also recommend the bar! I stayed here my last days in New York and had a small send off party in the bar downstairs. Everything in New York is smaller than other cities... so many people crammed together. So I was very impressed with the layout and design of the room. I did not feel at all cramped or crowded, and had every amenity I could expect in a larger suite. Staff were professional and helpful, the bartenders and servers are fun. Exquisite cocktail menue also. I left my luggage here to visit friends then the hotel arranged my shuttle to the airport. Excellent hotel experience, and I look forward to staying at other Ace hotel locations.

title: Love staying at Ace Hotel
text: I love the urban atmosphere and the low key feel of the Ace Hotel. The guests are extremely diverse in terms of age and nationality.  We travel with our two well trained dogs and are thrilled that we can have drinks in the lobby with them at our feet.

title: Dormitory
text: The 100 year old building has an inadequate hvac system.  Two terrible nights of sleep were had because of an overly warm and dry room.  Hotel guests do not have a place to sit in the lobby as the hotel encourages people to come in off the street to sit for hours using tech devices and drinking coffee.  As a hotel guest I did not feel that I received good enough care.  The rooms are filled with knick knacks collected from flea markets and such.  It has a trendiness to it.  However, stained fabric on chairs, chipped porcelain on tubs, mold on bathroom tiles and a  small room with one tiny window lead me to conclude that I will neither stay here again nor recommend it favorably to anyone else.

title: AceAmazingAgain
text: My wife and I had the best weekend staying at this cool midtown hotel and hangout. It has great food (dinner at Breslin) and amazing coffee from Stumptown in the morning......my favorite! The room was very clean and we both had some nice interaction with a super friendly staff from bellman when we arrived, right through check in and just passing staff throughout the day we had lots of smiles and warm greetings.  Location is good too as subway is right around the corner for us to explore NYC. Definitely recommend a stay here! It was our second visit and thought they deserved the positive feedback this time!

title: Amazing Space & Staff!
text: I've stayed at the Ace twice now and both times have been excellent. Everyone is super helpful and friendly. The rooms are amazing!! The spaces feel inviting but contemporary. I would highly suggest staying here if you have the chance!

title: Absolutely wonderful hotel
text: I've stayed in Ace many times now and every time the stay is wonderful. The rooms (medium and up) are spacious, the lobby is buzzing, and especially: the service is absolutely terrific. Staff is very friendly and helpful, and spare no expenses to make you feel at home. Would highly recommend staying here if you want to experience hip and fun NYC.

title: Aces High
text: The Ace Hotel was the perfect location just of Broadway. I packed in a lot on this trip and the location was a major key factor when booking. It also helped that the Ace Hotel offered apartment style living with just the right mix of boutique design and eclecticism. A great hotel in a great location in a great city. Need I say more?!

title: 用途によるでしょう
text:
オシャレ好きな方には有名すぎるホテル。それを目的とする人には間違いなく満足でしょう。
逆にちょっとオシャレなところを見たいだけという人にはあまりオススメしません。ホテルとしての機能はそこまでよくありません。
一階はクラブのようなバーがあり、夜な夜なオシャレさんたちが集っており、それが好きでないとちょっとうるさくて辛いかも。部屋は壁のファブリックやデザインなど凝ってますが、窓が防音されておらず、外の音が丸聞こえ。特に場所柄車の往来は多く、大通りに面した部屋はクラクションの音が絶えずします。二階のフロアの部屋はドアを閉めてもかすかに一階のロビーの喧騒が聞こえますが、これは耳栓をしてら聞こえないレベル。ツインルームでもお風呂場も狭くシャワーヘッドは取り外せないタイプのため使い勝手はよくありません。アメニティーも必要最低限。
そもそも部屋の静かさや落ち着きを求める人はえらばないと思いますが、オシャレさやエースホテルに泊まった実感を感じたい人にはオススメです。そうでない方は一階のバーに行くだけで十分雰囲気は味わえると思います。

title: A great night!
text:
We just had a night on the town in NYC from the suburbs, but it was a unique hotel experience.  The Ace is a hang-out for lots of young folks; the lobby is full of people on their laptops working, a popular bar next to it, and one of the best coffee places in the city is connected to it.  I've met people here for coffee or drinks even without spending the night.  For a hotel patron it means there's a lot going on just on site.

The decor of the halls and the rooms is also very hip, industrial, artistic, upscale punk.  Lots of fun.  In one corner of our room were painted the words Because I Love You in artsy graffiti style with dripping dried paint.  Amenities were inside industrial or retro type containers.  There's interesting stuff along with the mini bar, like turntables to play.  These optional amenities are fun but quite expensive, but hey it's a Manhattan hotel.

The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, with quick answers and help with anything. I even got an email praising my comment card and engaging me in a nice chat.  The place is run with the same social openness as is evident in the atmosphere of the lobby/bar etc.

The Ace is part of an interesting change to the neighborhood.  Penn Station/Madison Sq Garden is not far away, and Little Korea is a few blocks north.  South is Madison Sq Park and the Flatiron district.  This strip of Broadway between all of them has many new restaurants and hotels.  Retail is still mainly from the Middle Eastern/African marketplace, lots of incense and perfume and discount clothes places.  But Rizzoli Bookstore, a beautiful new store replacing the old one in Soho is a harbinger of new businesses there.  John Dory is a great raw bar seafood place.  We went to Pergola for great Mediterranean, nit realizing until we sat down that it doubled as a hookah bar!

So Ace and its neighbors may be too hip for its own good, may seem to only cater to millennials, but as an older Jersey commuter I can say we had a great time, were well taken care of, and could walk up to a Broadway show or jump back on a train at Penn Station for convenience.  I'd recommend the Ace for any local, as well as the many different nationalities who were enjoying there stay there.

title: Updated: New York Trip Experience Somewhat Saved
text:
Updated: A quick e-mail and phone response from the management team at the Ace has enhanced my rating of the hotel and that has been reflected in this review.

Their team was very kind in their response and it seemed like they genuinely wanted to improve and rectify the bad experience.  Hoping the next time I stay that I can give a better review of my experience.

Here's my original review:

When our marketing team told us that we would be staying at the Ace for the annual NRF Big Show, I was really excited. I’ve heard many great things about these properties throughout the world and I was excited for the opportunity to stay there. 

Our company was also hosting multiple events (happy hours and catered lunches) throughout the hotel and bringing a team of 5+ people that would be staying at the hotel. 

Upon arriving early on a Sunday afternoon we were able to leave our bags, but weren’t able to check in early. Their team was super helpful and got all of our bags together for when we returned from a day around the city. 

Check in was really easy and they moved our team through quickly. 

Upon getting to my room I was blown away by the size of the room (Medium Room) and what came with it. Large bed, large table, large couch, full size fridge, guitar, turntable. I was really excited. 

Then the disappointment started. Once I got settled, I noticed a terrible old smoke smell. Like when your parent quits smoking, but the house still wreaks of old cigarettes. I assumed this came from being on the 2nd floor right above the entrance, but others in our group had similar smells. Not a huge deal. I can get over the smell. I travel a lot for work and know not every room can be perfect. 

Surprised by the amenity, I went to play a Father John Misty album on the turntable only to find that the needle was missing. When I went to ask the front desk about it, they said it happens a lot and they just replace the needle. When I asked them to do that, they said they had no needles. Okay, again I can get over it. I normally don’t have a turntable in my rooms. 

Through all of this, and with our events, the staff had been very nice and seemingly accommodating. The environment was very cool throughout the days and nights and really fun to be around, so I could deal with a few disappointments. 

The disappointments continued to come up, though. The breakfast in the higher priced restaurant (we expected this, that wasn’t the issue) was not as advertised. A simple green juice came out flat and unmixed, the oatmeal on the menu wasn’t available (oats and water!), and the refill on my coffee never came after the first pot didn’t have enough coffee for a quarter pour. Again, very nice staff, but couldn’t provide the service requested. 

The last and biggest disappointment was a standard amenity that any hotel should be able to fulfill. The shower was freezing and semi clogged to boot. Every day. No matter the time. Once, I can get. In the morning when lots of people are trying to get hot water, okay. At 4 PM after a long cold day of tours around the city? Not acceptable.

Multiple people from our group had similar issues. Not everyone, so I knew it wasn’t just a whole hotel issue. When it was brought up to the staff, again it was in a very polite manner, they said it was pretty cold outside and there wasn’t anything they could do. That’s weird, because I’ve stayed in other hotels in cold climates and had plenty of hot water. 

4 days of cold showers. The other things would be fine, but when added on top of this, I can’t recommend this hotel and won’t stay here again. That’s a standard amenity that you should be able to find at any property in the city. 

Again, this hotel is cool. We get it. We were treated as if we were privileged to stay there (for $350+ a night) at times and our complaints were treated that way. 

Come here for a drink or a coffee for sure, but no need to stay here. Sorry Ace. I really wanted to like you.

title: Cool Layback
text:
You can get confused when you come to the lobby, because you will see all kinds of people seating and using their laptops, drinking coffee and lounging while working. 
It changes into a pseudo bar atmosphere at night.
The Hotel is very modern with and edge and a well curated grunge, great music always and absolutely great energy.
the location is also perfect. All sizes of rooms to choose from.

title: Problem Solved
text: During a less than perfect experience in room 806, Jason, the manager on duty, immediately moved me up to room 1112 for the rest of my visit. Problem solved. I then got a complimentary bottle of wine one day and tulips the next. Service was wonderful!

title: Awesome Ace
text: Was at the Ace this past week for work and so happy I got to see it. Hip, clean, and great restaurant. Love the coffee, staff super friendly and I already said this but I will emphasize: clean! Room was big too, which is a huge shock for anything in NYC. I was so surprised and really happy to be there. By far now one of my favorite hotels in the city. Stay there if you get the chance.

title: Amazing Stay- Will Be Back
text: I visited the Ace Hotel in NY for my first time with my GF and loved it. Like the title says- we will be back every time we visit the city, which is often. We both make our way here for work, leisure and to see family and have been waiting to find a spot like this that has everything. We’ve enjoyed time at Ace in Cali but didn’t expect to love this one like we did. Awesome, chill environment, laid back/hip but not that overdone boutique wannabe feel- and very clean. The staff was great and when we called down for a recommendation they were more than accommodating. We ate at the Breslin the last night and had a delicious meal- highly recommend the Dry Aged Prime Rib. Was ridiculous. I keep even thinking about it and now want to find a restaurant near my home that serves something similar (haha). GF had Scotch Egg- CRAZY GOOD!

title: Gem of a hotel
text: My husband & I had a lovely stay at the Ace Hotel. We were in town for a show at the Garden, which is just a few blocks away. The rooms are eclectic, comfy & clean, and the shower amazing! We enjoyed dinner at the hotel restaurant and loved having Stump Town coffee right there in the morning! We had a couple hours to kill in the morning before meeting friends for brunch, so we hung out in the cool lobby, drank coffee & read...perfect way to start the day! The staff was extremely friendly...just a really cool vibe. This will be our new go to hotel!

title: Simply the coolest
text: I felt at home in the cool yet unpretentious atmosphere of Ace Hotel. Queer friendly (very important) with an invitingly dark and low-key interior complimented by well curated amenities. I was particularly fond of the mini bar selection and the convenience of an Opening Ceremony located directly off the lobby. But the true beacon of my Ace experience would have to be the front desk staff. Attentive manager Jennie Wright really set the tone for our stay, making the upgrade to a larger room painless, ensuring our comfort every step of the way, even when I realized I forgot to pack a tooth brush. In a big city it's nice to come back to a place where the staff seem to genuinely care. This wont be my last time at Ace x

title: Cool Boutique Hotel ! Centrally Located
text: Yes, it's cool. Centrally located. Small but comfortable food and very nice service is a winning combination in Mid-Town Manhattan. A few blocks from the World Famous Macy's Dept. Store, a few more blocks to Times Square and the Theater District. Close, Penn Station and to 5 major Subway lines : The 6 Train B Train, F, and D makes public transport a breeze.

title: Brilliant hotel for a brilliant trip
text:
We stayed at the Ace having seen it recommended in an article in The Times and weren’t disappointed. 
We originally booked a small room but managed to take advantage of an offer and get a medium room instead which I think was a bonus. 
The lobby is beautiful and always busting but a lovely place to have a coffee and breakfast before heading out in the mornings.
The room itself was quirky and spacious, the sofa gave us some extra space for lounging although we weren’t in the room that often. The icing on the cake for us was a fabulous view of the Empire State.
The location of the hotel was perfect for us too, easy enough to walk up to Empire State and onto Times Square etc and close to a subway station making it easy to get further afield. 
We will definitely be staying here the next time we’re in NYC

title: A true NYC experience
text:
I have stayed at the Ace on a few occasions, and each time I came away feeling inspired. I love that the hotel embraces the history of the building and keeps the "drabby chicque" quality. The service is excellent, and though the rooms are small they do not feel cramped at all. The best feature is that it is just far enough away from Times Square that you can still easily get to the Broadway theaters but not have to deal with the crowds and noise when it's time to hang out or sleep.

The John Dory Oyster Bar and Stumptown Coffee are amazing.

Love the Ace!

title: If you want the best of NYC you want the ACE hotel
text: Great weekend stay at the wonderful ACE hotel before Christmas. Very clean, wonderful friendly staff. Big room with lovely bathroom. The lobby is large and very lively with an awesome bar. The location is fantastic, close to everything either on foot or short subway ride. The staff is more than willing to help with anything you might need. Also a great coffee shop downstairs to help you get your day started. Will make it a point to stay here again.

title: Lovely modern hotel
text:
I stayed for 2 nights in a medium room. The hotel is not suitable for all, but is great for me, active and diy traveler.

Location:
Quite nice. Subway station(N/Q/R/M) is a min away. Penn station, another subway station(4/6), Empire State Building are in walking distance too. Roughly 1h to Newark airport, 1.5h to JFK airport by train. There are glocery store/deli/bar around the hotel though. Less people on the street in night time, I felt safe though.

Reception:
Quick, hlepful and super friendly. Ask them whatever you need, they will help. But only a few person on duty, it might take a time when you need to talk at peak time.

Room:
Medium room is large enough for one. Lovely huge bed and radio. Well furnished but not new. View is limited from the 1009. Free wifi is fast. 7 packs of purified water in the fridge for free(!) No noise from outside and downstair, but I unluckily heard a guest yelling my opposite room.

Bathroom:
Small shower booth, a coil a round annoying shower curtain. I think it must be replaced to glass or plastic or whatever better. No tub, no toothbrash in the room 1009, prepare at yourself.

Other:
I guess the key what guest like/dislike the hotel is the lobby. Many hotel guests and neighbours staying there and having their own time. It is not like traditional hotel, more like living room of your home. Observatory deck on 86th floor of Empire State Building, just 7min walk away, is open for 8am-2am. Good for early birds and night owls.

title: Fun weekend stay
text: Thank you for the great weekend! I stayed from 12/22 - 12/24, the city was packed for Christmas festivities, although rainy and grey - it was a great weekend. Check in was quick and easy, kind friendly staff. Lobby staff were also kind and attentive. The bellman who helped store my luggage and arrange a cab to the airport was very warm and engaging. Thank you for the great weekend. Looking forward to coming back this Spring!

title: Cozy and Cool
text: One of my favorite hotel brands and NYC does not yet me down. Cozy rooms many with great city views of the Empire State Building (the best night light). Room is nicely appointed and the bar and restaurants are great. Stumptown is a rare coffee treat on the East Coast, don’t forget to start your day with a cold brew!!

title: もう1度行きたい
text:
誰に聞いてもかっこいいホテルだと言われ、期待して行ったら期待以上にすごかったです。
今まで行ったかっこいいと思っていたホテルが大体エースホテルを参考にして作られている事が身に染みるほど感じた笑

チェックインしたのが1時過ぎていたのかな、それでも入ってすぐのロビーは人がたくさんいてみんな良い夜を過ごしていました。
ホテル利用以外の人も利用できる事もあって1日中空いてる事はなかったです。

内装や家具、雰囲気全てが良かったです。あと働いてるスタッフがお店で販売してるTシャツやパーカーを着ていたのですがわざとらしさはなくかっこよかったです！

title: Very nice hotel
text: We loved our stay at Ace hotel! Make sure to grab a latte at the coffee downstair, very good! I recommend booking through their website and not on a website like booking or priceline, you will save money this way. We booked with booking and we found out later that it was cheaper on their website but they couldn't get the price lower for us since we booked on Booking. Anyhow, great hotel, I recommend you stay there :)

title: Cool, fun, cozy
text:
