I love this place. Can't beat the coolness factor--art, authors, music permeate the place. The black, white and gray color palette is alive with all the City's grittiness. The lobby is alive with the energy that makes New York the best city in the world.

Meanwhile, I always feel cozy in my little retreat of a room. They always leave (independent) music -- in addition to a light! -- for me.

And great service. Ready to fix, advise, arrange as needed. Can't be beat.

title: Great Hotel at accomodating price in NY
text: Have spent a couple of visits at Ace Hotel. Quite simple rooms and amenities - but just what You need. Great lobby to sit and work/see people - and the coffee shop attached to the lobby is mad good! Take a capoucino and a croissant in the morning.

title: Fun, hip hotel.
text:
Hipster style hotel with loud music in the lobby, and a lively bar/nightclub type scene.
The details of the hotel are creative, with cute sayings and memes found all over.
The location is very central to some great late night KBBQ and other things in the area.
I wouldn't recommend this hotel for families with kids, or anyone looking for a quiet hotel.
But for singles and young-at-heart couples, it's a great choice.

title: very nice hotel, different experience
text: very clean rooms, towels so soft, we've got a very warm welcome, in the room we found on behalf of the hotel some very yummy amenities. the restaurant is very good and the lobby very interesting atmosphere, very nice people we found staying at Ace

title: an experience to remember
text: very nice rooms, welcome stuff at the reception, the restaurant is excellent, the rooms are different and with a very nice design,  the hotel is very near the biggest stores in Manhattan and Times Square,

title: Great place!!!!
text:
I’m impressed once again. The room was super clean and so stylish. The staff is always so nice and professional. 
The price was very reasonable as well. I always stay here when I’m in NYC. Love it!!!!
I always recommend this hotel to all my colleagues and friends. The staff make you feel so special.

title: Fun Christmas Trip
text: We chose this hotel for its Flatiron location and overall hipness factor. I'm glad we chose the Medium room for two people, and the bed was really comfortable. Our room had a record player, but the needle was broken. An engineer tried to fix it, but told us there was a needle shortage. The bathroom wasn't heated (brrr!) and the fabric shower curtains didn't do a great job of keeping water off the floor. We really liked having breakfast at Cafe Breslin and shopping at the Opening Ceremony outpost off the lobby. Noise wasn't a problem.

title: 2nd visit even better than the first!
text: Just wanted to say thank you again for the wonderful services.  You guys are like family.  Cleanliness we all deserve, food we love, and service full of love.  Can't wait to come back.  You guys are still my #1!

title: They impressed me again
text: Again, had another pleasant stay at this hotel.  Room was very clean. The service was outstanding. I love  sitting at the lobby and enjoying their delicious coffee.  I absolutely enjoy the great vibe.  I always feel at home when I stay here.  Looking forward to my next stay.

title: Best place to stay in NY
text: Excellent room services, very kind hotel stuff, reception guys are very nice, hotel gym is more than what you need for a morning sprint. I really recommend this hotel for business travelling but also private. The restaurant also is worth to try it definitely!

title: Ace Hotel
text:
Currently staying at the Ace hotel and had the pleasure of enjoying Christmas in the city.

Ace hotel is perfectly situated. A short walk to Times Square and easy access to the metro service (which I'd strongly recommend).

The hotels lobby and dining area are perfect- they have truly nailed their style!

I do believe however we have possibly been placed in the smallest room in Manhattan. Trust me it's tiny! Nowhere to leave our luggage other than in the suitcases by the door- not a single piece of storage in sight. Unfortunately we encountered a technical issue that couldn't be resolved 

Its truly freezing at this time of year in NYC and our little window let's in such a breeze. 

We have a beautifully stocked minibar so you would never go hungry or thirsty (maybe just broke at $11 a beer!) 

However the good most definitely out ways the constructive points I mention and this hasn't put us off and I would 100% recommend this wonderful hotel to a friend.

title: Birthday trip
text: We stayed for 3 nights for my girlfriend’s birthday. We have stayed in various Ace Hotels and this is by far my favourite. The staff could not have been more accommodating and made a special effort for my partners birthday. I would highly recommend staying here. The room was amazing and the lobby area is a great place to relax after adventuring around the city. Having stumptown in the hotel is a major bonus too! Dreamy!

title: Hipt hotell
text: Hotellet har bra beliggenhet sentralt i NY. Veldig hipp og levende lobby bar. Kult og røffe rom. Noe kalt på badet. God service. Har kaffe bar rett ved inngangen og en levende frokost brasseri. Masse folk til frokost og Lunch her.

title: Always a pleasure
text:
This was my second trip to the Ace.  I've been to a number of hotels in NYC and yet I still find the Ace to be my favorite.  Yes, the rooms are small.  It may not be the place for an extended stay if you need to do a lot of work in your room.  However, for a great location with a unique atmosphere and great food and social scene in the lobby, I can't recommend it more. 

On my last trip I encountered a technical issue with my room.  The front desk immediately sent a technician up to resolve the matter.  Even though the issue could not be fixed the front desk manager immediately broke out his amazing customer service skills and resolve the problem immediately.  I really do need to get his name.  He made me feel like a king in a few short minutes. 

I'll be back again.

title: Not for me
text:
This hotel experience was SO confusing.

I go to NYC all the time for business, and I've worked out of the Ace's amazing lobby more times than I can count. I'm also a fan of the Breslin restaurant. The whole vibe of this place is eclectic/trendy/cool, if a bit overly hipster. I finally decided to stay at the hotel on my last 2-night visit, and it was like ... wait ... what? 

So here's how it goes:

1. You arrive and everyone is helpful and friendly and cool. Got upgraded to a king room, which I think is the second best room they offer. So far so good!
2. You walk through the hotel halls, noting the funny signs on the walls and elevators, and you're amused, and you're like, this is pretty clever, I'm into this place!
3. You open the door to your room and the first thing you feel is happiness because the room is so damn big (again, this is the king room), and you also see a full-size Smeg fridge and that's so cute and unexpected, and there's this really cute little drawing on one of the walls that looks like a ladder going into a hole, and you're pretty delighted.
4. You turn on ALL of the lights and the room is still dark AF ... you actually spend a few minutes wandering around wondering if you missed a light because there is no way it's actually that dark.
5. You kind of take it all in, and despite the fact that the Smeg is PACKED with every beverage imaginable, and there are Ramen noodles and beef jerky and other unexpected stuff in the minibar, you're realizing it actually looks like you somehow wound up in the shabby-bordering-on-kind-a-dump hotel of a broke college student.
6. It's SO dumpy (in "a purposefully stark but still this is dumpy" way) that you consider calling the front desk and making sure you didn't somehow wind up in an oversized janitor's closet.
7. You sleep really well despite the constant noise outside, so that's good. The bed is actually really comfy and the darkness is finally working in your favor ...
8. ... but then you wake up and get really confused because why are you in a college kid's dumpy apartment?!?!
9. You go to shower and even though the bathroom is kind of cute (though small), there's a shower curtain (which, GROSS) and the water pressure is nearly nonexistent.
10. You have trouble doing your makeup because, even in the full light of day, the ROOM IS DARK AS A POLAR BEAR DEN which I imagine is SUPER SUPER DARK.
10. You sleep really well again that night because COMFY BED & DARKNESS.
11. You check out and the staff is friendly and you're like huh maybe that wasn't so bad but then you're like yeah but I'm never staying here again.
12. Resolve to continue frequenting lobby & restaurant while leaving rooms for hipsters that appreciate this sort of thing.

title: All Hype, Disappointing Room
text: From the TripAdvisor reviews and hype, one would expect this to be the best thing next to nirvana.  First the positives, location tops and having a busy bar scene, albeit the folks crowding the lobby and setting up their work/study prevented us as hotel guests from just hanging out.  The spots are first come first served, and these folks aren't hotel guests.  The room, supposedly an upgrade in 909, was the smallest room for a NYC hotel I have ever endured.  The bathroom is quite cozy with obstacles involved.  While the old fashion turntable and vinyl records are a nice touch, they are totally impractical.  But perhaps that's the hype and charm.  Use the money to improve the feel of the room which is cold and cramped.  Despite having a three day reservation, we checked out after the first night with only a modest penalty.

title: Super trendy hotel
text: It was a wow experience, very nice people at the reception, the rooms are very clean, super location, the restaurant is very good!  Not the first time staying at the Ace and definitely it is my no.1 on my hotel list. Ace addicted!

title: とてもカッコイイ空間
text: 深夜に到着しましたがフロントのお兄さんの対応がとても良くてすごく安心しました。オレンジ色のヒゲもとてもカッコよかった。3人で一部屋に泊まりましたが、ダブルベッドが２つあって広々していてとても快適でした。フロント、ロビー、お部屋、全てのインテリアやデザインがとてもかっこ良かった。夜中3時ごろまでロビーの音楽は大音量で、金曜の夜ということもあってか、外からもお酒を飲みに来てる人で賑わってました。お部屋までその音が聞こえてくるという事もなかったので、時差ボケ解消に良く眠ることができました。

title: 3度目の訪問。やはり最高。
text:
エースホテルは、デザインホテルだと思われているが、実はスタッフ教育が半端なく行き届いていて、いつも本当にリラックスできるし、良い気分でチェックアウトできる。
1階ロビーの活気は相変わらず最高。爆音で音楽が四六時中鳴っているので、そういうのが嫌いな人は避けたほうが良いでしょう。

title: Awesome hotel with the best security team ever!!
text:
I usually don't write reviews but this is an exception!! I absolutely love going to the Ace hotel as its home away from home. I feel very safe, the staff is super friendly and just overall a great atmosphere! 
A couple of months ago, I had a little bit of a situation where I was bothered by a male patron and it was greatly assisted by their awesome security team that was both amazing and very professional. I appreciated it so much!! 
There are so many hotels out there but nothing compares to the Ace and kudos to the best security team ever!! Damian and his team were great! This hotel and its security team has exceeded my expectations in every aspect. I highly recommend anyone coming to New York City to stay at the Ace hotel!!

title: 빈티지 느낌 좋아요
text:
로비에 들어서자 마자 뉴욕 느낌 물씬 풍깁니다. 장소 자체만으로 행복을 주는곳 
일층의 커피집도 너무 맛있구요 위치도 좋아서 이동하기 편해요

title: ACES!!!!!
text: This property is terrific! The staff is very friendly, The atmosphere, amenities, room appointments, excellent! The bar and restaurant are in a very clubby, fun, setting, and, the location is perfect for both Mid- town and downtown, activities! It's all here!

title: Ace by name and by nature
text: Second visit here.  It’s in a good location to base a visit to Manhattan.  The hotel has some good facilities, the room we had was a good size and the bed very comfortable.  The bar and restaurant within the hotel are excellent.

title: Excellent place to stay
text:
Very very nice hotel. Really nice personnel.
I enjoyed staying there.
Every time I visit New York I'm staying at this beautiful hotel.
This hotel have a very good BAR - I enjoyed staying and drinking a glass of wine.

title: Poorly appointed filthy and dark rooms
text:
We stayed at the Ace while visiting family in the city. We're quite familiar with the Breslin so thought it was a no brainer to try out the hotel. 

Our room was disgusting. No windows at all besides one very small one in a corner that you couldn't even stand in front of to look out. Extremely dark and gloomy room. The carpets had not been vacuumed in quite some time, and the shower didn't work. It's unnecessary to have weird amenities like a full sized Smeg fridge and acoustic guitar in the room if it's dirty and dark.

The hallways are pretty banged up too and the elevators take an insanely long time. 

I would have checked out and booked a new hotel immediately had I not been so exhausted and gave up. Do not stay here.

title: Feel New York
text:
Great place with the best atmosphere, great room that make you feel like living in NY. Best bar in town and kindest people at reception, always feel welcome
Hotel is situated in great area with loads of restaurants and bars to explore.

title: I’ve found my inner hipster here!
text:
LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this hotel. From the incredibly funky room decked out with a huge and comfortable bed, to the minimalist bathroom and hanging rod to the cute Smeg bar fridge beside one of those large luggage boxes of an era bygone - all to make one feel like you’re living in NYC-style living.  

But outside the comforts of your room, the staff are friendly, the bar is cool and the cocktails delicious, and most importantly, a fabulous little coffee joint just off the lobby where you can get a very decent coffee to go (none of that American percolated stuff), to fuel your morning as you head out to explore the wonderful city that is New York!

Enjoy your stay!

title: Overrated even for the hipster crowds...it’s average at best.
text:
Hipster hotel.   Easy location.  Smallish rooms with hipster vibe. 
Cool lobby with easy and professional check-in. Lobby is always always busy.  

Hotel misses on details: 
1. traffic/subway noise I get, but people talking/ smoking outside is wrong.   Easy enough to double pane windows on the first 4 or 5 floors.   I was in 207 and people noise stayed way too loud till way too late.
2. Dishes left in hallway all afternoon, night and till the next morning.
3. Heater in room needed a maintenance man.  I called to front desk and after 25 minutes went down to front desk in person.   He arrived 5 minutes later and made the repairs.  I shouldn’t have to make two requests.
4. Tub grout is cracked,moldy
5. No lotion in bath
6. No coffee pot in room (shop downstairs is way good)
(Be sure to request queen-king bed in notes when you make reservations- otherwise ya get a full bed.). Two very good restaurants attached.  I stayed here for dead and co. shows (nov 12&14) at the nearby MSG.

I’ve stayed at the ACE hotel in the DTLA location...And have seen concerts/shows at the arched music venue there.

Overrated, kinda pretentious.  Average at best.

title: David Lynch would dig the elevator.
text: I don't know if this is a compelling comment to either stay at or avoid the Ace, but descending from my impressively quiet, third floor room in the elevator and being confronted by the lobby's WALL OF SOUND was such a beguiling experience I repeated it more than necessary by my comings and goings. This is to say, the elevator comprises an anechoic chamber travelling along a vertical tube that either rushes one from or to an eye- and ear-catching assemblage of humanity. Plus, there's ample seating in the lobby for drinking a beer (served on tap deeper into the space) or a coffee (proffered by the embedded Stumptown, which draws its own crowd).

title: Reduced amenities, shrinking room, growing prices
text: Have been staying off and on here for a number of years. This weekend, I was forced to take a 'bunk' room (no big deal) but they've eliminated the 'computer' rooms on a few floors, which means you have to compete with the tech bros hogging up the lobby for a place to work. The rates, of course, are the same.

title: Excellent service
text: We stayed 4 nights at the Ace. Great atmosphere with good music in the lobby. They miss a Spotify playlist so you can take yourself back to the Ace. Quality of the showers can be better... but the service is excellent.

title: Slept Well in My Plaid Den
text:
I'm a discerning traveler with near bi-monthly visits to new York and have stayed in every range of hotel.

Swanky Den: That's how I describe entering this hotel and the lobby, filled with local hipsters who set up laptop shop and camp for hours on end by the dimly lit bulbs. I've never seen this place un-busy: just always buzzin' like a little cool beehive, even when the lights are low and the DJ starts spinning.

Menswear Touches: the rooms follow a general theme of gray and signature navy plaid blankets with wrought-iron hardware and black-and-white. I mean, this is the fashion district.I dig the little soap on a rope.

ZZZ's: I don't sleep much but when I do I need to crash so I can work early, and I highly covet a quiet room and a comfy bed. It might be the combination of the previous two bullet points that make me sleep so well here, like climbing into a little cave and hibernating, but man do I sleep like aces.

Eats & Drinks: The Breslin Bar restaurant is excellent and hearty food, and a great boisterous place for people watching (make sure you get a reso). Similarly Stumptown Coffee will not disappoint and I've been meaning to get a stoneware coffee mug for several visits now!

Twinning: be careful that the first room booking option for the ACE HOTEL often involves a room with bunk beds. This has happened to two of my friends who booked a room here and didn't realize they'd booked bunks! It always pays to read, but some people really also like bunk beds. Just saying.

Wifi Woes: My first stay, I actually had a total WIFI meltdown and couldn't connect at all in my room despite best efforts by the front concierge and their tech team via phone...for like 1.5 hours; I needed to file a story. It was honestly horrible. I ended up setting a mini office in the lobby. While people around me dated and flirted and drank yummy cocktails, I balanced file folders on my knees. I was told that next time, they'd give me an upgrade. They honored that upon my following visit (see spacious suite picture). My room was so huge, I just didn't even know what to do with myself, but their efforts to right a wrong--and remember--was duly noted and appreciated.

title: Fabulous Hotel in a perfect location
text:
We stayed here in September for 4 nights and it was fantastic! We had a slight issue with the a/c unit in the room as it caused the room to stink. We alerted the house keeping team but there wasn't much they could do. Despite that, the room we had was huge for two of us sharing. The room also had a fabulous view of The Empire State Building...bonus!
The lobby area is fun a buzzy and the coffee shop by reception does THE best coffee...I should have bought some to bring back to the UK. I'd defo stay here again

title: Good value and amenities in convenient location
text: The Ace Hotel New York is a well-priced base to operate from for a get-away weekend. The staff and service were very accommodating and friendly. The oyster bar and coffee shop are excellent spots to fuel up, and the lounge is a welcoming retreat from the busy, urban traffic all around. The rooms are small, but well-appointed. The complimentary guitar was a really nice Martin. Definitely recommend for a couple's vacation.

title: Trendy Hotel, Good Location, Subpar Service
text: I would of left really love this hotel if service had been better. The lobby has interesting instagram-friendly decoration and is always darkly lit. It is an ideal place to watch creative-looking people work by day and sip cocktails by night. Overall, it's a fun place to be and inside the New York-sized rooms you will get cool details like custom art, incredibly comfortable robes and interesting books. The coffee shop downstairs is really good too. We got there before check-in time and needed to iron a shirt with a lot of urgency due to a important meeting, yet the staff could not find a way to help us. I understand that we got there earlier than expected, but a little effort from the staff could of been expected, or at least some sympathy. Too cool to care for creaseless shirts.

title: What a lovely NewYork style hotel.
text:
We stayed at the hotel during the weekend. 
The atmosphere in the hotel lobby and in the room was great, very New York style. 
The location is just perfect, at the real heart of NYC, we took an early morning walk to the ‘high line’ it was perfect. 
The coffee shop at the entrance of the hotel has a great coffee.

title: Night in the city on a layover
text: We loved this hotel! We booked one night on a scheduled layover and were so happy that we did. The hotel is conveniently located to Times Square and Broadway which was exactly where we wanted to be. Also, my husband and I both work in hotels and love visiting other hotels with interesting decor and restaurant offerings. There were little touches everywhere that made the hotel unique...from the photo booth to the room number lights, to the in room amenities and fixtures to small action figures located in little nooks, there was something to see and experience everywhere. The beds and pillows in our room were incredibly comfortable.

title: My birthday
text: A very unique hotel,conveniently located. A hip place to stay. Beds were comfortable, a bit dark, plenty of for purchase snacks and wines. Staff were very great, mentioned the pistachios were stale and the front desk comped us a bottle of wine.

title: Excellent at what they seem to aspire for...grungy dark dorm rooms.
text: I just had to give it 5 stars.   I feel that they achieved exactly what they want.   Dark, worn dorm room style hotel.  We were in a king room, and the room was an adequate size.    The staff was nice but really didn't care too much.   A sink in the lobby bathroom was clogged but I didn't say anything for fear of being frowned upon by the staff.    Trendy place.   You already know what you're getting if your even looking at staying here.

title: Fantastic hotel from top to bottom
text:
Ace Hotel New York is among the most unique hotel properties I've had the pleasure to stay at. From the Martin Guitar in the room, the vinyl album collection (and record player), to the relaxed lobby/coffee shop/bar, Ace Hotel's personality is infectious and inspiring. 

Added kudos to the hotel staff, all the way from the front desk to housekeeping, who took welcomeness up a notch. The hand-written, personal welcome note in my room was an unexpected touch. Any issues I had with the room (encountered a drainage issue my first night) were addressed immediately. Whoever is responsible for their pillow selection: Thank you. 

Finally, there is something to be said for the hotel's central location on Manhattan - easy access to the outer boroughs and JFK eased the stress of travel and allowed me to get the most out of my trip.

title: Unique and amazing hotel!
text: I recently stayed in the city for a girls mini trip. We chose the Ace Hotel and they did not disappoint! The hotel has a cool vibe, amazing lobby and a great staff. This hotel  is clean safe and centrally located. Will definitely be back when visiting NYC!

title: The coolest stay ever!
text:
Amazing rooms (some with acoustic guitars, record players and views to the Empire State). The atmosphere in the lobby and bars downstairs is incredible and the shampoo and conditioner to die for! 
Location is just perfect, right in the middle of everything! 
Highly recommended.

title: So right and so wrong
text:
I stayed at the end of September early October for five days. The hotel is in a great location of 29 west and broadway near fifth and sixth avenue . most of the guests are aged 20-40 techies who spend oodles of their day in the reception bar area permanently glued to iPads and laptops. Two blocks down coming out turning left there is a great little typical deli dinner where you can buy cheap essentials like water but has buffet style get what you want nearly 24/7 and really good cooks who attract locals workmen tourists etc who can order whatever they want freshly cooked which is great as the hotel has a pricey oyster bar so too elite for my personal taste or budget. My king size bed room on 8th floor was quiet on the whole but floors lower down were not so lucky as I had a colleague in a lower down floor. The decor is great if like me your an Art Deco fan it's literally like something from some like it hot with Munroe . The bed is super comfy a great bathroom with Deco charm brass a bath and good shower with some nice touches shower foam etc that hip. It has an ironing board and hairdryer so what's not good.  The things that would make me think seriously about returning are firstly light the rooms are dark and looks out onto another overlooked building so there is constant darkness and despite an overhead light and two bed lights the type of bulbs and complete lack of any natural light makes reading or seeing anything almost impossible so you need to leave the building to do your make up or see most things . The telephone is a nightmare and the handset did not work at all complicated does not begin to cover it . The booklet in the room did not contain the address or telephone number on it which is plain useless 
I was there to organise a big event so for me it was a nightmare I had trouble for anyone to reach me on the guest list I couldn't see what I was wearing or looked like and I couldn't read much without going outside every five minutes I try to always look at the positive of things and while the room had a guitar yes a guitar as I pointed out to reception I'd had much rather have a working means to communicate with the outside world than play a tune quirky but not useful unless I was a girl guide or wanted to form a band ! The hotel should get some decent simple phones without a million buttons and shortcuts that don't work. Darkness adds to jet lag as you spend days in total darkness only good if you have permanent hang overs or connected online 24/7 such a shame that some basic travellers needs are not met . So if your partying or a techie great but if your a business or tourist then they need to do more to make guests comfortable decent lighting a phone that  works. A glass of house wine is 9 dollars in the bar as a guide. The hotel receptionists are a mixed bag a few were extremely helpful and other not so with some attitude thrown in for good measure . My son is a web designer and would love this place however my other son an event organiser would struggle to do what he needed to . I hope this helps you decide if it's for you.

title: Recommended
text: Certainly recommend - extremely nice people, a great bar, fun rooms with a  really well stocked fridge. The location was very central. The Ace has lots of interesting spaces and shops to explore - go for it.

title: I will be back - for my third time!!
text:
Wow! One of the best hotels i’ve ever stayed! It is a place i didn’t want to leave... That’s why i came back for a second time! The vibe in the hotel is amazing. Doesn’t matter if you hang out in the lobby (there was a DJ playing during the evenings), at the baar or in one of the restaurants inside the hotel, you always feel like home! The staff is super friendly and also the outfits they wear are super styling. Great service, doesn’t matter what you need!
The room i had was huge, what is not standard in NYC. Also it was very clean!
The location of the hotel couldn’t be any better. The famous 5th avenue is in front of the door. A lot of things you want to do in Manhattan are in walking distance.
I will be back for sure!!!

title: Great location!
text:
I stayed at the Ace Hotel three times - this should say it all. Love the whole atmosphere there and the service is great! As soon as you enter you feel welcome. Everything is stylish, from the lobby, to the room decor and the staff's uniform. The location is perfect and you can reach the flat iron building in less than 15 minutes by foot. Love the Oyster Bar that is literally attached to the hotel and the possibility to grab a GREAT coffee and a scone right next to the lobby before heading out to explore the city. 
At night, you can sip on a drink at the hotel bar and meet people from all over the world, while a DJ is spinning some tunes.
The rooms are clean, the fridge is well-stocked and .... I will be back!

title: Anniversary Staycation
text: My husband and I just stayed at the ACE for our anniversary. I had booked a small room online. It was on the 8th floor, minuscule and the entire floor reeked like mothballs. I put a call in and the amazing Mahi took care of us, upgrading our room to a medium on the 5th and making sure we had an incredible stay. This level of customer service is what brings me back to the ACE time and again. We loved the bloody Marys at the Breslin and the late afternoon oysters and Freezeling at the John Dory. All in all it was the perfect way to spend our anniversary!

title: 一度泊まってみたかったホテル
text:
雑誌やインスタなどで見ていて一度は行って見たかったおしゃれなホテル。
とにかく可愛くて、オシャレで全てが最高でした。
LAよりNYのエースホテルの方が好きかな。
冷蔵庫も、ソファーもベッドもトイレもアメニティーも本当に何もかもおしゃれで可愛いホテルです。

title: Location, location, location
text: La ubicación del Ace Hotel es extraordinaria. El lugar tiene un ambiente agradable, una excelente cafetería, un Pub y servicio de alimentos en el lobby, muy buenos todos. Es oscuro, los cuartos no son tan pequeños, los baños un poco. La decoración es super moderna pero acogedora. Falta algo de espacio de Closet, para colgar y guardar. Todos los cuartos tienen refrigerador, recomiendo no tomar nada del minibar es muy caro, mejor comprar todo por fuera. Es caro, pero la experiencia fue buena en cuanto a servicio.

title: Great!
text: Really nice decor and a room with lots of amenities.Friendly and polite personel at reception providing us information about the area and restaurants. The size of room was just perfect for a couple and we had a large tv, and good sized bathroom.

title: Nice hotel, close to transportation
text: Nice hotel, less than 10 minute walk from Penn Station, and very close to subway stops on 28th St. The room was very clean and access to floors on the elevator were restricted to those with room keys. Overall, the hotel had a studio/loft type of feel which I liked.

title: More style than substance :(
text:
I recently stayed at the Ace for a number of nights on a business trip. Given the good name that the London Ace has, I was excited about my hotel stay. Unfortunately, reality fell well below expectations.
What a depressing & cold hotel - the staff are all far too cool to bother with good service, they don't appear to have any interest in their guests and any ask feels like a major inconvenience.
The concierge didn't book our cab as promised. My iPad which I left in my luggage had a cracked screen when I retrieved my bags.
The rooms are so dark & dreary and not cleaned very thoroughly.
The air con has 2 settings - off or on - which is too loud for sleeping.
The lobby is a joke - full of students on laptops, drinking Starbucks akin to a hostel. I wouldn't mind except that there is no space for paying guests most of the time. Again, a dark space, which is just all industrial style, but not comfortable as one would expect in a 4* hotel. 
On the plus side, it is a fantastic location with 2 of NYC's top restaurants onsite.
Save your money, and pay for a grown-up hotel, unless you fancy a glorified hostel.

title: A perfect place to stay.
text: We reserved the small room, but were so pleasantly surprised with the size of both the room and the bathroom.  The room was cozy and very quiet.  The location is superb.  The attached coffee shop was scrumptious and we had the best of times.  Thank you, Ace.

title: Best Hotel I've Ever Stayed At
text: Quite a few of my friends had stayed at Ace Hotels elsewhere in the country. I needed a hotel for a trip for a job interview and I thought I would give the Ace Hotel a shot. I fell in love with the room as soon as I walked in. The mini room was the perfect size for me and it was a cozy room with everything I needed or wanted. The radio was already tuned to the classical music station and I loved that the hotel room TV already had my name on the screen to welcome me. The soaps in the bathroom were wonderful and the bed made me not want to leave the room, an incredible feat since I always can't wait to wander the city. What really made me happy was when I had pulled up a blanket to keep me warm and comfortable at night I came back to find the housekeeping staff made the bed with the blanket pulled up at pillow level instead of at the foot of the bed. The staff is top notch and my mini room, which is one of their more basic rooms, had a great view of the Empire State Building. This is hands down the best hotel I've stayed at and I hope to stay at Ace Hotels elsewhere.

title: A quick recharge with the Recharge App
text:
Learned about the Recharge App (available on iPhone/Android), which rents premium and luxury hotel rooms by the minute, and I tried the app during my recent trip to NYC. 

Discovered the Ace Hotel on Recgarge and I was very happy to find a hip and comfortable property. I was only there briefly, but the hotel beds were comfortable and the room was spacious for NYC standards. I LOVED the lobby space, and the communal vibe it gave. 

My only remark is the bathroom space is limited, but this is a given in New York City hotel rooms.

title: Best hotel room I've ever stayed in
text: Holy moly. The Loft Suite at the Ace Hotel is the best hotel experience I've ever had in NYC. I walked in and couldn't believe it was all for me. It was more like a movie set then an actual hotel room. I know it's bigger than most NY apartments so one can't even make that comparison. Insanely spacious, with cool furniture and a huge comfy bed - it was more than I could have asked for. I loved the huge round sofa under the curved shuttered windows - perfect for lounging on while watching tv and enjoying the Ace's room service. And the bathroom was killer - claw foot bath tub with all the amenities. I stayed at another very hip hotel the night before and it didn't have a fraction of thoughtful amenities that the Ace had. Also, my room offered a full sized Smeg refrigerator, which would have been amazing if I were staying longer. The hotel staff also left a kind, handwritten note on the dining room table when I arrived, and gifted me with handmade caramels and bottled water. The whole experience was a total treat. It's like the "NYC cool" version of a luxury hotel experience.

title: Cockroaches in bed!!!! COCKROACHES in BED!!!
text:
What more needs to be said?  See photo. 

An unbelievable air of haughtiness and arrogance pervades this place.  Housekeeping clearly doesn't change sheets. 

Do not stay here unless you have no respect for your own money.  Or yourself.

title: No-Fuss Room Change / Gay Bachelor Party Weekend
text: I booked a large room category at the ACE for a (gay) bachelor party weekend. At first, I was assigned to a room that to me looked a bit off from what I had expected in the pictures. I asked the front desk to switch rooms and they quickly and kindly switched me to a corner room instead. It was wonderful! I threw a bachelor party with about 15 guests -- there was plenty of room for everyone (note, only myself and the bachelor spent the night, but the hotel was very accommodating of the party and had me leave a list at the desk with all the party guests' names so they could let them up to our floor). Plus, we were relatively loud and due to the great soundproofing, there were no complaints from neighboring hotel guests. Oh, and the bed was very comfortable too. Would definitely recommend for any 40-ish and under travelers, as well as any LGBT travelers.

title: Very average
text:
I have stayed in various of the Ace properties and actually don't mind the Uber hipster vibe.. it's whacked out but fun.

The problem with this place was the location. It's on a very seedy little block or two near he flatiron and there are very few decent restaurants nearby.

Also my TV did not work .. just would not turn on..

Room layout was the standard NYC shoebox.. but that's NY.

Would not stay again due to the seedy feeling locale.

title: New York New York !
text: Stay here if you want to feel a bit cooler than usual. The location is amazing. Rooms are very spacious for New York. The staff is full of energy and super helpful. The lobby is the place to work and have a drink (strange combination, isn't it?) And oh! Be sure you try their coffee. My favorite place to hang out even if I don't stay here!

title: The full Ace experience
text: It was exactly what I know of each of the hotels in the Ace company. Incredibly friendly, attentive staff, relaxed vibes, perfect details. Thanks to the team for making my stay so great. Can't wait to come back!

title: Excellent services, perfect location, very nice pub bar
text: A very nice experience for a snowy New York in January; first US image was influenced by Ace experience; very nice and helpful staff, extremely clean room, nice breakfast, good position within the city. Value for the money

title: Aced it!
text: The Ace Hotel in New York is a wonderful gem. It's conveniently located in midtown Manhattan and neighbors dozens of small businesses that offer great eats, treats, and souvenirs. The rooms are cleverly decorated and feature a lot of unique amenities including a body of curiously curated artwork which is placed throughout the hotel for your experience. Staff are firm but friendly and generous. At their in-house restaurant, The Breslin, I was particularly well taken care of by their fantastic waitress Paige and the bartender whose name I didn't catch. Dining experience was fantastic and featured great ambiance and decor. The food was so fresh and well presented that I over ate. I'll definitely be checking out other Ace hotels and staying at the Manhattan location any time I'm on NY business in the future.

title: A Charming Experience
text:
This was hands down the best hotel experience I've ever had. Everything from the ambiance, the staff, the service, the rooms...nothing fell short of excellent. Stumptown coffee is worth every penny and I'll be dreaming about their cappuccino for the rest of my life.

Ace Hotel knows the experience it wants to provide to its guests and has it dialed in to the very last detail. Every nook and cranny in this historic, renovated hotel makes you fall in the love with the place over and over again. I truly wouldn't choose any other accommodations in the city and I can't wait for my next visit.

title: Excellent service
text: I really enjoyed my stay here. The staff and management were very professional and courteous. Next time I'm in NYC for business I will be staying here again! You guys come highly recommend. Thanks for the hospitality

title: Absolutely love this hotel
text: Went to the city for business meeting and stayed at the Ace.  My coworkers and I enjoyed meeting at the hotel lobby. We enjoyed the city vibe, the music, and the comfortable sitting area. The personnel was very attentive and accommodating. I will come back to the Ace and bring my family.  I am sure they will enjoy the uniqueness of this hotel.  The rooms are very nice with unique decor -very impressive.

title: Amazing staff and services...
text: What an amazing hotel.  I didn't know what to expect before I got there but I was pleasantly surprised.  I love NYC and I won't stay anywhere else when I go back!  I was treated like a VIP by everybody and the room was elegant and felt like a second home after a couple days.

title: Great hotel
text: My friends invite me to experience this boutique hotel and I have to say I was impressed and love the style of the hotel.  I'm more of a brand guy, but if the city is every sold out and this place came up, I would stay again.

title: Ace Hotel è un punto fermo dei viaggi a New York
text: L'Ace hotel è un punto fermo dei miei viaggi a NY. Si respira aria internazionale e le stanze hanno sempre quel tocco che ti fanno vivere la grande mela anche in albergo. Unica nota di demerito è la poca elasticità del personale che non ha facilitato l'organizzazione di un compleanno.

title: Great location, great people-watching
text: I spent 2 nights at the Ace Hotel for a business trip. It's an ideal location in the city, near the Flatiron and Chelsea neighborhoods, so there's a lot of destination shopping and restaurants in the area.  The (dark) lobby of the Ace is always great for people-watching and the atmosphere is more akin to a trendy coffee shop than a hotel lobby. I stayed in one of their medium rooms, complete with unique artwork and acoustic guitar.  My bathroom had a huge walk in shower and great water pressure.  The only thing to note is that the bathrooms do not provide body lotion among the amenities, so be sure to pack your own. I definitely recommend the Ace for anyone who prefers a more colorful, less corporate hotel experience.

title: A Haven
text: I heard about the Ace from a celebrity friend...she loves it there and once I got the chance to do the same, I fell in step with her adoration. The scrumptious detail of all things simple and crafted, this room has it. Pendleton blankets, soft beds, soothing, gray color schemes, generous bathtubs (!!!) and more, the Ace has thought of it all. Mainly for me, besides the awesome tub to wash away the miles of hot summer city walking, is the way the room makes you feel at home...quiet...serene. And if you want action, go to the lobby where it's hopping with folks sipping coffee or cocktails where DJs routinely set up in the later hours. The desk staff is really nice however the door guys were a bit aloof. The criticism I've heard about the hotel is it's incredible hip. Yes -- I can see that but it isn't off-putting. When it comes to the Ace -- this North Carolina girl is hooked.

title: Business trip
text: I mentioned the first room I was put in had some minor issues. I was immediately offered a generous upgrade to one of the 'loft' rooms. Great room. Lots of space. Staff, especially Hana Yom, could not have been more charming or helpful. The Ace is in a great location, best coffee in New York from Stumptown, great restaurant (The Breslin) and lively atmosphere. The lobby feels like a drop in for any hipster passing by which can be a little frustrating as a resident since finding a seat can be a challenge but that's a minor thing compared with all the positive aspects of the hotel. If you like hip shabby chic and lots of atmosphere and life you can't do better.

title: Fantastic place and location!
text: The hotel is right in the heart of everything.  Near subway, close to great restaurants and shopping.  Central location to head in any direction.  The staff is very helpful no matter the request.  Good variety of food outlets as well.

title: Dinner
text:
Nice people but messed up the orders didn't bring what we ordered didn't sell us any drinks so service was poor . Was also very pricey considering the lack of service.
The interior was well decorated and interesting but wasn't matched by our experience

title: Ace a place to come back
text: Best Experience so far, unmatched housecleaning, reception very welcome, nice, warm, lobby very urban atmosphere still home feeling one. Very cosy rooms and amnesties are best quality.  Definitely I will come back

title: Good room. Good sleep. Great shower.
text: Got an upgraded room (from mini to medium). Guitar in the room. Low bed, which I was warned about. Some hallway noise at night--people walking / returning to their rooms. Nothing that kept me up all night. Awesome shower. Good wifi and charging station. Room service burger was tasty. But was just a burger on a plate. $20. Good fries and butter lettuce salad. Would stay again. Cool bar / lobby, but was too busy this trip to stop down for a drink.

title: One of my favourites
text:
Love coming here. Cool vibe and one of those places everyone says ' have you stayed there?' 
Great staff, marvellous location and chilled but stylish air about the place. 
Loved the sofas and the lobby - the art is great.
Coffee place was amazing. 
Room sizes were good, with nice towels.

title: Interesting artsy hotel near Chelsea
text: I stayed at the Ace For 4 nights.  Rooms were a good size and the rooms on the 11th floor were quiet.  Very active lobby and lobby bar.  Good restaurant for breakfast right off the lobby.  Very artsy decor in lobby and in the rooms.  Key needed to get from lobby up to your floor. I would go back again.

title: Both a great hotel and a theme park for 1970's New York
text:
I like pretty much everything _objective_ about this hotel. Great, spacious room with air conditioning suitable for a meat locker. Super comfy bed. Nice sitting / reading area. Great desk. Killer WiFi.

But I'm also amused by it. It's a kind of a "1970's New York theme park" - for reference, think about Robert Mapplethorpe and Patti Smith holed up in a seedy hotel, abusing drugs and making art, and also about the New York City of 'Taxi Driver.'

If you're young and hip (or even - like me - not-young and barely hip) - this is attractive. That was a scary, creative, amazing time in New York (I was there...). And to get that vibe, combined with great wifi and comfy beds, makes the Ace an especially nice hotel.

The lobby and bar are packed solid 12 hours a day - go next door to the on-property John Dory Oyster House for a great bar and seafood appetizers.

And if you see DeNiro wearing a mohawk, say "hi" for me...

title: Dark, Dirty and Smelly
text:
Pros: Very comfortable beds, clever details, good vibe in the lobby. 

Cons: Dirty, Smelly and Rundown

Our room was dirty. We arrived to find a moldy shower and dirty sheets.  

I have been a fan of the hotel for many years and hope to see them clean up their act.  It feels like they are due for a bit of remodeling.

title: Seasoned Travelers.
text:
We just wanted to go to NYC for one night. We didn't want to be on a train at midnight! The ace hotel was highly recommended. We got there at 3pm on Saturday. Right to our room. We were told it was a small room but we only needed the bead and a bathroom. It was a really cool room. Just what you need. Clean, good towels, comfortable bed, and clean bathroom. The ACE has a coffee place, and a nice seafood place with outside seating, and a bar that was open late. It is a happening spot. The crowd was the younger generation. 25-35 year olds. I would call it a very hip place even though we were older we just blended in. 
It was a great hotel. If my kids ever go to NYC I would tell them to stay here. 
BUT, the food/snacks/water in the room available for purchase was crazy! We had to play the price is right with the candy and popcorn. Candy bar 6 bucks?   
The bar/lobby was playing DJ music late, but Our room was very quiet. Only horns from the cars outside in the morning woke us up.

title: Best Hotel I've stayed with in a long time!
text:
I simply love Ace Hotel New York...  The design is just what I wish my own apartment would look like, and the staff is friendly and very helpful.  The cafe downstairs is also great, and I love the vinyl player in my room. My room also has a view of the Empire State building, and the location is so convenient!  I basically got around via the R & W subway lines!!!

Thanks for making my visit to NYC memorable!!!

title: Trendy, but sometimes too loud music
text:
Great and trendy hotel, fantastic and helpful staff. Rooms are fine, (2 bed rooms) but don't use them on the second floor.

The bar and DJ are hip, but music is loud and lobby dark. Which is no problem if you are in the bar. 

On the second floor you are right above the DJ, and sleeping is difficult.

However, after asking at reception for a solution, it was provided within minutes, no questions asked.

title: The place To be
text:
Voilà l'hôtel où il faut descendre ! C'est la nouvelle génération d'hôtels branchés qui sont à 100 % 24h/24 avec des dej qui animent, des gens qui bossent EN conworking, qui draguent, qui dînent !
Ne passez pas à côté de ce lieu mythique

title: Cool hotel,  love the location
text: The rooms are nice.  I stayed twice,  no room is similar to the next,  and I did have my preference between the 2 rooms but both are did the work. Both had the space and cool simple decor.  It's an older building,  it comes with room charm but also older looking bathrooms,  older elevators.  I found the hotel to be clean,  with welcoming front desk.  Great bar type vib in the lobby.  It has great coffee shop attached and one awesome oyster bar right there.  In general this area of the city is my favorite.  Very cool places around,  easy access walking or taking the subway (which is right there going North to south).

title: Good value at great location – tiny rooms
text: If location (29th and Broadway) and value are what you're looking for, this may be your hotel. It has a hip, cool vibe. It's an old tiny hotel converted.Though the lobby is dark, it's like a large Starbucks, filled with coffee drinking online customers.The rooms are tiny with very few amenities (clothes rack rather than closet). LOTS of construction noise starting at 7 AM! See if you can insulate yourself from that. If you are looking for any sort of semi-upscale hotel, this is not it. Housekeeping only every three days. The hotel restaurant, the Breslin, though,is fantastic! Try the grilled cheese sandwich. Life-changing.

title: Trendy but in need of storage
text: The Ace is a trendy midtown hotel - the lobby bar buzzes every night.  The rooms are smallish, but that's not uncommon for NYC.  They are comfortable, and the bed is good.  It bothers me that there is no real storage in the room - no wear to put clothes.  Small problems I guess. Oh, and it's not a cheap place to stay.

title: Best kept secret in lower midtown ...
text: An eclectic experience in a very modern and hip property. It is only a 10 miute walk from midtwon and has good subway connections. It is extremely popular evening hang out with a choice of an English pub fare or seafood restauarant. had seafood for dinner and enjoyed the pub for after-dinner drinks. A good whisky selection. Would definitely revisit.

title: Great location & comfortable hotel.
text: Traveled with my girlfriend to this hotel for 3 nights. Lobby is very spacious to hang out in. Coffee and convenience stores very close by. Subway is nearby as well. Might be a little expensive for a pleasure only trip, but if I had the opportunity again I would definitely stay here.

title: 想假裝當個紐約客嗎?
text: 我是在這裡的大廳享受咖啡. 飯店大廳有好幾座沙發和長桌, 都配備了插座,歡迎你帶著筆電來運用他的空間. 大廳裡有一個酒吧, 外面有個咖啡館,可以直接把咖啡帶進來, 會有人來收走. 陌生人坐在一起,低聲的聊天,看書,甚至工作. 非常愉快的下午

title: Bonne prestation
text: Hotel sympa avec une décoration tendance et design. La taille des chambres est correcte et la literie est excellente ! L hôtel n'est pas situé dans une rue à forte influence mais privilégiez une chambre le plus haut possible des les étages pour éviter le bruit de la rue.

title: Super trendy
text:
Stayed in the Ace for a week for work, the staff were great, hotels is very trendy! Great gym and close to transport. 

I now have a personal addiction to Le Labo products as you'll find your shower gel, shampoo features the range.

title: fab ny hotel
text: I've stayed here a few times, and have had nothing but delightful experiences! The location is prime, the staff is lovely and the rooms are unique and great. Love the bar and restaurant as well! All around solid spot in NYC.

title: Nice for couple of nights, but a definite No for longer
text:
It looks super cool, unusual and a bit funky, but at the same time no comfort and they too focused on money (while I thought it will be opposite).
Few examples: Shower area (this is really just area surrounded by curtain and tiles) it too small and every few seconds you touch the plastic curtain; Shower gel and shampoo dispenser are located at ~ 175 cm height, which means you have to try to get it with your hands up (and at the same time do not touch the curtain). Kind of clumsy when you think of it, but not comfortable at all; I ordered take-away desert to the room from their restaurant and they tried to charge me for bringing fork and spoon as room doesn't have any and it is an additional service!
I know this is all small and a bit silly, but this is what comfort made of. Add to this no heating, water for $9/250 ml, tea for $3/tea bag and this is not something I would recommend if you stay long.

For short stays - fun, good coffee and great deserts!

title: 泊まってみたかった
text:
念願の宿泊でした。館内照度の低さにビックしましたが、オシャレな雰囲気にテンションが上がり、着いてすぐに隣接してるSTUMPTOWN COFFEEで注文し浸ってました。部屋もコンパクトでしたが、設備は一通り揃っており、暮らしているような気持ちになりました。
ロケーションも良く便利ですが、夜は通りが暗く、女性一人なら注意した方がいいかと思います。今回は色んな所に泊まりたかったので2泊でしたが、長期宿泊しても良かったです。
機会があればまた泊まりたいですし、違う都市の系列ホテルにも行ってみたいです。

title: おしゃれ
text:
とにかくオシャレで、スタッフさんもオシャレでした。
ロビーがレストラン、バーになってるので、帰ってきたら音楽が結構な音量で流れていて、落ち着く雰囲気ではなかったです。立地がいいので、便利でした。

title: Go Large, Request No Funk
text: The Large King room was remarkably spacious with thoughtful, accommodating touches throughout.  Comfortable almost like a good friend's house, if that friend was running a dog kennel out of his apartment in NYC.  Yes, dog's are great.  But no one likes to be greeted by a waft of dog smell when they first open a hotel room door.  We thought it would go away with the windows open, maybe after some steam from a hot shower to help clear out the air in the room.  No, taking a shower does nothing for dog smell in your room, and it actually makes the smell kick your nose that much harder adjusting to back to funkiness from that fresh, clean shower with the amazing Rudy's Barbershop products.  Nice touch there, Ace.  The entire bathroom was nicely kept and well-decorated, much like the entire hotel.  Still, I must give a 3 on this review because there was also water damage, possibly mold on the ceiling in one corner.  Small but remarkable nonetheless.  We asked twice to be relocated, after toughing it out through the first night of three nights with no complaints, only for promises made and nothing ultimately happening.

title: Best experience in Ace Hotel in NY city
text: excellent services, front desk very friendly and happy to help you, the rooms are very clean and the hotel amnesties are escellent. i love their pearl soap! definitely an experience that I would like to repeat and I recommend this hotel, the restaurant is very good and they have one of the best burgers in town, also morning breakfast is excellent.

title: Snyggt!
text: Snyggt och bra placerat hotell. Detaljerna är helt i sin ordning även om rummet som vi både på var litet, men så blir det väl när man snålar. Väldigt mycket svenskar. Mycket bra service från front desk, gav intryck att trivas.

title: Winter in New York
text: This is only my second time visiting New York. The kids came with us this time. We stayed at the Ace Hotel which was very retro, had a very cool vibe. Very lively at night lots of music and crowds of people. It's like a nightclub in the lobby. Rooms are great size and everything I have that old feel to it.

title: Apartment Style Hotel
text: This hotel was decent. Their rooms can be extremely extremely small. So please do check at the sq ft before you book. I stayed at the loft Suite so that was very nice and spacious. I felt like I'm in a spacious apartment. Staff was nice. Location is very noisy but overall it was nice.

title: What was once cool is now just tired and pretentious
text:
I came here for cappuccino today at Stump and as I was trying to find a seat and was told by the bartender that "this area is only for cappuccino's ordered at the bar". Add to that that at 10:30am a bunch of the worn couches were reserved and empty for a long time. I have been here for drinks, food and coffee bunches of times...but was once cool appears to have become just plain, pretentious and tired.

If you want to create totally separate establishment from Stump coffee... eliminate the door into the hotel lobby from the coffee shop.

title: 満足
text: 到着が深夜1時だったにもかかわらず、ロビーには人が沢山いた。フロントには日本語も話せる韓国系アメリカ人の女の子がおり安心感有。カードキーは一階にあるLe Laboの香りSantal33。朝のstumptown coffeeは少々混雑します。場所はどこに行くにも便利でした。

title: If you have budget to spend for "Small Room One Full Bed" option, not bad choice.
text:
I stayed here for a couple of times at SMALL ROOM ONE FULL BED type. The room price increased in this 3-4 years, so it is very difficult to make a review from neutral stand-point. Frankly, if you pay USD350-400 for 1 bunk room, you may not be satisfied with the room. You can find better option around this location. The minimum requirement I need for my trip is only satisfied with SMALL ROOM option, otherwise the room is a bit small even to work inside of the room. Most people who stay here may work in the lounge that is very spacious, however this space becomes hip club lounge for young people. A bit noisy for people who prefer quiet place. 
The location is super convenient, easy access to metro and penn station too.
Cafe is also nice. However considering heavy competition with Airbnb and other hotels nearby, it's becoming very difficult to find reason to stay here with pricey budget here these days.

title: Moyen
text:
Hôtel bien situé mais les chambres sont vraiment très petites.
Lits également petits (1m40 de large !).
Propreté de la chambre assez moyenne.
Lobby toujours très bruyant.
Personnel moyennement serviable.
Convient d'avantage comme hôtel de "dépannage" et pour voyageur en solo.

title: Great Hotel - Comfortable Rooms and Lively Bar/Lobby/Restaurant
text:
I frequently stay at this hotel when visiting NY. The location is fantastic, the rooms are comfortable (as long as you don't go for a small room) and the service is great.

ROOMS
If you opt for one of the larger rooms, they are spacious with very comfortable bedding, decent sized bathrooms with a large shower space or shower in a bathtub. Good HD TV with cable, alarm clock. Some rooms have couches that pull out as sofa beds, turntables and a collection of LPs, or a guitar. They are all decorated in a fairly 'hipster' style which blends in with the rest of the hotel. 
I know if you go for a small room they can be ridiculously small. There's WiFi in the rooms too.

LOCATION
Less than 15 minutes walk from Penn station, and a subway station just a block away. There are plenty of nice bars and restaurants within walking distance, you're close to Madison Square Park and in the trendy area of NoMad. 

ROOM SERVICE
Room service is not cheap but there is a good selection of food, the grilled cheese is amazing, and they brought up one of the biggest and best Old Fashioneds I've ever had. 

SERVICES
There is a reasonably sized gym in the basement with a couple of treadmills/elliptical machines, some weight machines, free weights, a bench, and a warmup/core room. The hotel has a Stumptown coffee shop inside, which often has insane queues but sometimes you can be lucky and get served quickly. And they do make great coffee. The lobby bar is always bustling, it's a place to be seen but also to sit down and get on with some work as there's free wifi. Gets noisy on weekends when they have a DJ but the noise doesn't seem to filter up to the rooms. The bar do great cocktails, as already mentioned. There is also the Breslin restaurant for breakfast/lunch/dinner which makes awesome food - although the staff there can tend to have a bit of an attitude (especially the host!).

title: A great hotel in the centre of the city
text: A perfect place to stay! I liked it so much - in the centre, great stylish rooms, full mini-bar, nice beds, clean and good bathrooms, very helpful staff, quick luggage storage service. Would be glad to return there!

title: Far to expensive compared to a DORM...
text:
The size of the rooms are ridiculously small (a mini room is about 12 sqm)
The quality of the staff is the american (Jamaican) average...
Price/quality is zero...  I know NYC is expensive, but come on.. you pay 340 USD for DORM room?? (although compared to a Dorm is not that bad :)

title: Hip and Trendy NYC hotel
text:
I really enjoyed my stay here it was my first stay at an Ace Hotel. The design aesthetic was really beautifully done, a fantastic mix of old and new and all with a very New York feel. The lobby was super busy and loud at night, borderline overwhelming after a long day of work but would be super fun if I were staying for a weekend or vacation. 

The room was spacious and had a very old NYC feel but still had modern features and was clean. I was right next to the elevator and did not hear it all, the street noise (2nd floor street facing) was another story and I would ask to not face the street if noise is a concern for you. 

The front desk staff was amazing. I got in very lat (1am) after a long flight and they were friendly and helpful and made me feel very welcome in the middle of the night. 

I would absolutely stay here again and would stay at Ace properties in other cities if the opportunity arises!

title: Alienating anyone over 40...
text:
This is my second business stay at this hotel. I don't get to choose where I stay. Good points, rooms are clean and have everything you need. I love the shampoo, conditioner and shower gel so much that I bought some to bring home. Noise not an issue. Glad to see lifts now require key card, this helps to reassure guests particularly with a bustling lobby full of predominantly non-guests. 
Down side? I get that it's a hipster kind of gaff. I get that it's trendy, but there should be no reason why anyone over 40 should be made to feel like this hotel is not really for them. I suspect owners of ACE don't want older employees for whatever made-up business reason. It's a shame because the more businesses embrace diversity and become more inclusive, the more (most) people are keen to support through custom. ACE you can still keep the edgy, contemporary feel of the hotel whilst taking a more accessible and open stance on welcoming and retaining your more mature customers. It's good business sense....and also just a decent thing to do.

title: Ace is the place...unless you're over 30
text:
I've circumnavigated the globe and stayed in some pretty odd places, but this particular Ace Hotel got my attention...and not in a good way.

But first, the good: 
・Our room was spotlessly clean and huge. 
・For my purposes, the hotel itself was well-located. 
・The on-site Michelin-starred restaurant ("The Breslin") provides the hotel's room service, ensuring that even a morning delivery of eggs and bacon will be a gastronomic delight.
・The in-room bathrobes are unusual and cozy. They're effectively floor-length sweatshirts.
・The in-room minibar was extremely well-stocked with high-end eats and beverages.

And now, the not-so-good:
・The rooms are DAAAAARK. Like, "can't read my own handwriting" dark. If you're young, this is probably no big deal. You might even find it romantic. But for those of us firmly in middle age, we need reading light! I contacted housekeeping, and they managed to scare up a spare canister lamp for us, which my husband angled to reflect off of a wall and provide somewhat adequate illumination. 
・The water pressure--at least in our room--was comically weak. When you're staying at a cut-rate hostel, this is to be expected. But when you're paying almost $500 a night? Yeah, that's not awesome. 
・The windows are either single-pane or super-cheap double-pane. In any case, they provide virtually no noise insulation. Even though our room was on the "quiet side" of the hotel, I tossed and turned fitfully every night of my stay as the sounds of NYC fought past the extra-strength earplugs that I vainly shoved into my ear canals.
・No body lotion provided. Again, for almost $500 a night, a hotel can spring for a few ounces of moisturizer, don't you think? 
・If you want anything delivered via housekeeping, there's a $5 service charge...on top of whatever you might tip them.
・As others have said, the lobby is a moshpit. Even at 7:45am, it was hopping with hipsters; and at 11pm, it was just short of a rave. I understand that this Ace Hotel is trying to create a "community space," but it was a strange sensation to return to my hotel after a day of work and not feel like I was entering an oasis, but rather, a trendy nightclub.

In summary, I am clearly not this hotel's target demographic. But frankly, even hipsters like a quiet place to sleep and a nice dollop of skin moisturizer after they shower. Ace Hotel New York, I've stayed at several other Ace establishments and had much better experiences. Perhaps you could look to your brethren and up your game?

title: strategico
text:
L'hotel si trova in posizione strategica. Due passi dalla Broadway e 6th e a piedi 10 minuti da Times Square. vicinissimo al Flatiron. L'hotel è molto particolare, non comune e comunque accogliente
La colazione un po' cara ma è possibile averla nei tantissimi locali esterni

title: Great atmosphere
text:
Really good place to drop by for a few beers / cocktails 

Quite a pub feel to the place and good service.

Expensive but that's more due to weak pubs / dollar at the moment 

Check this place out if you are mid town area

Matt

title: Lovely hotel located right off broadway
text:
This is a lovely hotel with a really nice decor. The staff are considerate and generally helpful. The location is perfect. It is 2 steps away from broadway and a 5 min walk to Times Square. 
There is a restaurant and bar at the lobby, a tad bit expensive but hey what is New York is not.

Overall I would come back.

S

title: A journey back to the future
text: The best way of describing this hotel is 'shabby chic' The hotel's name doesn't appear outside, and the rooms have a genuine 1930's decor. No two rooms appear to be the same, but one thing all rooms share is a lack of shelf space. I may have lived out of my suitcase, but at least I had a full size Smeg refrigerator as a mini bar.

title: Always fun at the Ace
text: I have stayed here 4 times and each time has been great. The rooms are fun and interesting. Stumptown Coffee is just off the lobby. Delicious but lines can be long. The restaurants, John Dory and the Breslin are good. Breslin is a little pricey but the food is always interesting. It is nice to have 2 restaurants in the hotel during the cold winter months. The lobby is overrun by people who aren't staying there which is sort of annoying. The location can't be beat. Subway is right there, easy walking to Flatiron/Union Square, Penn Station a quick walk too.

title: Parfait
text: si vous allez à NYC pour la première fois, évitez l'attrape touriste central park ou times square bruyant. Optez pour ce petit écrin au lobby branché, look soigné, ambiances d'étage feutrées et literie royale. Tout ce qui à trait à la ferveur et l'épuisement de midtown est fait ici pour vous détendre et vous requinquer pour affronter une nouvelle journée. Emplacement idéal. A 2 pas de l'empire state, de la Ve. Proche de times square qui reste un passage obligé (mais pas obligé d'y loger). A la fois à l'écart et en plein milieu. Clientèle hétéroclite internationale d'âges variés et lieu de rencontre des afterwork citadins. Parfait en couple. Parfait autrement si vous me demandez.

title: Can't beat the value/location
text: Stayed here in one of their hostel-esque suites that had two bunk beds, I was solo. It was a really well-curated space, they have done an amazing job of creating their own little hive here chock full of travelers, young professionals, and visitors all enjoying and utilizing the co-working space, bar, and restaurant. If you're looking for a one-stop shop in the city near all of the action I can't recommend them enough. Big fan of Ace and what what they're doing.

title: Disgusting
text: This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The lobby is obnoxiously loud and feels more like a club than a hotel. The people at the front desk were rude, having skipped checking me in multiple times for people who were on line behind me. When I got to the room, it felt like it had never been cleaned. The comforter had a mountain of dust on it, the towels smelled awful, and there were multiple "sticky" spots on the couch. The bathroom makes no sense either! When you turn on the shower, there's nothing to stop the water from leaking into the entire bathroom. The whole place was just a mess and the housekeepers made no effort to keep it clean. You can do better.

title: 18th birthday present
text: I live in England and for my 18th birthday my parents took me to New York for 5 days and I had the most amazing time ever and the ace hotel definitely contributed to me having the best time possible in New York! The rooms were really cool and the location was perfect. One of their biggest assets is their staff who were really lovely, the people who work behind the desk are great and also the men who carried our luggage and greeted us on the doors every time we entered / exited were always so nice, not in a false over the top way, but genuinely nice and happy which was really refreshing! I love this hotel and if I find myself in New York again I know exactly where I'll be staying!

title: Mini break to New York with husband
text:
This is a super cool, funky hotel in lower midtown. The lobby has a really interesting vibe and quite bizarre. You have to experience it to know what I mean. Late at night with mood lighting there are hundreds and hundreds of people in here sitting on their own on their laptops with the DJ blaring out funky music until the wee small hours. The bedrooms are really quirky. The last time my husband stayed here he had a guitar in his room. This time we have a pencil sharpener. The rooms are really comfortable with a king size bed and a funky bathroom. You get given bathrobes and there is a tray full of yummy scrummy American snacks and nibbles with a mini bar underneath jampacked with sodas and alcoholic drinks. The doors are magnetic and you have a magnet for the door to let the housekeeping staff know whether you want your room cleaned or not with a 'not now' on one side and 'now' on the other. We had a beer and a gin and tonic at the bar on our first night which was delicious. Our bedroom has the most amazing view of the Empire State building.

Definitely worth staying here. Really great fun. Check-in was simple and straight forward with the reception staff incredibly helpful. Two elevators which you have to flash your room cards against to make them go up which I thought was great from a security point of view.

title: Fun & Funky - Large Rooms (for NYC!)
text: My family stayed here for a quick weekend trip.  They booked a "double room" which had two double beds with a narrow desk in between them.  It was very spacious by New York standards--there was ample space between the beds and two chairs and a desk in between.  Their room had a perfect view of the Empire State Building, which was a nice 'treat' for my eight-year-old nephew to see lit up at night.  The bathroom was small but well appointed. The Ace has a chill, hipster vibe which plays out from the always busy lobby area to the room decor.  (Even the 'guest guide' in the room states 'if you don't find something in your room like, say, an ironing board, it is either because it was too big for your room or we couldn't afford it.  Either way, just call us and we'll figure it out.')  The minor gripes--the ceiling could use a bit of a paint job and the lobby is so popular that it is a challenge for guests to find seats.  Other that that, I recommend this as an ideally located respite for tourists.

title: Busy
text: You might mistake this place for a nightclub instead of a hotel and actually you wouldn't be too far off. The rooms are nice though and super quiet, very isolated from the din of the premises. Very fun place to hang out though; trendy coffee shop, common area for laptop party, bar, oyster bar, trendy restaurant. They've made it very easy for you to part with your cash here.

title: A great central spot for fans of walking
text:
All in all, I highly recommend this hotel as a tested and true "luxury boutique" hotel at a reasonable price. Read my review carefully to see if this hotel would fit your style and needs:

We stayed at the Ace Hotel previously for one night only, in one of their smaller rooms, so it was a treat for our babymoon to stay in a room with a king bed and a bit more space. This hotel is perfect for yuppies and hipsters (I think I'm a combo of the two), but it's also a great deal for anyone who wants to stay in the heart of the city and plans to spend time in multiple neighborhoods.

The hotel itself is a bit of a "scene"--during the day, the comfy lounge is full of patrons on their laptops. Many of these people have either gotten coffee at Stumptown, which opens into the hotel, or they've gotten food at the bar in the lobby. If you would find it annoying to not easily find a place to plop down in your lobby, then you may not like this hotel. However, if you like people watching, and you're fine with taking yourself to your own room to relax, this is no problem. Plus, the perk is that you have Stumptown Coffee on the premises, which is some of the best coffee available in the country. No, seriously. It's from Portland originally, and it's one of the reasons my husband and I will probably always stay at the Ace Hotel. If you're the type who would rather find a hotel with free Keurig cups in your room, this is not the place for you. But if amazing coffee for a couple bucks doesn't break your bank, then stop by Stumptown. My husband drinks his coffee black, and I prefer a latte, but I would honestly drink anything when the quality is this good. They also have some pastries, which are great if you're trying to grab a quick bite for breakfast or an afternoon pick-me-up.

The scene continues at night, when the lobby turns into a happening bar. Again--if this is annoying to you, skip it. If you want to be seen while you have that nighttime cocktail, you can do it just steps from your room. There is also live music or DJs frequently.

The restaurant on premises, The Breslin Bar & Dining Room, offers breakfast and brunch on the weekends. It's great to have an option before 10am on the weekends if you're like us and want to put food in your belly and start your day before noon. The food is good, with lighter options (like oatmeal) to heavy, like a full English breakfast.

The room itself: the rooms are a modern design, and despite normally having traditional/classic taste, I love the aesthetic of the Ace. The beds are very comfortable (most important), and the housekeeping staff was very accommodating bringing me extra pillows for my pregnancy needs. I love that they have shampoo and conditioner in the shower (not for me, but for my husband, who always forgets to pack his own toiletries). Our shower was one of my only complaints. The heat was not consistent, and I imagine this has to do with many people showering around the same time. It wasn't that it every ran out of hot water--just varied in how hot it was over the course of my shower (and not just decreasingly hot as one might expect). If you're looking for a spa-like experience in your room, this is not the hotel for you. Other amenities: a radio, record player with a few oddball records, some books and magazines, medium-size fridge (we brought some of our own water and snacks), and comfy (but not plush) robes.

As for the location, you are very close to NOMAD and Eataly (great for lunch) and all the shopping in that district, and only a mile from the theatres, with an easy (if congested) walk up Broadway (no need for Google Maps!). We like walking and walked as far as Chelsea one night, but you can obviously take public transportation or taxi/Uber as well. Other gems nearby that a first-time tourist may overlook: The Morgan Library and Museum and The NYC Public Library (you know, the one with the lions). There are also many other boutique hotels in the area, and they all have their own restaurants on premises, which are a great option if you want to grab dinner "close to home" before heading to a show or out on the town.

title: Pretty disappoinred
text:
Writing this review while at the hotel. I'm pretty disappointed with Ace. While the place has character and is pretty clever, there are a number of essentials that have fallen by the wayside. 

The bathroom is very moldy/musty. There's no hook to hang the towel. The shower drains very poorly. 

The television remote doesn't work. When I asked room service to bring a spare set of silverware, they charged me $5. The room is very hot despite the A/C being set to 65 degrees. 

Overall, the hipness can't cover for poor hospitality.

title: Best location in NYC!
text:
A four night stay with 30 colleagues all in the leisure and industry. The Ace was perfect for us. Rooms are pretty basic and lighting a bit dim but they are pretty cool too with record players, big tv's, Smeg fridge full of beers. A desk, loads of hanging space and decent shower and bath tub make the rooms just fine. Like a very posh back packers. 

Where The Ace scores high is everything else. 

The location on 29th is perfect. Half an hours walk (30 blocks) north through Times Sq or up 5th Av and your in Central Park. The same south and your in Soho, Greenwich Village or near to Wall Street. 15 minutes west and your at Chelsea Market and Meatpacking District and 15 minutes east and your in East Village. 

Right on your doorstep are loads of great bars, restaurants, diners and hotels (e.g. nomad hotel, Gramercy Tavern, Union Square Cafe, ABC Kitchen and Cucina and Eataly - all amazing places).  Also, pretty handy are the East River Ferries up on 35th. For $4 you can hop on a 20 minute (amazing view) ferry to Williamsburg where you'll find the best bars, restaurants and cool hotels all within walking distance. 

Right in the hotel are some pretty cool places too. Starting with the lobby bar - DJ's and great relaxed vibe into the small hours. The Breslin (same guys as The Spotted Pig in Greenwich Village - I think) is a really buzzy, fun bar and restaurant. Book - its worth it. 

Stump town have a little strip of a coffee shop at the front serving smiles and great coffee. Next door is Rudy's barber shop - again v. hipster if you like $30 hair snips.  Finally, there's a good seafood joint here too. I didn't try it but it looks fun. Lots of oysters on display. 

There's ok meeting facilities in the basement (the AV and audio guys were great) - facilities are a bit cranky but fine. There's also a very compact gym in the basement too. 

Overall a great hotel and good value for money. I would definitely recommend. I stayed for 2 nights earlier at The Nomad (around the corner) where the rooms, corridors, restaurant and bars are definitely swankier but it's at least twice the price and whilst cool it's probably not quite so much fun as The Ace.

title: Too cool for school
text: Spent 3 nights earlier this month with my husband.  Great property, super location, Stumptown Coffee attached a big plus.  Only complaint was the lighting in the rooms was inadequate - too dim, and not adjustable.  Bed was super comfortable, and the lobby/lounge was great.
