It's busy all day with people holding casual meetings and working on their laptop, and at night it's a scene - we were never able to actually find a place to sit, although from what I understood 90% of the people working/meeting weren't guests.  Overall, a good stay, but for the price, in the future will look for a property that's more on the cozy side, rather than a hipster magnet.

title: Not as good as they think they are
text: Having read YumYum Travellers review I couldn't agree more.  I stayed at the Ace NYC with friends in January, and also felt that I didn't quite make the grade of what they considered to be a 'cool' customer.  Liked the decor, liked my room, and really appreciated the responsiveness when I had numerous noise issues (which by the way is quite a problem there - the rooms are not well insulated against noise both from the hall and other rooms).  BUT, when I am paying for a stay at a hotel, I do not expect to have to compete for seats in the foyer with people that are drop ins off the street using the free Wifi.  Many times I found myself standing or perched uncomfortably while waiting to meet my group, or wanting to sit and enjoy a drink after the day out.  However, your loss Ace - we would have happily sat in the bar and spent a lot on drinks, but we were forced to move to our rooms and provide our own.  And possibly the most annoying thing of all, when my friend was asked for her feedback, and explained how we found the foyer arrangements unwelcoming, she was pretty much told she didn't understand the intention of the hotel founder.  So the message was loud and clear - if you don't agree with us, you're not the sort of person we want staying here.

title: Definition of customer service
text:
Snow storm Stella has ground NYC to a halt today so there are a lot of guests hanging around the hotel either working or doing there best to enjoy vacation.

The hotel staff have been truly outstanding trying to help people. I'm sure they are a few people down due to storm related travel challenges.

The Team are putting on a happy hour in the bar area, trying to accommodate restaurant bookings and offering discounts to all residents.

All credit to Ace Hotels and their dedicated and friendly staff.

A modern definition of customer service.....

title: Very cool hotel in NYC!
text: I recently stayed at the Ace Hotel NYC as my son said to check it out.  I would highly recommend staying here as it has a great vibe in the main lobby, Breslings restaurant is fantastic and with Stumptown coffee connected to the hotel you can't go wrong!  My room was small but welcome to NYC.  However, it had all the comforts needed when on business travel.  Some rooms have guitars and some record players.  They have a great assortment of snacks, food and drinks to choose from as well.  Plus the hotel is in a great part of town as it is easy to go either uptown or downtown via Uber, taxi or subway.  Definitely check it out!

title: The Most Enchanting Stay in New York City
text:
After staying with the Ace Hotel, my experience in New York has completely changed. The Ace is one of the most refined, mesmerizing, and modern hotels in the city, and their exceptional service and attentive staff are nothing short of extraordinary. 

I stayed at the Ace over the course of three weekends in February and March this year. Needless to say, for so many reasons, I kept coming back. The hypnotizing atmosphere and alluring charm of the Ace swept me right off my feet from the moment I first walked in, and from there, only magic ensued. 

The lobby alone is one of my favorite places to be in New York. Whether you want to relax, work on your laptop, read the paper, have a glass of wine, or mingle with locals and other travelers, the Ace is consistently filled with the most interesting people, who much like myself, don't want to leave. You can really only experience it for yourself to comprehend the atmosphere of this beautiful space. The romantic glow of the lobby will most definitely cast a spell on you, but the entire hotel will simply bewitch you. 

The rooms have a luxurious, modern rustic character which make you feel right at home, except somehow even better. The Ace makes it a priority to attention to detail - each room is completely satiated with exactly what you need to feel comfortable, but delightfully fulfilled with even more than you expected. I had the pleasure of staying in their Mini Room and Medium Room's, and my experience in each one made it extremely hard to check out. From the most comfortable (and huge) fresh beds and linens, to the rain shower heads, soft robes, guitars, record players, and brimming mini bars in between, not only was it hard to check out but it was also hard to leave the rooms all together!

As for the staff, my goodness. I have never met so many amazing, accommodating, and generous people all in one building, let alone all working for the same hotel! My birthday passed over one of the weekends while I was there, and I was completely delighted and surprised by how generous the Ace team were to totally surprise me with an incredible complementary room upgrade, and to also wish me a very happy birthday with a bottle of red and card waiting for me upon arrival. I was touched, humbled, and perfectly blissful. I could have never wished for a better surprise or more beautiful gift. What's more, is many of the staff took it upon themselves to actually learn and remember my name. House keeping also left my room completely fresh, clean and immaculate every single day. There is no other place in New York that could make me feel like such royalty, or steal my heart the same way that the Ace did.

This hotel is something special, and truly ethereal in the heart of New York City. I will most definitely be back again, and can't wait to visit the other Ace locations too. Thank you so much to everyone who made my stays as sublime as they were, and for making me feel so completely wanted and welcomed. 

Until next time!!

title: L'Hotel idéal pour un séjour à New York
text: Je me déplace assez régulièrement aux Etats Unis et notamment à NYC. C'est la première fois sur les conseils d'un ami que j'essayais cet hotel. Il est idéalement placé (29th / Broadway - Midtown). L'ambiance est parfaite (elle rappelle son homologue à Londres), à la fois professionnelle et détendue. Les équipes sont attentives et la chambre qui m"a été proposée extrêmement pratique et confortable, je recommande particulièrement la Loft Suite. Je reviendrai à coup sûr !

title: I didn't want to like it but I did
text:
I stayed here on business and was lamenting being put up at The Ace (no disrespect just not my preferred neighbourhood) - but that changed when I saw my room.

It was surprisingly spacious and tastefully decorated. It had a lot of personality - I could have moved in.  

Staff were friendly too.

title: Love Ace Hotels!
text: The charm of the Ace Hotels never disappoints, and I enjoyed my stay at the NYC location.  From the flowers in the foyer, to the decor of the lobby, to the eclectic fun of the room -- the details are fun and inviting.   The front desk was attentive and personable.  My room was great, with a view of the Empire State Building.  The bathroom is a tad small, but the size of the room and all the little extras like a comfy beds, great 360 desk, and a Smeg refrigerator made up for it.  Having a Stumpton coffee attached is just the extra bonus to the hotel, as is breakfast at Breslin's next door.   A wonderful location with a ton of character.   Thank You Ace New York!

title: Excellent stay
text: Great Hotel and worth the extra expense for the atmosphere, location and interesting people. The rooms are beautifully decorated in a New York style and the facilities are comfortable. There is a great gym, restaurant and coffee shop in the hotel and the lobby is inviting.

title: Super fun, super competent.
text: My sister and I were on business in NYC and stayed at the Ace. Not what you'd describe as a 'business hotel', it was actually incredibly comfortable and despite it's 'party party' reputation very quiet and restful if you do indeed want to step out of the mayhem for a while. It's a total shot of adrenaline when you walk in the door: bumping disco, post punk and house music and a packed bar full of the cool and the dangerous... absolutely brilliant! The rooms were stylish, clean and well appointed... And best of all very well priced for mid town Manhattan. The staff were helpful and hilarious in equal measure, perfect personalities for this kind of joint. We had a great time- thank you!

title: Underwhelmed for the 2nd Time
text:
I stayed here twice in the past year. May 2016 and February 2017.

I have to say, I am not a fan. I gave it a try the second time with a so-so experience the first time around. However, both stays have been pretty underwhelming and the service is not really very professional.

1. Location is OK. Midtown is a decent part of Manhattan. Not the coolest part of town. It's a bit touristy. I stayed here because it is close to where the conferences were that I attended for work. However, the location is decent.

2. Rooms are Overrated. The rooms are unique, but that's about it. The lighting is really dismal and depressing. The black carpet, black doors, black shades kind of need some light if you ask me! I have three lights in the entire room that barely light up anything. The decor is very much like a dude, college dorm room. 

3. Service. This is my main issue. Some people who work here are nice to your face, but I always get the feeling that they are annoyed when they actually have to help you. It's as if they feel that you should be thanking them for allowing you to stay at their "cool" hotel. It's as if, they feel that they are entitled to have a job where no one ever complains or expects them to actually follow through on anything. It's as if, they just want you to only give positive reinforcement on what a "cool" and "unique" place The Ace is, yet when there is a complaint or something different or special needed from a customer, they have no idea how to handle it.  It feels very one size fits all mode of service and they don't seem to know how to relate to anyone who is different from them.

Here is some advice to The Ace, serve your customers with respect and don't treat them as if they are "outsiders", "complainers", "stupid" or "unreasonable" when they just expect the same level of service you'd get at any other respectable hotel who cares about serving customers. Don't expect all of your customers to be young, hip, cool people who are like you (or more accurately how you perceive yourself to be, because the way you act ain't cool).

People who give you their money expect you to treat them as a guest, not someone you merely put up with because you need their money to stay in business.

If you can't run a hotel with a true customer service attitude (not perfection mind you), then why are you in the service industry?

title: A bit overrated
text:
The best thing about this hotel is the staff! Everyone I encountered was very helpful, kind and efficient (not to mention they all looked pretty cool, too!). 

I was here two nights for work and found it a tad gimmicky. From the super-packed (and extra-dark) lobby, to the room decor, this hotel appeared to try a bit harder than it really needed to. Other people seemed into it though, as the common areas — and attached coffee shop — were packed at all hours. 

My room was spacious and very clean, but the bed was oddly short and the window super tiny and oddly place. It felt a bit like a cave. On the plus side, the hotel is well-situated and is an easy walk to many major attractions and subway lines. 

Overall, my stay was decent, but I'm not sure I'd rush to go back.

title: Love the vibe
text: This place has a great vibe. Love this place. The common spaces really promote a great sense of community. The staff were very friendly and the location can't be beat. Very central and close to everything.

title: Swanky Bar / Night Life
text: Lobby / Bar comes to life after hours and you feel like your in a swanky / 20's throwback. Wasn't a huge fan of the beer selection at the bar but overall a great atmosphere. One of a kind place with modern feel

title: Muy buen diseño pero sobre todo buena onda
text: El Ace no solamente es un hotel bueno y diferente en donde la decoración rústica crea una gran atmósfera sino que su lobby es de lo que conozco el de más onda de Nueva York. Para los viajeros latinoamericanos que agradecemos las cosas divertidas lo recomiendo a ojo cerrado. La habitación que me tocó tenía una nevera antigua perfectamente restaurada llena de cerveza - punto para el Ace

title: One of s kind
text:
I needed a place for a couple meetings in NYC. I read so many good reviews on this hotel especially on their lobby policy. 
I came in around 09:00am had 2 
meetings and lunch 
Nice - clean - quiet - convenient - good size desks- wifi - charging stations for all my gadgets - restroom- open tab thorough the day all this and I am not even a guest...
Next time I will be

title: Amazing New York Experience at the Ace!
text: The general manager and the staff at the Ace are exquisite hoteliers. Everything was perfect. The large suite was luxurious and fun. It is a definite must stay hotel! High above the noise of the city the suite was quiet and tranquil.

title: Great place!!!
text: My daughter booked our room. It is a great place to stay! Easy access to many places. Very reasonable rate for NYC. Room was clean and the people are very friendly and helpful. Interesting lobby there were always people just hanging out there.

title: Fun, interesting atmosphere. Nice, large suite, great staff.
text:
I accompanied my fiancé on a business trip to New York and we stayed four nights at the Ace Hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. They seemed happy to be there and we felt welcomed. We were in a large suite with two desks, two couches, a fairly large bathroom and a small stocked refrigerator. The room felt like a New York City loft with hipster feel. It even had a guitar in the room. It was fun to stay in. There was no coffee or coffee machine in the room but there was tea for sale and an electric kettle to boil water in. A great coffee shop was located in the lobby with coffee for sale. The lobby was an active exciting place. Crowded with people working on their phones and computers during the day and the place turned into a nightclub every night. (So if you want quiet, low key lobbies, this is not the place for you. I cannot see my 78 year old parents here) The Ace also had a nice bar. Plenty of places to eat near by and just 2 to 3 blocks from the Empire State Building on 5th Ave. it's a safe area to walk. 
Now for the downside. The street noise was very loud in the room. I had trouble sleeping. I suggest you bring earplugs if the sound of sirens and honking cars bother you.

title: Uber cool
text: I stayed at the Ace over a weekend in January as I had meetings in the city. I thought the rate very reasonable and when I arrived I was immediately upgraded to a larger room - which at a 1.45am check in - I was most grateful for.  Uber cool, stylish rooms, with excellent attention to detail (the most lovely bath grey bath robes, fluffy towels and luxurious shower gel/shampoos etc).  The most comfortable beds I've ever slept in,  a large Smeg fridge, TV, digital Radio, work bench, guitar etc - and as it was snowing heavily outside - it was a pleasure to lounge around in the room.  We had cocktails on the Saturday evening in the lobby bar - the crowd was lively and DJ read his crowd well. I ate in the Breslin on Sunday with 5 friends - and we all agreed it was a great hotel and restaurant. Would definitely stay again - but in a room further from the lift - I was opposite and was woken early both mornings by guests coming and going!

title: Business Trip
text:
This hotel is in a nice location for being in the city.  We could walk to many restaurants.  Also, I slept in the rollaway bed and it was more comfortable than the actual beds.  

Breakfast is provided in the hotel. It is decent, but I recommend going out to get breakfast.  There is a coffee shop in the hotel and it is fantastic.  Stump town Coffee. 

The rooms are very sound proof, you could hear your neighbors and people walking down the hallway.  But your in the city, so it wasn't really a big deal.  

I would stay again.

title: College dorm
text: The place is clean and cheap and the staff are highly responsive. It is perfect if your are nostalgiac for your college dorm: tiny bedrooms, lobby a sea of laptops and iPhones and loud parties echoing in the hall. I am pretty sure I saw at least one sock on a bedroom doorknob.

title: オシャレなホテル
text:
娘とクリスマスシーズンに泊まりました。
お部屋もロビーも全てオシャレ。
併設のカフェやオイスターバーも使い易く、一度泊まってみる価値のあるホテルだと思いました。

title: Great, unique hotel
text: We loved the Ace Hotel. Cool, interesting rooms. Great location (don't stay in Times Square; that's fake NYC). The service staff is amazing (which is way too rare inn NYC). Check out their calendar before you arrive so you can experience their events too.

title: So NYC style
text:
Ace hotel really impressed us for this trip.
we stayed here for two nights.

great location to subway station and some sightseeing spots.
walkable to Madison square park,flatiron building, empire states building...so on.

love spending time at the lobby even though just sitting there:)

love this kind of hipster style hotel.

title: Fun Boutique hotel that's not expensive
text:
I travel to NYC every January for the NRF convention at Javitts. Not many choices in/near/around the Convention Center for hotels. First time visiting the Ace this year, have to say it was a very fun, cool hotel. From the main open lobby with plush leather couches to The Breslin bar and Stumptown Coffee onsite, it's actually a lobby you want to spend time in. I had a few work meetings in the lobby before and after the convention and it was a convenient and comfortable place to meet.

For my room, they only had available the smallest option, which I was worried about size-wise. But the decor is really cool(old-school pencil sharpener on the desk, funky radio and other kitchy items, bar well stocked with premium products) and it felt very comfortable, so it wasn't a big deal. The only downside was there isn't a closet, just some hangers on a bar on the wall, which was odd. The bathroom was quite large for New York, I really liked the shower with a window to let out steam. The amenities were very clean as well.

Overall I would stay here again, only other downside besides no closet is the area surrounding the hotel is a little shady, so be careful walking around. We had a homeless guy following us asking for money, we ignored him and walked past, he then yelled "If someone doesn't give me money Im gonna start robbing people." But that's more New York in certain areas than the hotel itself:).

title: Really had fun at the Ace Hotel!
text: I was a little surprised by the retro decor when I first arrived because I hadn't done much research about the hotel, but once I got used to all the distressed surfaces and started to notice the nice touches like brass fittings on the tub...it became a super fun experience! The staff was great, the hotel was within walking distance of everything. Highly recommended!

title: Very comfortable hotel but the bar staff need to get over themselves
text:
We stayed here for a few days over Christmas, you walk in to the lobby and it's very vibey and cool, if a little dark, even on Christmas Day it was busy with locals.
Initially I was a bit disappointed with the bedroom, it was a bit studenty and the bathroom was tiny but actually on reflection it had everything we needed, the bed was very comfortable, there was very little noise from other guests. The minibar was a huge smeg fridge and there was a turn table and a selection of vinyls in the room. The room had a great view to the Empire State Building.
We had drinks in the bar a couple of times and on both occasions the bar staff were far too busy being cool or chatting with their friends to serve drinks so we had to wait ages to get served, which if they had been busy it wouldn't really bother me but they weren't. The staff in the oyster bar in comparison were excellent.

title: Best you can get in Manhattan!
text: Ace NYC was the best choice for our honeymoon. The staffs were so apologetic when the room was not ready, then they decided to upgrade our room and serviced us a bottle of wine to celebrate it with us. You cannot expect a huge room or bath in Manhattan. But our room was clean, bed was comfy and shower had a good pressure. The Beslin bar had nice selections of drinks, and John Dory's oysters were so good!! We enjoyed the photo booth on lobby and the Stumptown coffee every morning. Think about your hubby gets you the best latte when you are still getting ready! I left a little thank you memo when we check out and Jennie at the front sent me a thank you email. I can't thank enough to Ace for making my first NYC trip so memorable. Would love to go back!

title: Amazing Place
text: Just returned from a milestone birthday ti to New York, and stayed at The Ace - the most amazing hotel ever! The vibe is the coolest you will find, decor is fab, all the staff are so lovely and really helpful when needed - all i all the best 5 days you could wish for. Stumptown a great place to get your morning hot drink, then you can relax in the lobby for a while before heading out. Just fantastic!

title: Without a doubt one of my favourite hotels in New York!
text: Modern, hip and stylish the Ace Hotel New York is a perfect combination of comfort and ambience at an ace location in the big apple. There's all sorts of shops, restaurants, and landmarks walking distance and a few subway stations a minute walk away. Opening Ceremony store at ground floor makes it even a better catch!

title: Paper doll hotel- so pretty to look at, but when you touch it falls right over
text: I think you are paying for a hip lobby and not a quality room when you pick this hotel. I mistakenly booked the bunk room which felt like a jail cell- for $150 this was a huge mistake! Also, when I arrived after a long days work all I wanted to do was lay down watch snl and relax- it took one hour for the problem to be resolved & in the morning the tv was again not working! Needless to say I was very frustrated... when I complained at check out I was offered a free cup of coffee 😂😂 laughable act of compensation... the shower was tiny- I'm 5'6" 130 pounds and every movement I made caused the gross shower curtain to touch my body- very annoying! This hotel is all looks and no quality... I do not recommend!

title: Hotel with a difference!!!
text:
Stayed at the Ace Hotel with my partner for 3 nights and this was the first time we had both visited New York - And what a first impression the hotel made.....

The hotel itself is fantastic and great value for money! The hotel front is impressive,  decor is quirky but cool throughout, bedroom was lovely and spacious enough (small room booked), the lobby bar was always busy with a great atmosphere and the staff were nothing but great and nothing was ever too much trouble!

The coffee shop located on the ground floor was by far the best coffee we had in New York!

Convenient location for all the sites!

Would highly recommend for younger couples and groups!! The only place we'd now stay in New York!

title: Short stay, great location, great bar
text:
Room was small but had everything we needed. Bed was so comfortable! The hotel is in a great location and the bar downstairs is great.

Would definitely stay again if in New York, I do think that the lobby area could be better managed for guest, often it was difficult to get any seating.

title: Great location, Nice decor, Awful service
text:
To start with the positives: the location of the hotel is excellent, the decor is chic and the bed was comfortable.

However, the negatives: We landed in NYC after a red-eye flight and got to the hotel at 7 am looking for a chance at an early check-in. Were told to come back at 3 pm, which we understood, but still had to wait until 4 pm to check in (with no apology). The front desk staff also didn't "come get me" I had to go ask again.

We received a late check out, but they didn't update our keys or ask us to come down to do so. When I was out, my girlfriend (whose name was not on the room) was left waiting in the lobby since they would not update her key since her ID did not match the reservation.

My biggest complaint is that when I came back home, my good friend asked me if I had received his gift. (I hadn't). He apparently called in to the Ace front desk a few days before my arrival to put his credit card on file and was assured that my entire room bill would be charged to his card (which would have been a very nice surprise). They did not charge my room to his card. If I was someone giving the same gift, I would have been livid.

Also, for whatever reason my credit card was pre-auth'd three times so my credit card limit was down by $3,500.

One more thing: They charge $7 USD for a pack of small M&Ms in the room.

title: Coup de coeur assuré
text: Nous sommes tombés sous le charme de cet hôtel très branché. La chambre était super sympa, propre et confortable. Très bon accueil. Nous étions au 10ème étage et nous n'avons pas été dérangés par le bruit. Bien situé pour découvrir New York.

title: Superb lodging
text: This hotel embodies its name. It's all aces! Super cool vibe with beautiful rooms. Service is friendly and efficient. Rooms are quite large and very well appointed with super cool accessories and the like.

title: Wonderful welcoming and warm
text: And whimsical too! It's an amazingly trendy place, filled in the afternoons with all kinds of want-to-be-seen folk and their laptops! Rooms are excellent and the bathrooms are to die for! Rates are good, location is perfect and the staff very friendly and helpful - and stumptown is just downstairs for the coffee or cocoa fix!

title: Amazing, great location, excellent hotel
text:
I spent 4 nights here in mid December.   It's location is great, close enough to Time Square (10mins walk) but far enough away from all the hustle & bustle.  We had a double room (two huge beds), very spacious with a view of the Empire State Building 👍.  The food in the restaurant was amazing, best Steak & Stilton pie and French Onion Soup in town. Great choice of Craft Beers in the bar too.  The coffee shop was also convenient, tasty strong coffee, great to start the day.

I would definitely stay in a Ace Hotel again, worth the money for sure.

title: Great stay and well priced hotel
text: Had a good deal for this place. I liked the design and feel of the place. Enough has been written about all the details. I had a mid-size room and managed to get a great price for it. Was doing business in the area so it was perfectly located for me. I also enjoyed the layout and hung out in the lobby area quite a bit and had meetings there. The gym is decent so you can get a good workout in. Further, I really enjoyed the restaurants as I was able to continue meetings there when in need of lunch or dinner. Folks meeting with me who met me there and didn't know the property were impressed. The room was comfortable too. I enjoyed the bed and the bathroom, although a bit tight as everything in NY is, was very usable. Amenities in room were also good. All in all a good stay and if you need to be in the area, a good choice. It wasn't perfect hence no 5 stars but everything was a solid 4 and if you get a good, price you can't go wrong.

title: Great stay!
text:
Super nice staff and cool hipster place in New York. I stayed here in one of those 'heavy snow' weekends when my flight to Chicago (were I had a 5 stars hotel waiting for me...) was cancelled, so I needed a strong and funny experience to recover the delusion. And everything worked perfectly well. The room is really cool, and the bathroom looks like the one at home!
Only a couple of things: no coffe in my room, is the policy I am told, but there is a cattle. 
Well, boys, you can surely do better on this.
Recommend!

title: This place is cool!
text:
My husband booked this hotel for my 30th birthday and he sure did pick a gem!

On arrival at the hotel you are greeted with a classy exterior and cool 'waiting room' style lobby. The staff all great you with smiles and go out of their way to assist consistently.

My husband had liaised with the hotel and when arrived to our room I was blown away! The view of the empire state was amazing (being a typical girl I cried!) we also had a bottle of red compliments of the hotel and a birthday note. I suspect our room was not the mini room we had booked as it seemed more spacious than the mini's, however I am not certain. The decor was edgy and smart with good lightening and a very comfy bed. The room had everything we could need and the MOST comfortable dressing gowns I have ever worn (you can also buy these). The toiletries in the bathroom are divine and can also be purchased from the barbers down stairs.

The rooms are cleaned daily and are cleaned to an impeccable standard (even around the increasing shopping bags we obtained as the week went on).

We had one night when we were disturbed by a dog barking, this was not annoying but more worrying for the animal. However animals should not be left in rooms so this was dealt with by hotel staff. In the morning we had a voucher for 2 coffees and cake from the coffee shop down stairs! Amazing.

Speaking of the coffee... well I pride myself on appreciating good quality coffee. And this stuff is special. Creamy, vibrant coffee and service with a smile. We had these everyday and since coming home have tried to recreate them- so far no success.

On my birthday the hotel staff had helped my husband order huge 30 balloons and they delivered them to the room. My husband reports all correspondence with the hotel was prompt and helpful.

We drank in the bar a couple of times and never struggled for a seat. We also found the wifi in the hotel to work very well.

We also had cocktails and oysters in the John dory oyster bar. These were great.

All in all this hotel is just epic, we will return to NYC and will for sure stay here. We also now want to try the other ace's around the globe.

Thank you to all the staff for making my birthday and our stay so special. We will be back!

title: 50 dollars charge for 30 min late check out
text: Stayed in this hotel for four days. Noisy lobby full of young crowd with laptops, in the evening it became as a disco club with loud music. Very Small rooms, no service provided at all. Overpriced. Was charged 50 dollars for 30 min late check out. Will not return

title: 噂通りのオシャレなホテルだけど。。
text:
オシャレで人気になので若干高いかな？と思います。
1人での滞在だったので1番安かった二段ベッドの部屋を取ってしまった為に
部屋では過ごし辛い！
ベッド寝心地微妙。。

泊まるだけで良いなら周辺にある違うホテルでも良いかと思います。

ここは、雰囲気がオシャレというのがポイントだと思います。

歩いてフラフラするには良いダウンタウンです。

車でピックアップして貰ったり、タクシーを使う時はこの辺りの一方通行迷路にハマります。

title: Great rooms average staff
text: The room and location were great. But for the price you pay no one helped with luggage, either on the way in or out, and we were completely ignored by the bartender who preferred chatting with his regulars to serving actual customers.

title: Drink and happy hour in the lobby.. MA...sorpresa al conto ...
text:
Siamo stati all'Ace con una amica newyorkese e l'ambiente ci è piaciuto molto così come le sedute su ampi divani nella lobby. Ambiente quasi da film con bel contrasto tra il banco bar con una mega bandiera americana e scritte creative sia per bagni sia per uscita di sicurezza.
Dopo poco dal nostro arrivo ci è stato portato un altro menù dedicato all'happy hour con selezione di vini e cocktail
Ricevendo il menù 15 minuti prima dell'orario di inizio dell'happy hour abbiamo consultato il menù e sono andato personalmente ad ordinare e pronto a pagare visto che ero con due ragazze.
Non ho più fatto caso all'orologio visto che ci avevano portato il menù happy hour. 
Abbiamo ordinato 3 bicchieri di vino rosso dalla barista a cui dopo la richiesta se avessi voluto lasciare il conto aperto ho lasciato la carta di credito.
Dopo circa 40 minuti abbiamo fatto un altro giro di 3 bicchieri .
Dopo 1 ora e mezza sono andato a pagare e ... Sorpresa..
C'era al bar in altra persona (un uomo e non specifico etnia ma potrei riconoscerlo per segnalarlo alla proprietà) che mi ha fatto il conto facendo pagare tutto a costo pieno.
Ricevendo il conto ho subito segnalato che avevamo preso il vino in Happy hour e lui in maniera scortese (e questo mi innervosisce ancora di più..) ha fatto vedere che lo scontrino riportava l'ordine che era stato fatto alcuni minuti prima dell'inizio dell'happy hour . Io ho chiesto gentilmente se non c'erano alternative visto che avevano ricevuto il menù proprio per happy hour e lui ha detto che non poteva farci niente.
Molto scocciato ho pagato senza lasciare Tip e me ne sono andato.
Oltretutto mentre posso accettare la fiscalità sul primo giro ritengo assurdo pagare pieno il secondo giro di vino perché il conto  era stato aperto precedentemente.
Viaggio da anni e raramente ho dato recensioni così negative ma .. in questo caso hanno perso non noi che siamo occasionali ma la nostra amica che si recava spesso con altri conoscenti o clienti ...
Ambiente 4,5
Servizio 0,5

title: Cool and stylish stay in Manhattan
text:
We booked this as part of a Christmas trip we had to visit family in Manhattan and Long Island. Being a Londoner I am familiar with their location in Shoreditch so had a fairly good idea of what to expect. 
We initially checked into our Small room however asked if we could be relocated to another as the one they gave us was directly opposite the lifts and wanted to negate any disturbances that evening - they moved us immediately which was really appreciated. 
All the rooms have a similar feel with unique touches; ours featured an acoustic guitar, record player and murals on the walls. The rooms were quite big in comparison to the other hotels we stayed in - only negative is that there was not a lot of natural sunlight or lighting options so the rooms were fairly dark.
The cafe downstairs was great for an early "jet lag" coffee and the gym was also pretty well equipped. 
We also ate at the Breslin - the food and service were outstanding and memorable.
Only two things to note that bothered me during our stay:
1) Upon checkout we asked to leave luggage for a few hours at the hotel. We ended up staying with the luggage in eye shot for 30 minutes as they did not immediately move it to a secure lock-up, instead it lay wide open in reception by the main doors at the mercy of all visitors coming in and out of the hotel that morning.
2) We used the photo booth in reception on our last morning to have a memento of our stay. The photos came out semi-developed so reception team promised to re-fund me the money paid. It was only around $5 however I am yet to see this re-funded on my card (some two weeks later).

title: インスタ映えはするけど
text:
部屋が選べなかったので
内装をきたいしたけど

title: Too cool for school
text:
I quite liked the Ace but it is definitely trying too hard to be hip.
The rooms are decent, beds comfortable, lobby gets annoying after a while as it is always packed with Apple devotees taking advantage of good coffee from the adjoining coffee shop (a highlight) and free wifi.
Well located but all in all a bit overpriced and hipster centric.

title: 1 Week Stay
text:
Room - very good
Bed - excellent
Downside - funky lobby with lots of Millennials occupying the seats. First time I have felt like a second class citizen in my hotel.  
Breslin restaurant - food was ok , menu limited for what you might expect at a hotel.  Room service menu not worth mentioning. ACE could do better here. 
service slow , erratic,  rated poor.

title: Väldigt härligt hotell med personliga rum
text: Väldigt bra och tryggt läge. Roligt att det är aktivitet i loungytan på hotellet under hela dagen. Personligt inredda rum i industriell stil. God frukost i restaurangen bredvid. Trevlig personal. Kanon att de har gym.

title: Truly for the Millennial...I think
text: This hotel has always been highly recommended. I don't get the hype - it's dark and you say a ton of people in the lobby on their laptops with headphones on. The rooms were in character with the theme of young. Beds were platform and room was decorated like randomly found furniture from your college days. Bathrooms were nice. Biggest flaw for this hotel was you couldn't find the electrical outlets! Had to put phone on edge of trash can to plug in. Pricing is somewhat high for what you get.

title: Cooles Hotel
text: Wir waren fünf Nächte hier zu Gast vor Weihnachten. Die Lobby und die Zimmer sind eher dunkel, aber cool eingerichtet. Das Zimmer war super. Vielleicht hatten wir Glück aber unser Zimmer war riesig mit großem Bad im 10. Stock. Die Lage ist perfekt, man kann fast alles zu Fuß erreichen. Gerne wieder

title: Great experience
text: I only write positive experience reviews and this has to be one of the Nicest hotels that I've stayed at. The 1900's decor was fabulous yet up to par. The bathrooms were the best part of our stay! Front desk Staff is very friendly and helpful. The housekeeping department are talented and quick. Great location and has a full bar! A tad bit pricy but you pay for what you want and it's worth every dollar!

title: Très bon établissement
text:
Super hôtel que je recommanderai à tout le monde.
Il est très bien situé dans Manhattan
Apres deux passages, je peux dire que les prestations sont toujours assurées. Chambre très propres, personnel répondant présent, si demande il y a, même avant votre séjour, par mail notamment.
Concernant le bruit je n'ai jamais été gênée étant dans des étages élevés. Faites en la demande à la resa :)
J'espère y revenir une troisième fois très vite ;-)

title: Fantastic location for getting around
text: The hotel is in a brilliant location - a short walk to the ESB, Time Square and right near a subway station - so easy to get around. Travelling to/from Newark I was able to get the train to Penn Station and then short taxi journey - the staff were really friendly & helpful at check in and check out. I agree with some of the other comments about the lobby/bar - the large groups of laptop users take up most of the space and it is hard if you want to sit and have a drink. The hotel décor is really modern - from the lobby to the corridors to the rooms. The rooms are fantastic - mine had a SMEG fridge in there - and had a great view - looking over typical Manhattan buildings - I could see the glow of the ESB too - if I'd been a room or two over I'd have had the perfect view. If only this place had a roof terrace!

title: We were dealt an ace....💚
text: The ace hotel New York is situated on the edge of everything, kind friendly staff and our room was amazing, all original 1900s bathroom and yet a modern feel to , chilled out atmosphere and the bar is decent, in the nomad district the hotel is on the border of fifth avenue at one end and Broadway at the other , subway is close by , we would deffo come again, these hotels , Ace,  that is, are special. 👍👍👍🇺🇸
